title: No room at the Inn!
text: Made a reservation for three rooms for three nights beginning 5/8.   Arrived at 6 pm only to be told our reservation was cancelled as they indicated the credit card number was declined when they ran it that morning.   Asked if they had notified me of the declination and they indicated no, they just cancel the reservation.   Asked for a manager, got a rude one, who indicated the same thing and then said they were sold out and couldn't help us.   Checked with credit card company and they had no declinations.   Found a hotel ( Pod Hotel on 42nd) and received email from New Yorker the next morning asking if I want to upgrade my room and it showed my confirmation number!

title: New York, New York for sure
text: Stayed here as part of a Road Scholar program. Good location, historic property. Interesting if you are a Tesla fan. Rooms vary in size and quality. On site restaurant with good food and fair prices for NYC. Very busy lobby. Part of the property is used for college student housing.

title: Sconsigliato
text:
Buona posizione. Unico pregio. 
Colazione da non includere nel soggiorno, ti danno un voucher (a caro prezzo) con una scelta limitata a 3 possibilità (2 molto simili). Senza glutine inesistente. Camera molto piccola, la valigia nemmeno si poteva aprire, solo sul letto. Bagno piccolo con vasca. "Green policy"? Per niente se metti le boccette in plastica dei saponi. Lingua parlata italiano? Falso. Solo inglese e un po di spagnolo. Tassa di 31 euro a notte per servizi non utilizzabili se non per viaggi di lavoro tipo business center. Palestra? Trovato sempre ingresso sbarrato..se ci sarà una prossima volta a NY sicuramente come alloggio sarà altrove.

title: Perfect in so many ways!
text:
Iconic hotel with massive size rooms & views to die for. I can 100% recommend this hotel. Used by virgin cabin crew. I have done a full hotel and room review on YouTube if anyone is interested take a look @vickisworldtravel
Great location in Manhattan. This was my 5th trip to NYC & I would stay at this hotel again. Beds comfortable & great TV channels. We spent 10 nights here and loved the place. Yes it is a very old hotel but it has character. Fridge was freezing and room view of Maddison square garden and Empire State Building was amazing. I was not impressed with TikTok diner but we loved NYCBC New York City bagels Chelsea which was a 8 minute walk & huge choice of food for a great price. We upgraded for an extra $10 per night and it was well worth it. I booked this hotel via Virgin holidays hotels & paid no resort fees.
Lifts fast and ice buckets on each floor. My only negative was the shower head which kept falling down but we managed. Room was cleaned every day and was spotless. I miss NYC already & hope I can visit again soon & stay at this wonderful hotel again.
I have done many reviews on my YouTube channel including restaurants, Walking tours, Go city pass, Cold spring day out via train (also the location for train stations is great).

title: great
text: great service and great location  I would stay here again, if I put in a review I would stay here again that means I am going back and you should stay here

title: Good location but that's about it unfortunately...
text:
Where to start with the New Yorker. First impressions were excellent, a wonderful location and a really impressive reception/lobby area.

Unfortunately that is where the money seems to have stopped. We had a room on the 20th Floor (2042) and when the lift doors opened you could sense a change in quality, carpet was looking tired, along with the doors, walls and paint work.

Our room was really small, despite it being for my 30th birthday there wasn't any "wiggle room" in making the stay memorable.

The room is dated and dusty. Unfortunately the only interactions we had with reception feel on deaf years. The safe to our room wasn't working (needed a new battery, nothing exciting), we called reception and were told that the maintenance man was with someone else but would then come over, as we had just arrived and in a bid to fight off the jet lag we told reception we were going out, they asked was it okay for him to enter the room and fix it when we weren't there to which we agreed. Came back 6 hours later and still not fixed. The money and passports remained in our locked case all weekend. We also called after we noticed a "thumping" noise from the ceiling, this didn't stop, bang, bang, bang, Reception didn't send anyone and this continued over the 3 nights we were there. This was really disheartening after walking over 35 miles in the city we were looking forward to a restful night. This brings me on to the another point... The windows! There is no sound proofing, we were 20 floors up and the beeping and sirens went on throughout the night.

Overall a real tired hotel that I imagine was once really spectacular. Bathroom extractor didn't work, full of dust, faucet leaked when being used and run all down the back of the wall...

Was also told upon checking that a "hold" would be placed on my card for $150, no problem. When I looked at my statement in the airport on the way home they had actually taken over £661 ($800) off of my card, not a hold an actual transaction. This was brought to their attention and a refund was issued and has now been credited to my account (after 4 days, which I am grateful for). But something for you to watch out for.

Upon checkout there is also an additional fee of $5 per bag to keep in their luggage room. That was a shock to me also, I've never had to pay a hotel I've stayed at to keep my bag in their luggage room!

Overall I wouldn't stay again, regardless of cost.

title: Super séjour !
text:
Très bel hôtel, chambres confortables, très bonne literie. 
Personnel professionnel et sympathique. 
Emplacement idéal pour découvrir New York.

title: Small Rooms in Good Location
text:
Room was small but clean; Bathroom was extremely small with no counter space around sink; closet was extremely small...not enough room in closet to open suitcase, etc.
Location is good...on 8th Avenue adjacent to Penn Station and short walk to subway station; storing bags prior to check-in was $5 per bag (I thought that was too expensive).
Staff were very pleasant and attentive.

title: Not worth it compare to price
text: Good Location near to time square, Lots of coffee shop nearby, good room space, nice front desk behaviour.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: Beautiful hotel, staff are all so welcoming and friendly can't knock the standard of service only thing I could say needs improving is the water pressure shower room however at the same time I completely understand the water pressure in the shower not being good as we were on the 28th floor. Even with the water pressure not being good I would still give a 10 out of 10 marking

title: Best Mid-Town Location
text: Outstanding location and staff. A block and a half from the Moynihan Train Hall, near Hudson Yards and a few blocks from the High Line. Additionally The New Yorker is only a fifteen minute walk from the Theater District. We stay for a week each year and are never disappointed!!

title: Fabulous, central hotel
text: Excellent central hotel - cant not fault it - stay here many times over the past 40 years and it always gets better. The price increases too of course but for NYC its still great value. Tik Tok restaurant is also very good value but not owned by the hotel inside. Rooms are clean and comfortable with everything you require. They do charge for left bags which is a downside

title: Iconic, worn out hotel with small rooms
text:
The good news is that it is very quiet, location is great - across from the Garden, next to subway.  Check in was EZ and they had active, people security all the time - reassuring.  

The bad - small rooms - we had a queen sized bed and that made the room smaller (they don't have King beds as none of the room could accommodate them).  Bathroom was from, well, the 30s - you can barely turnaround and there is no shelf space for modern supplies.  

Housekeeping was great - we had nightly service (which you rarely get these days). The staff was wonderful, efficient and very cheerful

All in all a great place to flop into for a weekend - especially if you spend all your time outside of the hotel.

title: Excellent location
text: Excellent location when traveling on Amtrak.  Hotel is one block away from Penn Station and  Madison Square Garden.  Hotel has multiple dining options if you don't want to wander far away for breakfast or dinner.  Hotel is very clean and beds are comfortable but room is very small.    Be prepared for lots of people coming and going in this hotel.

title: Historic Art Deco hotel
text: We stay at the New Yorker every time we visit New York City. Landing at the Moynihan Train Hall at Penn Station, we walk one block north to the historic Art Deco New Yorker. Diana was very pleasant checking in, and our spacious room had three windows looking out at the city! The hotel is spotlessly clean, and the service is excellent. You must acknowledge that this is very much a tourist hotel, and small groups of people waiting to see the town fill the lobby. There is tight security guarding the elevators and leads to a feeling of safety throughout. Another hint: the least expensive rooms are adequate, but quite small. We stayed there one time a few years ago,  and while fine we prefer a larger room. They called the larger rooms "Executives" Try the bar on the first floor, as they make one of the best martinis around!

title: Really nice hotel for the price.
text: The room is centrally located with easy access to public transportation.  A lot of the things we wanted to see were within walking distance.  The hotel is older and shows in the halls but the room was very nice.  The room was kept very clean.  We enjoyed our stay and would return.

title: Soggiorno a NY
text:
Posizione eccellente!
Struttura accogliente con reception h24 e personale gentile.
Camere vecchie ed un po' piccole. Pulizia nella media.

title: New Yorker-close to MSG
text: Super close walk to MSG!  Also close to subway entrances.  Felt very safe there.  Room was nice.  Wasn’t too noisy once we left the lobby.  Elevators were fast.  Every employee was pleasant and helpful.  We chose it for proximity to MSG but I would stay there again even if we weren’t going there.  The price seemed good for NYC.

title: Great Checkin Experience and Accommodated my early check in request.
text: The front desk staff was very helpful.  Muhammed assisted me with getting an early check in so that I could begin my remote work day after a 6a flight from Florida to NYC.  He did not hesitate when I explained my needs and was very helpful even upgrading my room type to accommodate coming in before 9a.  Experiences like this will make The New Yorker my primary hotel stay.

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
Great location for walking & transit.
Staff r really nice.
This is the 3rd time I’ve stayed here.
Beds r really comfy, pillows not so much!
Showers were great!
There’s a lot of young students hanging
around…. so it’s a busy place.
Great location if you’re going to Madison 
Square Garden.🙂

title: Gross!!! (see pictures)
text: it’s disgusting beyond the awful lobby the ancient elevator, the awful corridors… There’s something wrong with the air quality and it stinks like death in here. This is awful and I feel terrible for the cockroaches. It’s amazing that they could charge more than $100 a night. And I specifically asked for a newer renovated room and it’s just disgusting.

title: OK
text: We spent 3 nights at New Yorker.Room was small,with only a view from window of other rooms.It was clean though,bed was comfy but bathroom was very dated and really could do with decorating.As we only slept here it was ok for our needs.No tea or coffee facilties in room but Starbucks and Mc Donalds just across the road so just got our early morning cuppa from them.

title: Beware extra charges
text: We chose this hotel as our flights were cancelled and we arrived v late. Rooms are dated and the shower seemed to have two setting hot or cold! No water or a coffee machine was provided in the room. Our room was a good size with 2 single beds . Beware they do charge $5 each to store each piece of luggage which I think is pretty steep when you have already payed a charge at the hotel. We received nothing extra related to the standard charge unlike some other similar hotels we stayed in whilst in New York .

title: Its best days are behind it.
text:
This hotel is dated and in need of major refurbishment. The room was draughty and road and construction noise from outside was intrusive, even at night, to the point of wondering if a window was open somewhere but it was not. New windows required. 

In colder months you’ll feel a cold draught as soon as the heating kicks off once it has reached temperature.

I was shivering in bed, ask for extra blankets. 

The general area the hotel was based in was shabby and had shady characters around. 

The lobby is nice. But it lacks a bar. Tic toc diner was alright but very warm in there, too warm to enjoy a meal. 

One day we asked staff on a desk at the lobby some general information how to get around and was hit with a relentless sales pitch for a trip even though we told him we had plans that day and we were obviously tired and stressed. He carried on with the pitch despite this!

There is an interesting display of the past of the New Yorker near the fitness gym. It obviously had a grand past, sadly its heyday was in the 1940s-50s and is firmly behind it.

title: Good
text: I stayed at the New Yorker with my son for a week in April. We had great service from Muhammed on reception. The rooms were a decent size for NYC and the hotel is ideally placed for exploring Manhattan. The $300 room deposit was a bit of a shock on arrival but otherwise a good stay.

title: Very close to Penn Station
text: Enjoyable stay at the New Yorker. We used the Tick Tock diner for breakfast a couple of times and loved the food. I feel the facilities fee is a rip off. We only used wifi and I think $30 per night is too much. The same for left luggage at $5 per bag. I've been in hotels in London, Paris, Rome, Madrid and Berlin and have never paid for Internet.

title: Wonderful!!
text:
I figured I would spend a few nights in NYC to round off my trip after staying in Philadelphia. What a place I chose to stay!!

Firstly the train to Penn Station from Philadelphia is so so easy. One stop in Newark then onto NYC. I primarily chose the New Yorker because of it's location and that is clear when you get into Penn Station. The hotel is literally 5 or so mins from the station. I only had one cabin case and a backpack but for those with more bags this is definitely a factor. When you get upstairs on street level .. just wow. MSG right in front of you and you just have to take a moment to soak it all in. Once I did that onto the hotel!

I noticed there were plenty of coffee shops, stores, souvenir shops etc close by which was ideal. Wasn't suprising but it was definitely good to have those options close by. The hotel is signed clearly from the outside. The interior is grand! nice lighting, chandelier. Nice lobby area with plenty of seating. I made my way to the check in desk and was greeted by a lovely gentleman. Really personable, asked me questions about my stay. Based on my answers he was quick to offer more information and useful tips which were greatly appreciated. I was attempting to check in early and was more than happy when a room was offered to me. (It is $25 to guarantee an early check in) but I wanted to shower and chill before attending an event that evening. Everything about my stay was detailed clearly and I made my way to the room. There are attendants stood by the elevators. You need to show your room key before using the elevator. A little touch I really like from a security point of view.

The elevators are easy to use. Certain lifts go to certain floor levels but these are illustrated well. I was up on the 26th floor. I was so excited getting to the room as the receptionist said it was a great view. The corridors look dated however this isn't a knock from me. I liked it. Gave that authentic feel. The directions to the room are good and clear. Again, really important as I have been in some hotels and it's like a maze!.

Got to the room and wow! Firstly .. nice size room. Plenty of room for me as a solo traveller. Chair, desk, nice size TV, safe which was easy to set but the first thing that takes the eye is the view. I was in 2655 and wow. So cool! The shower worked great. I did have a nightmare trying to get the temperature right as there were a few taps lol but I didn't feel strongly enough about it to say to reception. It was just fine. What would have made the room super amazing for me would have been maybe a bottle of water or tea/coffee. On the 2nd day I saw there was a Starbucks in the lobby area so I understand why you wouldn't find tea/coffee facilities in the room.

It's New York. Everything is pretty easy to get to via the subway so location is just amazing. Really close to Times Square too which is where I spent a good bit of time. 

There was a bit of a queue on check out. This was my own fault as I waited until 10.45am and there was a group leaving their bags before me but it moved along quickly and I was able to leave my bags for a bit before an evening flight and enjoy a bit more of the city. ($5 per bag if you wish to leave them for a bit which is more than reasonable to me).

All in all a really enjoyable stay! I will definitely consider staying here again when I'm in NYC again. Been twice now and just love it. My first time I stayed a bit further out of the city but this is a great place to stay. Despite it's location there was no disruption when it came to sleeping and everyone I spoke to was lovely. Thank you to everyone for making my stay a great one!

title: Excellent stay
text: The service was excellent. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable. Everything was great. Would love to stay there again in this iconic hotel the New Yorker. Front desk was extremely friendly and pleasant and was checked in really quickly.

title: Memorable stay at the New Yorker hotel
text: The New Yorker experience is one of a nostalgic remembrance coupled with a warm reception and friendly atmosphere from its staff.  We had a pleasant stay there for the five days.  I was particularly pleased with the Wyndham sales representative, Mr. Dylan Porter, for his personal help and assistance with recommendations for restaurants and insights on the Wyndham experience.  Also staff coordinator, Neida, was very helpful in room arrangements, and outside New York activities.  My overall experience was quite good.  I would go back again on  a future visit.

title: Needs refurbishing
text: This old hotel is in serious need of a full renovation. While the lobby was quite nice, the room we had was drafty (ask for an extra blanket) and the shower is not pressured balanced so you get an occasional blast of very hot water.  The hallways are shabby.  On the plus side, the location is excellent , the room was clean and staff are pleasant.

title: Top hotel
text: Mooi hotel, goede ligging. Heel centraal, metro om de hoek. Heerlijke bedden. Vriendelijk personeel.

title: Mediocre
text:
The hotel is mediocre at best. We had a double room, with a queen bed and "metro view". 
The room was very dated and small. Not enough room for two large suitcases. 
As soon as we walked in there was a gail blowing through the windows, which a struggled to shut. A drawer from the desk wouldn't shut and would slide open on its own (a small thing but annoying)
You could hear everything outside and in the adjacent rooms. It was so noisy, worst nights sleep we've had on our travels. 
The bathroom was functional, but dated. The TV was prehistoric.
We stayed in several hotels on our travels and this was the worst. 
The only good things; the staff were pleasant and the entrance to the hotel was nice.

title: If I could give it a zero I would
text:
Travelled all across America and this was by far the worst hotel. Rooms are dated and very basic. Walls and windows are very thin so you can hear all the noise from the busy roads along with people in other rooms.

They also have the cheek to try and get you to go to a timeshare talk. Safe to say the this has tainted my view of the Wyndham and won’t be staying in one again. Ridiculous resort tax and then also charging you to hold your bags. 

Not sure how people are finding many positives with this place. Luckily we spent a lot of time exploring the city 

Think you could find a nicer hostel!

title: Beautiful hotel with superb staff
text:
I loved my stay at the New Yorker and so did my daughter. The hotel was a beautiful old building with a lot of art deco styling in the reception area and in the rooms . The history of the building was also amazing as they had a small museum type area for the hotel , with loads of history and information. The staff were very professional and courteous all the time . I have to give a special mention to the staff at the reception desk who helped me . My daughter and myself arrived about 8pm to check in , so I asked for the two rooms to be together but because it was late they were unable to do so . They told me it would be sorted the next day  and it was ,with the minimum of fuss . The lady who I spoke to on the second day even went up to the 28th floor to personally check the room was ready for me , what an amazing service. The hotel is really central and was a brilliant base for our adventures in New  York , putting everything within walking distance. I loved my stay at the New Yorker and can’t recommend it highly enough ! 
If you are looking for a brand new shiny dull characterless hotel then it’s not for you . If you are looking for a beautiful old building full of history and character then you have to stay at the New Yorker , it’s a must

title: Amazing Place
text:
Loved this place! So friendly & helpful! Close to everything! Yes it's outdated to some, but we loved it! I will definitely be coming back! 

Staff where amazing & tourist tax wasn't bad at all, most places charge a fortune & we got out deposit back within 7 days! 

Thank you for making mine & my son's 1st experience of new york amazing!

title: Run for Your life- Worst hotel experience ever!
text:
This is the worst hotel experience we ever had- no wonder Nikola Tesla died there and his papers vanished. We arrived on April 11- for a 3 night stay for 2 rooms- both were upgraded to executive to make sure we had good rooms- and prepaid. The hotel is in a horrible part of New York- with shady people lurking in front of the hotel and inside the lobby. The only nice thing about the hotel was the lobby- a historic part. everything else- the elevators, rooms, the service it was beyond words horrible. We also paid more than 400$ per night per room. We stayed exactly 15 minutes- asked the reception and the lady at the reception was clueless- did not even ask whether she could make the stay more enjoyable- try to find another room etc. she just said but you just checked in- and you are checking out!! 
Not a single word- why are you leaving? Are you not satisfied- is there anything we can do for you? nothing. 
We went to Park Lane- stayed there at the same price, in a great room, nice environment. 
If you value your money, a bit of comfort and do not want to pay so much for a horrible hotel- do not bother staying here.

title: Very happy experience for a first timer in New York
text:
As an adult family of 4 from Dublin, this hotel was perfect location for all our sightseeing days in New York. Right beside Penn Station for coming off the train from Newark Airport. 
All staff are very friendly and courteous from check in, security and house keeping.
Rooms were spotless, functional and are cleaned daily.
I would have no hesitation to stay here again.

title: Hotel Art Déco sublime si on aime cet Art
text:
Hotel Art Deco a fuir si on aime pas l'Art Déco sinon un véritable bonheur.
Cet hôtel mythique est placé à un endroit stratégique proche de quasiment tout (à 5 minutes de la High Line, devant le Madison square Garden et tant d'autres choses.
Le personnel est vraiment au petit soin et vivement que toutes les chambres soient modernisées

title: Great Location
text: The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Penn Train station, and Madison Square Garden. So, great location. The room was about the smallest room I have ever stayed in, and I have been to Tokyo and Europe! It was clean. The shower was very dated, and the temperature fluctuated during the shower which was annoying. The staff was incredibly friendly.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: I did enjoy staying in the New Yorker, rooms were big, clean, all the services and amenities work well, great location,

title: Very well-located, beautiful hotel and nice staff
text: The hotel is beautiful, we had a great view and the staff is always nice. The only thing that we did not like is that they charge you extra for safe keeping your luggage (5 dollars per item) before check-in and after check-out. But other than that it is a great hotel and the location is excellent.

title: The New Yorker nails it once again!
text:
We stayed at the New Yorker again this week, and from the reservation process to check out, they exceeded all expectations.  But I'd have to say that the front desk check in experience was where the New Yorker really stepped up and delivered.  "Samira" was simply wonderful. There are not enough words to express how much she made a difference in our stay, right from the start.  What a way to be welcomed back to NYC! Honestly, she was perhaps the most qualified, professional, courteous, amiable and helpful person I've ever encountered when visiting NYC. Samira went out of her way to make us feel welcome, offered helpful suggestions when asked, instinctively offered a late check out option, and really made the entire check in a fantastic and memorable experience.  Such a  beautiful and genuine person- she truly is a gem!  I will also say that the rest of the on site staff were all quite kind, and greeted us warmly as we came and went throughout our stay.  And I can't forget to mention 'Shine', who patiently guided me through the reservation process a few weeks back. Great sense of humor and very helpful!

Rooms:
Both rooms were on the 38th floor, with one overlooking 8th Street, and the other at the back of the building, with views of the river and countless skyscrapers.  Both came with a spacious balcony, which offered a breathtaking view of that famous NYC skyline, Madison Square Garden, The Empire State building and more.  The rooms were clean, well lit and with a perfect layout featuring two baths, a separate bedroom, dining table for 6, small fridge, open seating area, and a large patio.  

Parking
We used Spot Hero to book a parking spot right around the corner on 33rd.  (next to the Olivia).  This enabled us to get in and out of New York in record time, and probably saved a nice chunk of change in the process.  I'd highly recommend doing this whenever you're looking for a place to park in the city.  

Other:
If you are staying in Mid-Town, it's going to be more expensive than elsewhere.  But despite the costs (and yes, those pesky 'resort fees' or whatever they're calling them do apply here), you will get your money's worth at the New Yorker.   The location can't be beat, and the Staff are just fantastic. 

Downside: Not much to complain about here.  I will say that their 'price match' process leaves much to be desired, and when trying to get some clarity from their  customer care person online, I felt like I was being given the run around.  Next time, I don't think I'll bother.

title: Location, location, location
text: Location is as great as it gets, clean and secure hotel. The emploies are very helpfull and the check in and check out takes less than a minute. Subway stations all around the hotel as well as restaurants. Time square is 5 minutes walking distance away or one subway station.

title: Loved our stay here
text: Really enjoyed the trip and the hotel was nice and clean. Came here with my family to visit the city and it was in a good location that was close to many things and had a subway stop right outside. I would recommend as our stay was nice and the staff were very kind.

title: Beautiful Hotel. Surprisingly affordable.  Close to everything.
text: Beautiful restoration of an iconic NYC hotel. Close to the Javitz convention center. Comfortable and affordable. Fantastic city views. Friendly staff. I'll go back on my next trip.  Self park is available (I didn't use it). Security made sure only guests could access the elevator.  One of the best hotel stays in a long time.

title: Beautiful building great staff
text:
Beautiful art deco hotel. I can’t imagine what It was like back in the day. But it’s tired. It needs restoration not another coat of pain. 
Individual staff was amazing, doorman, housekeeping and front desk are truly the backbone of the hotel

title: Perfect Place for a Tesla-themed Birthday Trip!
text: Even for someone not obsessed with Nikola Tesla, this was an amazing choice for our NYC stay. The location was within walking distance from so many fun places, and the subway was VERY convenient from here. We felt like we could be just about anywhere in 20 minutes! There are several Tesla-related sites nearby, and I appreciated the historical exhibit in the lower lobby as well as the plaques and photo collage at Tesla's room, honoring his presence there and his accomplishments. We felt very comfortable during our stay, and the room was a good mix of cozy and spacious. The views from our windows on the upper floors were spectacular! The restaurants on-site (we visited the diner and the Italian place) were not only convenient, but also incredibly tasty. Everyone was so pleasant and helpful at every step of the way. We will ABSOLUTELY be back!

title: Definitely worth checking out!
text: Room was on the smaller side, but not any smaller than most NY hotel rooms, but we enjoyed everything about the hotel. It is an older building, but the lobby is beautiful and the rooms are decorated to give it a more modern feel. The staff is very friendly and helpful, there is a layer of security at the elevators (you have to show your room card key to get past them), and best of all it's kitty corner to Penn Station, so getting around NYC is incredibly easy.

title: SCAM: facility fee
text:
The hotel is OK and very well located, but they have a scam. They charge an extra cost called "facility fee" US$ 29,00 per night and don't make ir clear when you book it in Booking.com.

I strongly advice to choose another hotel that doesn't do that. Search for hotel that don't charge the infamous "facility fee" or at least be aware that the room will cost much more than it show on Booking.com

title: struttura comoda
text: Posizione ottima, la metro è proprio fuori dalla struttura, il Madison Square Gardene la Penn Station ad 1 minuto e l'Empire a 10minuti a piedi. Personale gentilissimo e molto preparato. La camera spaziosa, silenziosa e pulita ma i mobili sono un po' datati, il bagno va rinfrescato, non c'è un bollitore e nemmeno un frigobar.

title: Fantastic Staff, Huge rooms
text:
The staff here rules, location is within throwing distance of MSG and Penn Station, and the attached restaurants are fantastic. My 2 double bed room had 2 bathrooms and closets.

Ideal if you are driving in, as it's very easily accessible from the Lincoln Tunnel, parking is pretty simple as well.

title: A destination, not just a hotel.
text: I love this hotel, it has style and character, great staff, a great coffee shop, and it feels like New York, rather than any hotel in any city. Coming from the UK, it feels like a foreign destination and an event. The authentic decor does not detract from great service, and a really comfortable room. This was our third visit and we would come back again if visiting NY

title: 7 night stay in NYC
text: Friendly helpful staff.Accomodated us with a fridge in the room for my Wifes Eye drops which was sent up immediately.housekeeping excellent.Handy to amenities as in an excellent location in NYC.Good value for the money Comfortable bed and excellent TV in room

title: Great location but outdated rooms.
text:
Had great expectations from a marquee Wyndham property but the rooms were a big disappointment. Basic amenities are missing like a coffee maker, water bottles, soap dish to keep soap bar, the window had a leak so cold air was seaping in. Even the bathroom has very old and dated tiles, toilet and tub. 

The front desk staff is really good and the location is very good easy walk to many attractions including Times Square and right next to penn train station.

title: Good stay at The New Yorker.
text: Was a bit worried as some reviews were not good. However this hotel was good for our stay. It is  conveniently situated near Penn station and walkable to many popular sites. We had a 2 double room and room was huge , had a great view.of empire State building from window behind one of the beds, we were on floor 33. Beds were so comfortable . Plenty of sockets. Beds made and room cleaned every day. Liked there was someone on lifts so only people staying at the hotel had access to floors with rooms. Staff friendly and helpful. Think it's maybe a 3 star rather than a 4 . However was cheaper than some.of the alternatives near by. I would be happy to stay again.

title: Not Satisfied
text:
Trash left in guest room on check in
Key card had to be fixed daily to get into room. 
Outside noise was intrustive and made it hard to sleep. Outside the hotel was dirty and not kept up. 
Hot water was spotty and would go from burning hot to ice cold

title: A great value and great staff
text: A great location for an enjoyable midtown experience in NYC.  The walk from Penn Station was especially convenient.  It's also only a few blocks from Hudson Yards.  Staff were excellent and the rooms were clean.  However, the dimly lit hallways were a bit unsettling.

title: Family trip to NYC
text: This is such a cute and clean hotel so conveniently located next to Penn station. My husband and I are traveling with our ten month old and we’re nervous about the sleeping arrangement as she’s not sleeping in a crib or through the night. The only room they had available was a queen size bed and we were hoping for a possible upgrade. Upon arrival the front desk staff was so kind and said they were sold out for the room we were hoping to get. Then the manager, Ronald so kindly upgraded us to a room with two separate rooms- a queen bed and a pullout bed as well as a dining table and kitchen. Also a huge bonus the room had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. We appreciate and are so grateful, thank you Ronald. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Gem in the middle of the city
text: A surprise in the middle of the city.  I'm usually an exclusive Marriott person but when this came up at $150 for night (including breakfast) on our company travel site, I couldn't justify the lowest Marriot at $300 more.  Base upon the review I gave it a go and was pleasantly surprised.  Check-in was super amazing, fast, and efficient.  I had my key and on my way in less than five minutes.  The concierge stopped me to explain the benefits they had to offer but I was only there for the night for business so I couldn't use any of the offerings (but might return with family).  The room was a queen and made good use of every inch of space in the room.  it included bed, desk, night stands and a small but ample bathroom.  Breakfast was in the attached Tick Tock diner next store and was your typical NY/NJ diner.  Coffee was very good as was the service. Security was always on duty in the lobby and made it feel safe.  I would recommend this gem to anybody.

title: Very cold rooms
text: Lacked the very basics, no kettle, no fridge!!! Very tired rooms. Windows did not close properly which meant a very cold room. The shower made a horrendous noise every time it was used. The tap also fell off regularly! They even charged to store two suitcases for two hours on our last day. Customer Service generally was very poor. Would never stay here again....avoid if you want a warm comfortable stay

title: Very disappointed definitely not 4*
text:
Very disappointed. No kettle , unless we wanted to pay €25 per night. A kettle to me is basic so was disappointed straight away. 
Rooms are dated and cramped. Not informed of the charges. Was told on arrival the €200 they took from my card was for incidentals. And not getting my refund for 7-10 days is disgraceful. The woman on the desk was extremely rude and spoke to me very smug when I asked for a breakdown of the bill without any explanation.

title: Business
text: We always stay at the New Yorker when coming to the city. Easy access to Times Square, downtown, the Gardens and shopping. If available when I come to the city for pleasure I will stay here. Bellhops out front are extremely helpful getting cabs. Both restaurants are delicious.

title: Excellent stay
text: Fantastic room and great front desk experience. Always seen happy faces. Check in was smoother than any other hotels I had been. Very flexible and very helpful in navigating to places for sightseeing which is absolutely outside the purview of the hotel staff. I will keep going to this hotel again and recommend others to go as well .

title: Bien!
text:
Nous avons la Métro double avec vue.
C’est petit mais très bien. Le lit fait plus double que queen… mais super confortable quoiqu’il n’y avait pas de couverture d’extra et que nous avons du en demander. Bien localisé, c’est propre et bien sécurisé, ça vaut la qualité et le prix. La vue est correct, mais c’est pas éblouissant je trouve. Ça reste que pour le prix et l’endroit, ça vaut la peine!

title: Super viaje
text: Todo estaba perfecto hotel muy agradable cerca de todos ( snack , comercios , metro …etc … ) buenas vistas de las habitaciones y gracias a José de la recepción bellísima persona con buenos consejos y siempre atento a que todos estén bien gracias

title: Très moyen mais bien situé
text:
Bel hôtel vue de l’exterieur, mais une fois dedans ce n’est plus pareil. Loin d’être un 4*.  Vieillot, manque de couleurs et de lumières ( besoin d’un gros franchissement ). Mériterait un très fort rafraîchissement, manque de diplomatie et patience des Réceptionnistes. Dès qu’on leur demande une explication sur la facture, ils soufflent. Heureusement que tous ne sont pas comme ça.
Très bien situé, tout juste à côté de madison square Garden et t une bouche de métro à l’angle. 
Le garde bagage est de 5$ par valise une honte
Pour un  hôtel 4*

title: So Disappointing
text:
From the outside this looks the great hotel it probably once was and when you enter it looks smart.
The only good thing other than that was the staff greeting you before you entered the lifts who were friendly and made you feel welcome.
That's were the good stuff ends !
The corridors are tired and dated but that does not matter if your room is ok however on entering it look tired and dated too !
The bed was so uncomfortable and the bedding itchy.
The shower was poor as was the sink and they both needed major refurbishment.
It was one of the worst stays I have experienced and it was no use complaining as the staff were inundated with complaints.
We were chatting with some Virgin Airways staff who were staying there and asked them if they had better rooms and they hated staying there too so it was not just our room.
The only other good thing is the location which is good and made things walkable but we just did not want to go back on a night.
How to spoil a stay in New York then book a room here as we have stayed in a number of hotels in the city and this is the worse.

title: No
text: I was disappointed in my very tiny small room even by NYC standards.  The lighting was terrible, hallway walls were grimy, hallway and room carpeting were outdated and frayed.  Hotel needs a very serious upgrade - although lobby was nice.

title: Si trova di meglio
text: Camera piccola, pulizia all'arrarrivo poca ma posizione ottima. Troverete shampoo, balsamo, crema corpo e 2 saponettine per doccia e mani. Asciugacapelli professionale ma senza diffusore (portatevene uno universale), ferro e asse da stiro. Vi forniscono 2 cuscini a testa comodissimi come il letto che anche se è un Queen size è perfetto per 2 persone di corporatura normale. La cosa più scomoda è il soffione fisso in alto nella vasca, difficile lavarsi le parti "basse", americani, è ora di aggiornarsi!

title: Fun in New York City
text: A great place to stay. Friendly staff, a clean and tidy room serviced daily. Good diner on site but no breakfast options offered at Check-in. Close to 34th and Penn Stations, a block away from Macy's, in sight of The Empire State, a great hotel with character, history and good staff.

title: Un hotel para conocer
text:
Hospedarse en este hotel es hospedarse en la mega ciudad que supo ser Nueva York.
Si buscas modernidad no es el lugar, pero si querés algo histórico y pintoresco es ideal.
Es un hotel enorme, pero muy enorme entonces esto hace que sea impersonal, el lobby tiene mucha vida más allá de las habitaciones entonces te piden ver las credenciales cada vez antes de subir a la habitación, hay mucha seguridad. Te cobran todo, pero todo, dejar las valijas, entrar antes todo. Pero… todo funciona.
En nuestro caso, nos dieron una habitación que estaba rota, perdía agua y como compensación nos pasaron a la suit en el último piso y la verdad que fue increíble tenés una vista increíble de la ciudad todos los días. La limpieza es buena. 
La ubicación es excelente, pegado al subte y cerca de todo. 100% recomendado, pero tener en claro esas cosas, es muy grande, muy impersonal y te cobran todo.

title: Amazing
text: The beds are so comfortable and the pillows were soft , the room we stayed in was spacious and clean, most importantly the staff were amazing, loved my stay would stay there again and again ,from the door men to the cleaning staff everyone was so nice and welcoming

title: Perfect weekend getaway!
text: Beautiful hotel! Was able to check in early, the room was clean, the view from our window was awesome, and overall very affordable. Wifi worked perfect. Shower pressure was great too. Location is also so convenient for touristy stuff. Would stay here again for sure :)

title: Mohammed is amazing!!
text: Our arrival at the New Yorker was seamless and amazing thanks to Mohammed! He checked us in flawlessly and even upgraded our room! He is an amazing employee and we will definitely be back because of him! The room was clean and gorgeous and the staff was great! Love the New Yorker and will certainly be back! Thanks Mohammed!

title: Bien placé
text:
L’hôtel est bien situé. Proximité commerces transport etc..
Bien accueilli, personnel aimable et disponible 
Seul bémol, aucun Rangement dans la salle de bain. Impossible de posé ses affaires. Pas très pratique

title: Great
text: The room was very smaller of our expectation, but over all, the service was great, there is a 24 hours restaurant in the hotel and it is less expensive of the other hotel of manhanttan. Over all we are satisfied.

title: The price not worthy
Excelente ubicación
text:
La mejor ubicación, todo queda cerca o con posibilidades del metro. 
El hotel tiene buena apariencia, la cama muy comoda.  Los elevadores son rápidos, tiene buenas vistas y negocios estratégicos al rededor.

title: The New Yorker
text:
Lovely hotel, great location. We stayed here for 4 nights in a metro view 2 double room, we had a view of the edge, rooms are small but very clean and we had a lovely modern bathroom with walk in shower, we also had a small fridge and coffee machine with coffee pods. All staff were very friendly, easy check in we paid $50 per night deposit, then on checkout they take taxes and resort fee ($33 per night) out of your deposit on check out and repay the difference onto your card.
Tick tock diner open 24hrs , lovely Italian with nice bar. Wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again .

title: Surprisingly small room but it's what we needed!
text: All the pillows have different firmness levels. That's something I appreciate. The location can't be beat tbh. It was a super small room but all we did was sleep in there haha. It was an amazing and easy stay. I will definitely be coming back to this place. It pays to be a rewards member as well! Housekeeping came around every day and changed our sheets. It was lovely. Wonderful.

title: Easy walk from the train
text: I always stay here when I'm in New York. It's so close to the train station, I can easily take the train into the city and then walk to the hotel, even with luggage. Walking distance to plenty of restaurants. Plus, this is where Nikola Tesla used to live, which always makes me feel like a part of history.

title: Have Appropriate Expectations.
text:
I love staying at this hotel but it may not suit everyone. The bathrooms are cramped and do not have a fan. The beds are on the small side- I would describe them as a full size rather than a Queen size. The rooms do not have a coffee maker or fridge. Like most hotels in the Times Square area, there is a destination fee. 

Nevertheless I find the location to be unbeatable and as a Wyndham Rewards member I have always been treated very well by the staff with room upgrades and late check outs.

title: Fantastico
text: Hotel "barroco", con un ambiente de la epoca, realmente recomendable, la ubicacion es perfecta, para poder caminar a todos lados, las habitaciones que tienen vista son maravillosas, al estar a un costado del metro es muy fácil moverse, y es fácil llegar desde el JFK

title: Beware of the ridiculous resort fees for literally NOTHING
text: Location is great - and that’s about it.  They charge a ridiculous resort fee of $33 per night for literally NOTHING - no coffee making facilities in room or a fridge or even a bottle of water.  This ‘fee’ doesn’t even cover luggage storage (which is free in almost every other hotel, where you just tip). Nope - this hotel charges $5 PER BAG and they have the cheek to display a notice that tips are accepted.  As ‘charming and old style art deco’ the hotel is its now very tired.  There’s plenty of great hotels for less around the area where you even get breakfast inc (and free luggage storage) who also don’t charge ridiculous resort fees.  Beware!!

title: Best customer service
text: We were helped by Mohammed at the front desk. AMAZING service! He made sure we were so comfortable, early check in, let us upgrade our room, even called to check to make sure the room for our comfort needs. If I could give Mohammed the five stars I would. Thank you so much!

title: A great base for a NYC trip (especially if you're arriving through Newark)
text: This was built to be a grand hotel, and the lobby and lifts show this. We were amazed by the price of some rooms - and they're small and a bit worn. But clean, fixed up and a great base for a city visit. Caution - like many other hotels, they have a 'service charge', which added $33 to the room price. Still a great deal, though!

title: New Yorker
text: Great Art Deco hotel with lots of history. Great location along from 34th street near Macys department store. Penn Station is located across the road.  You can get the Long Island Railroad to a lot of places.

title: Excellente localisation. Excellent rapport qualité prix
text: Excellent hôtel très bien situé à côté de la gare Penn Station, coin 34 rue et 8e avenue. 15 minutes de marche de Times Square, 40 de Central Park, 10 minutes du High Line,  Hôtel avec style et personnalité, très propre, bon service.  Upgrade de chambre à rabais.  Bon resto de style “diner” (Tick Toc) ouvert presque 24 heures.  Déjà 2 visites et fortement recommandé.

title: The New Yorker
text:
Had a great stay at the New Yorker hotel!   Staff friendly, housekeeping very helpful and our room was an excellent size and was very clean.
Excellent location to most places and a great diner & Italian on site which we used several times & found the service excellent.

title: Very nice place to stay
text: Very nice staff. Well located, near subway and parking. Nice big room with view. Starbucks and a restaurant in the hotel. Security staff at the elevator checking upon. The beds are comfortable. Bathroom small and minimal but very clean. Will go back.

title: The New Yorker was wonderful!
text: Our stay at The New Yorker was wonderful! Convenient location, clean hotel and staff was friendly. We loved that it had 3 restaurants in the hotel and one of which is open 24/7. We also loved that near the elevators they had staff Checking to make sure only guest were going inside. We would definitely recommend this hotel and we will be staying here on our next trip to NYC.

title: NYC means staying at the New Yorker.
text:
We love staying at the New Yorker Hotel.  The location is excellent and it is always very clean.  The concierge is helpful, the doormen are awesome.  Over all, I choose this hotel for our NYC visits .  I cannot say anything about the restaurants but the bar has a bartender, Francisco who is very nice and makes a wonderful drink.  
The housekeeping staff are also fantastic!

title: Love The New Yorker
text: It is the best hotel in NYC and excellent centrally located in the heart of Manahatan. Close to the train station and walking to Times Sqaure and all NYC entertainment sites. I have tried different hotels in NYC and the New Yorker is trully the best of the best....

title: Dated room
text:
Stayed 24/25 Feb in standard room, my rating is lowish because;-
When lift doors opened at our floor noted dated decor and carpet.
Room was not as fresh as pictures, again carpet and room dated.
No Water or kettle offered in room. Reception hires coffee machine and pods for $50 a day.
Windows drafty.
Bed comfy

title: RV
text:
Appearance perfect. Location perfect. Personnel kind and supportive, well dressed. Services great everywhere.                                                                                             
Notifications of some significant guests from the history, like Nikola Tesla, and others, could be mentioned in the lobby, or pamphlets provided, so new guests could understand how exclusive this property is.

title: New York
text: Absolutely fantastic hotel. Staff are brilliant diner next door Starbucks in the lobby Penn station on the doorstep subway 45 seconds away walk more. Could you ask for in Manhattan . Rooms were brilliant views were spectacular. The art deco of the whole building is stunning.

title: Perfect location, Low quality rooms.
text:
Positives:

- location is perfect and very central!
- tick tock diner is wonderful!
- subway station outside hotel
- some of the staff are very polite (Dylan
Went above and beyond)

Negatives:

- Bathroom is still stuck in the 1950’s
- $250 dollar charge for the room is too much
- personal experience / door broke and we got stuck in the room for 45 minutes (wasn’t fun)

title: Weekend Break
text: Great location. Very welcoming & pleasant staff. We got upgraded so room we had was on top floor with the most amazing views of the Empire State Building, room in its day would have been fabulous very dated but quirky!

title: Great experience
text: Great location: close to Time square, Madison Square garden..but not too much which saved us time to park / reduce the noise. Friendly staff: security at each step of the hotel, however very friendly and helpful. Good value: the room is much bigger (took the beds option) than most boutique hotels for the same price.

title: Amazing hotel, loved it
text: Really great location. We upgraded our room on arrival. An extra $25 per night, but absolutely worth it for the view of the Empire State building. Penn Station is really close so great forgetting around the rooms are not modern but are fit in with the era and very clean. We left them.

title: Trato lamentable.
text:
Mi pareja y yo nos alojamos una semana en este hotel,  sufrimos un trato lamentable por parte de la seguridad, que una mañana temprano, yo todavía en la cama nos aporrean la puerta de malas maneras, entra un hombre de seguridad diciendo que se estaba fumando, lo cual era mentira yo todavía dormía (y jamás lo haría en un lugar que está prohibido) y mi marido no es fumador, después de revisar todo y comprobar  que no había nada, saca fotos a mis cosas personales donde había una cajetilla de tabaco, ( no sé hasta qué punto es legal) y hablándonos muy mal, sin importarle que yo estuviera en la cama semi desnuda, tapándome como podía con la sabana y mi marido en ropa interior... Una situación surrealista, en la que nos sentimos humillados y que atento contra nuestra intimidad.
Mi marido bajo hablar con el jefe de seguidad para poner una reclamación por tal hecho. Y aún estamos esperando una disculpa. 
Lo que está claro es que jamás volveré ni recomendare un hotel que trata así a sus clientes.

title: Non ho parole!
text:
Camera piccola angusta e piena di spifferi. Bagno piccolo. Vasca inutilizzabile.
Colazione inclassificabile una bevanda ed un pezzo da colazione (muffin scelto sempre dalla cameriera). Non ci tornerei mai.

title: Our stay at the New Yorker
text:
We arrived at the hotel on 20th February and as we walked in we thought the hotel looked well maintained (reminded us of the wellington where we had stayed in 2019). We walked to the queue for reception but we didn't have to wait long to wait as a very pleasant member of staff pulled us to the desk at the side and checked us in. We had room 2263 on 22nd floor. As we left check in we were accosted by time share staff who even when told we weren't interested kept insisting on you get  xyz for free if you come. Really who has travelled that far to go sit in a time share presentation!? 

Eventually we got to the elevators and we were directed to the right hand side ones which serve floors 20 - 40. Once the doors opened on the 22nd floor we were quite shocked by the state of the corridors, clearly downstairs had been maintained but everywhere else not so much! We got to our room and we once again were shocked by the room, it was the smallest room we've ever had in New York with very little room for our luggage. I understand that the hotel is old and art deco but it really needs some tlc (the carpets look particularly scruffy) and the bathroom had mismatched tiles on the floor where some had previously been replaced and peeling/chipped paint where the wall tiles had been painted over. The shower wasn't great but it did work, the taps were very stiff as they're pretty old and the actual shower head couldn't be moved. We did manage to get hot water but some days it took 15 minutes for it to come through. The bed was very comfortable and the housekeeping staff were always about cleaning. However, in saying that there was rubbish under the bench opposite the elevator the day we arrived and it stayed there for 2 days before it was cleaned and removed to the point I actually took a photo of it. 

After a week we had gotten used to the hotel and it had grown on us to a point we did say we would potentially return again next year. However, we have since changed our minds and I will explain why. We checked out on 27th February at 12 which we had no issues doing but upon trying to use the restroom one member of staff questioned if my husband was a guest so he explained and he spoke to someone else who gave my husband a card to access the restroom but when I went he questioned me and told me to go downstairs in the tick tock diner. It clearly states on the door into the diner that toilets are for paying diner customers only which I wasn't, I then noticed that he gave a pass to another lady who had also checked out to use the hotel restrooms so why wasn't I able to use them? My husband went and asked at guest relations and the lady there said I needed to get the pass off the man who had told me no so she then said to use the other restaurant's toilet which I reluctantly did. I'm sorry but this is ridiculous, I have paid to stay at the hotel and just wanted to use the restroom before leaving for the airport.

The location is excellent, lots of restaurants etc nearby and the subway is easily accessible.

title: Lovely hotel
text: Stayed here Feb 24. Hotel location is excellent. Rooms were small and a little dated. Room was cleaned every day. Towels were changed daily whether you left them on the floor or hung them up. Bathtub with shower was amazing. Room had a safe, iron and ironing board, hairdryer, complimentary toiletries. Entry to the lift area was controlled by security which made the place feel safe. Staff were polite and friendly. My only complaint would be that there was no complimentary tea/coffee or water in the hotel.

title: Super awesome stay
text: We really enjoyed the ambience of the TickTock diner and the Trattoria restaurants at the hotel.  Jose the doorman was super friendly.  We took his advice to take the train from Penn station to Newark instead of a cab and so glad we did. Our room on 7th floor was super quiet and although it was a queen bed we slept well (king was NA). We would certainly stay here again.

title: Would use again.
text: Queen room with view on 20th floor. Clean and tidy room. Central location. Subway and LIRR next door. Great breakfast restaurant. Ease of access to the city and plenty of shops and restaurants around. easy to get around from. Close to Madison Square Gardens and other key points.

title: Clean and comfortable, friendly staff
text: Overall we had a lovely stay. Comfortable, rooms cleaned daily and staff friendly and helpful. Ideal for a few nights stay in New York. Location is excellent for seeing all the main attractions. However 8th avenue seems to have a drug problem which was a bit concerning and intimidating for us at times but it didn’t impact on the safety of the hotel.

title: Excellent Location
text:
Enjoyed my stay. Location, room and staff all great. TICK TOCK food was worst we had in trip. Close to subway, shops and restaurants. Macys 5 mins away .

Room was cosy, warm and clean. Bathroom needs a little love

title: Wyndham is a nickel and dimer- DO NOT STAY HERE!!
text:
The Wyndham policies are so off-putting that I recommend choosing a different hotel. I certainly won't return here until the Wyndham's lease of the hotel ends, which I heard is soon.

Firstly, there is no coffee pot in the room and if you want one the hotel will charge you $25 a day for the coffee pot.  I suspect they took the coffee pots out of each hotel room as part of the agreement of Starbucks to rent space in the lobby. The Starbucks has very little to offer and I went across the street to the other Starbucks to get the Peppermint Mochas we wanted and they were indeed cheaper than $25. Looking at the website it now will cost you $50 a night to rent a coffee maker!!!!!!!!!!!! (and a one time $30 fee to rent a frig).

Next problem is the upsell when you go to check in and it's before the 4pm check in time.  Clearly, they have many rooms available, and a good hotel will just check you in early, but to make even more money on top of the high prices they tell you your room type is not ready, but you can be upgrade for $40 more a night and get a room right away.  I listened to this same spiel be given to other checking in throughout our stay.

We said no thank you and went to check our bags. Bag check here costs $5 for each bag/backpack.  They also charge a resort fee (over $30 a night) but the bag check is not included in the resort fee it is separate. They charge you another $5 a bag when you check out and need to stow bags until leaving.  

Wyndham has also set up two time share desks. One desk has employees hawking free this and that and then I'm sure they hit you with it's free if you listen to our 10 hour time share spiel, but I simply said no thank you when they tried to get our attention as we were going up to our room.

There is not much room to sit in the small lobby that must accommodate the 1,000 guests. Wyndam has a second desk and two chairs in the lobby for their time share nonsense.  When sitting in the lobby I saw an employee ask two guest to move from those two chairs because they were only for time share talks.  There wasn't even an employee sitting at that desk!  Those guests were then forced to stand in the lobby waiting for the rest of their party.

We did appreciate the security and housekeeping staff all were friendly and helpful.

The room was small but adequate.
However, there was only the smallest of glass shelves above the very tiny sink in which you could place a toothbrush and toothpaste and not much else.

I would recommend not staying at the Wyndham.  So disappointed in all the fess the Wyndham is charging here it has really turned me off the hotel brand entirely!!!

title: Fabulous hotel
text: Fabulous hotel, very central for exploring the city, comfortable beds, clean, lovely decor, which is inkeeping with the hotel age. Friendly and professional staff, excellent communication prior to our visit. Hotel felt safe, which is important when travelling with family. Would definitely recommend. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

title: Family break
text: Great location to tour New York. The lobby of hotel is fabulous. The bedrooms however are very small and dated. Stayed here with my husband and daughter for 5 nights in room 1947. 2 small double beds. Nice pillows and bed linen . Very little wardrobe space. Nice bathroom with  good shower. Serviced everyday. Staff were extremely helpful and polite. Lovely coffee dock in lobby. The doormen were great and so helpful. Would definitely stay again if the rooms were updated. Thank you for a fabulous stay.

title: New Yorker thumbs up
text: I love this place: rooms are great (sometimes wityh fantastic view over the Empire State Building or the new Hudson Yard area), staff is friendly (especially for the french speaking persons: Samira or Driss @ the front desk). Good restaurants including one open 24/7 which is convenient when you have jet lag issues.

title: Una excelente experiencia...........
text: Recomiendo este hotel por: su ubicación, cerca de TODO..... acceso a todos los trenes justo en la esquina del edificio (Penn Station), vistas espectaculares desde las habitaciones, restaurante TIK TOK abierto 24 horas con un menú muy variado y muy buenos desayunos, wi fi incluido, un servicio excelente....

title: The new yorker hotel
text:
The Wyndham new yorker is a great hotel in a great location for sightseeing. The staff where fantastic and friendly. They have 3 places to eat in the hotel. 2 fantastic  but avoid the tick tok dinner service and food quality 2 out of 5. 

But would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

title: Tiny rooms and rude reception staff
text:
We arrived at the hotel after travelling for more than 18hrs. We were met with quite a rude welcome. No hello, no how are you? Just a “give me you ID” so I can find your booking” “Give me credit card” the females attitude was unacceptable and should not be front desk staff greeting tired and grumpy guests. 

Further more my room key didn’t work so after going back down 30 levels I was met with the same female who was just as grumpy and made out the key not working was my fault and she requested security to follow me to the room where the key still didn’t work. Security were nice and he went and got a working key. 

The rooms..well they are small, very small. They are also not very clean, dust everywhere and cracked and flaking paint on every wall. The toilet is hard against a wall so at 6ft 5 tall I had to poop side on!! The shower is also very low down and the cold tap made the water hotter. After all these issues we requested a room change. New room same issues so I just accepted it and got on with my holiday. 

Would I stay here again? Definitely not!

title: Lugar con excelente ubicación
text: Lugar con excelente ubicación y si es cierto que la habitación que elegimos era la más barata y por ende la más pequeña, pero uno ni pasa en la habitación, prácticamente nosotros (2 adultos, 2 niños) solo la ocupamos para llegar a dormir.

title: A hotel with lots of history
text: We are staying at the New Yorker at the moment and what a great place it really is. Lots of history if you’re interested in the basement. A lovely diner for breakfast at the TICK TOCK. Very safe as you can’t get through security without your pass. Very close to the main attractions and subway. A great hotel and thanks a lot to the staff

title: New Yorker break
text:
Great hotel, central location. Reception staff were brilliant; really friendly and welcoming. The hotel itself was brilliant. 
The Tik Tok diner which joins the hotel was ok but it be if the staff members we had was rude and made us feel like we were an inconvenience. The lady waitress was amazing and even remembered what we ordered and how we liked our eggs.
Overall I would highly recommend the New Yorker.  Location was perfect, cleanliness was perfect and the rooms were ideal.

title: Great location
text: I gave this hotel 4 stars purely on location, it really is a fabulous location. The hotel is dated, we travelled as a family of 4 and got allocated the smallest room ever, we paid to upgrade to a suite. The two very small double beds were comfortable, as was the sofa bed. For a suite the shower room was tiny, but let's face it - you don't go to NYC to sit in the hotel room. The housekeeping staff were lovely, the room was very clean, you do get asked to show your room key every time you enter the lift area, but I quite like that security measure, the onsite Starbucks was great, the Italian restaurant has a nice bar. Would I recommend the hotel...yes based on location

title: First and Last time
text: Clueless staff, waking me up 2.5 hours before check out with a knock on the door to see if room was vacant to clean. And then tried again 1 hour before check out. Leave me alone when I’m paying to stay.

title: Great location / front desk staff changes stories a lot
text:
I really wish I could give this a 4 or a 5 but we had so much repeated ridiculousness with staff at front desk I just can’t 
The positives: location is amazing 
Staff super friendly / welcoming / helpful
Elevators really effective for as busy and old as the building is 
Cons: It’s a building from 1920’s. First night cold air was literally rushing in through window in bathroom - reported in the morning and was 90% fixed when we returned 
Staff would turn off heat every time they accessed room - made for chilly returns - and one night we didn’t realized it until til I woke up at 3 am room was 50 degrees 
But the biggest pain was the run around I got literally every time I walked up to the front desk 
First it was our room had a “maintenance issue” so they asked us to wait 35 minutes to clean a new room 
When we returned the person literally said the same thing…then a said we must have tried to check in early a noooo it was 5pm
Didn’t get into a room until after 6
Was NOT the room we had booked (view) was told that when he gave us key and said our rate would be adjusted
Checked the next morning and was told by a manager even she can’t adjust rate - so offered to waive res for fee for 1 day???
Basically had to check in every day to be sure we were properly compensated for whatever happened to screw up our room. Then when I checked out I asked for a print out and was
Told the printer was broken they would email it - said I needed it before I left - he disappeared for a bit and came back with a print out . A LOT of unnecessary ridiculousness that was totally unneeded

title: A definite fantastic place.location  location location x
text:
An absolute fantastic hotel.The Location is perfect.
Check in so easy.
There are so many places to eat around here including a bar in the hotel 24 hr restaurant that serves everything and a great steak restaurant that you do need reservations for.
There is Starbucks and McDonald's right across the street and a fabulous Public house AKA Pub with 2 levels a wide variety of beers and drinks and the food is delicious all very well priced Tailors public house , definitely recommend it turn left out the front doors of the hotel and it is one block away on your left .
24 hr security you must show your key before entering into the elevator area.
Our room was good for us small but we made do we were here for 5 days and just need a place to lay out heads as we were out all day on adventures.
Bed very comfortable and bathroom had everything we needed.
Fitness center is great lots of equipment and cardio and a nice business area to print off documents or just use a computer.
We definitely would recommend staying here to all our friends and when we come back we will stay here again .
Very good value for your money

title: Great location, history, service, views and value
text: My belated discovery of New Yorker Hotel has enhanced my relationship to the city (will be returning soon for fifth visit in 18 months). It combines reasonable rates with the rarity that travel writers describe as “a spirit of place.” It continues to reflect NY’s unique jazz age/art deco history, while its authentic renovations offer modern conveniences without gutting uniqueness. I usually arrive by train so love fact it’s one building over from Penn Station, as well as being at the nexus of the key subway lines. It's worth paying a bit more for a view as the hotel's are spectacular. Check-in is easy and flexible, along with great bag check service. I love NY diners and its 24/7 Tick-Tock is the best!

title: Great experience 4 nights at The New Yorker
text:
I have just returned and had a great experience at The New Yorker.
Staff were so helpful and welcoming the lady at check in sorted out a free room upgrade for my daughters birthday she was the kindest lady.
Beds were comfy and the room was clean. This hotel is in a great location and is close to everything with access to Penn station on the doorstep.
We arrived very early and although checkin was not till 4pm they let us check in early.
All in all a great stay for 4 nights I would recommend to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Review
text:
Check in was an issue with my room not being ready, but staff secured me another room which was very good. Clean room and I was impressed as last year I had a room the size of a closet!
Hotel was clean and a good value for the money. Elevators were fast. Hotel does need a good update.

title: Average - Good value
text:
So here's the reality on our stay at The New Yorker Wyndham hotel. Overall, it was just okay, but definitely had some bumps along the way.

Let's start with check-in. The reception vibe? It felt like they were just going through the motions, no real warmth or info about the place. The elevator situation was an experience. Every time we got in, it was like we were being grilled by the lobby staff - with comments such as "We only need to see one room card..." and "the odd nod" Not exactly the friendliest bunch.

But it wasn't all bad news. Big shoutout to the housekeeping staff, they were super friendly and always welcoming for a chat. The rooms where immaculate and fitted with the Art Deco vibes, also loved our city view.

The gym wasn't in use, despite paying the full service tax every day...
So yeah, The New Yorker Wyndham has some good stuff going on, great value, but they've got a lot to learn about hospitality too. Hopefully, they step up their game for the next guests.

title: Overall, not a bad value
text: We went for a brief bday trip for my daughter.  The room was small and simple.  Definitely "historic" (read small, oddly weird to get to, a bit dated, and short).  The bathroom was TINY.  The hotel seemed clean and the bed was comfortable.  We were "upgraded" which meant we went to a higher floor which was quiet.  All in all, not bad but certainly not what I am used to with modern hotels.

title: Fab 4 night stay in NYC
text:
We spent 4 nights here in June 2023, 2 adults and 2 teenagers, the hotel is so central and close to shops and Times Square, The TIK TOK diner next door was one of our favourite haunts and so convenient  for delicious food.
Hotel fabulous and comfortable.

title: The staff need to be friendlier! It would be 4*then
text:
Arrived late at night to a lovely art deco lobby. Great location and easy access from the airport on the air train to Jamaica station then a train to Penn station which is opposite the hotel.  So easy and much cheaper than s taxi!

A real good thing is security, asking to see key cards before you go near the lifts to rooms. 
Great Tik Tok restaurant next door, where the lady who served us was so lovely, and food was great, it’s 24 hour service too. 
There’s a Starbucks/McDonald’s and liberty Bagels across the street which was great for a morning coffee/snack. 
Here’s what spoilt our stay- unfriendly staff at reception, barely cracked a smile. 
When you leave luggage they charge $5 per item, we had small cases and a very light rucksack, which I tied to the top and she charged us €10 as it was classed as 2 pieces. Shocking when you’re a guest at the hotel. I witnessed someone tie theirs with an luggage elastic band and they got away with paying €5. It’s just the principle and not the money for me!
We had a basic standard room with not much view, so don’t expect more than 3* and you won’t be disappointed. The room is small but we had a comfy bed and our shower was powerful and hot. The lift area and corridors are a little dark and dingy but not the end of the world as you do just pass through. 
Would we stay again? Yes but only if it was cheaper than others.
The staff could really make the difference with great customer service, but this was something that was really lacking.
I would have given 4 stars had the staff been friendly.

title: Un excellent hôtel !
text:
Nous avions l'habitude de séjourner a
à l'hôtel Pennsylvania qui a malheureusement été détruit en 2022. Nous n'avons pas perdu au change (au contraire) en découvrant cet hôtel art déco comme je les aime et très bien situé !

title: Highly recommend
text: The ONLY complaint I have is that the shower leaked onto the floor, but housekeeping was very accommodating in making sure we had enough towels to clean the water each day. The staff was always friendly, the rooms were very clean. It felt like a very safe place since you always had to show the room key to get to the elevators.

title: Located right in the heart of NYC
text: The location was superb. Right beside Penn Station which was important. It was within walking distance of Times Square, the High Line, the Empire State and shops eg Macy’s, Old Navy, Target. The rooms were small but very adequate. Very comfy beds, great shower and lots of storage space. Great security so felt very safe. The Tick Tock Diner in the hotel was great. Good food, fast service and reasonably priced. Lobby was spacious so it was good for sitting with friends or to have a coffee. It was possible to leave our luggage on checkout at a cost of $5 a bag so we could make the most of our last day. I would definitely stay at the New Yorker again and would recommend to everyone.

title: NYFW
text:
The hotel was clean, the staff was excellent and Jose C was an awesome staff member to check us in.
They made our hotel stay awesome.The staff that check to make sure we had cards to a room made us feel very safe. Thank you for a wonderful stay

title: Great hotel, rooms very small.
text: We were 4 adults sharing a room. We loved this hotel overall but we had an issue with the room we were given. We were told we were getting an upgrade to an executive room with a view of the Empire State Building. When we went to the room, we could not believe it. We could not swing a cat in it. I understand that space in NYC is a premium, but the room we received was not an executive room, and had a view of the corner of Empire State Building. We had a number of suitcases and had nowhere to store them. We had 4 hangers and 3 drawers for 4 people to share. For health and safety reasons, we had to ask to be moved to a bigger room and thankfully the lovely receptionist was able to accommodate this.

title: Girls Trip with Class!
text: Everything was great from the start. I found it through the internet and booked my room. My son then told me how I could save if I joined the Club Wyndham. I saved so much and my free cancellation from my first reservation was honored easily. The decor, front doorman and porters led to the feeling of populace or the bygone eta of long ago. We were several hours early and was able to valet our bags. I paid a tiny bit more for a room with a view. So worth it!! I was on the 35th floor facing the Empire State Building and more. The restaurants attached were awesome. Especially the Tick Tock.

title: Beautiful, historic hotel in an extremely convenient lolcation
text: Kind and efficient team, room was nice, small but typical NYC. Great location for getting around with the subway and Penn Station right across the street. As a history buff, I really enjoyed the Art eco style and original features of the building. Would stay again.

title: 2 x 2 nights stay
text: We spent two 2 night stays before & after a cruise from New York, it was the perfect base to access all the things we wanted to see & do. We would absolutely stay there again as we loved where it was situated

title: Ok location
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights. On arrival, we were ready to check out, room very dated and small needed alot of work for a 4 star hotel. The worrying sign at check-in was if your room is too small, come back to reception in the morning. The next morning, we decided as we are not planning on being in the room much it will do. The room was sort of clean. Bed sort of comfy think I could have slept anywhere with all the walking we did around New York.  Also the room was cold draft from the window.

Reception was lovely. Really looked the part and found all the staff we dealt with friendly. I did like you had to shoe your key card before you can get in the lifts. 

We only use the cafe on the first morning tick tock very good breakfast. Not far from the hotel was liberty bagels New York we went there most morning would really recommend. And the coffee from madman just up from liberty bagels is really good. 

The hotel is in a great location but wouldnt stay here again. Also a bit disappointed with the facilities charges as only in the hotel about 9 hours a day so not much time to use the facilities.

title: Third time, still a charm.
text:
Always enjoy staying at the New Yorker. They are busy, but efficient. We love the location for getting to shows and other activities. This was our third time here, our second time with a suite. LOVE the suite that gives us extra room to stretch out and visit while leaving the bedroom area for sleeping. 
We have tried all of three restaurants attached at least once. This time was the first for the Italian restaurant. All are very good. The Tick Tock has enormous portions and we could have easily shared two meals.

title: Great location, great room in this Art Deco gem.
text: We had a great experience at this hotel. The location is ideal, and the room that we stayed in was clean, attractive, and as large or larger than other similar hotels, we have stayed in in New York City.
