The Art Deco lobby is beautiful and security is excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City.

title: Worst hotel experience I have ever had.
text: I stayed here with my son and it was absolutely horrible. Our room was actually checked in to another guest. There was No heat in the room and Dirty sheets. Scalding to freezing shower. The rooms window was opened at one point and left open at one point making it too cold to be in. The staff was rude and said “what are you scared if it’s not like someone will climb in through the window.” They gave us a new room and a single night refund.

title: Family outing!
text: Location in the city was phenomenal, access to the subway was perfect! Cherished the historical value of the structure. The hotel had a buzz of activity to it which was nice. Direct access to a restaurant was convenient. All around wonderful trip for me and my daughters to spend some quality time and venture out into the greatest city in the world, highly recommend!

title: New Yorker
text:
Hotel is in a great location, clean and greet staff. 
Room was very outdated and paint was peeling from walls and ceiling. Also a big draft coming from window. Tv has a good variety on Channels, heating was very good and warms the room quick. Bath and shower was fine too.

title: New York Adventures
text: The room was small. The bathroom was very very old where you can see cracks. The shower was also terrible. The bed was comfortable and the view was good. Line reception line was way too long and it was a bit hectic too. All in all, a bad choice unfortunately.

title: Great Location. Accommodations need help.
text: Great location. Right across from Madison Square Garden. Only issue was the size of the room - brutally small. Bathroom was well sized but very small room.  Difficult to move around room once luggage was inside. Staff was helpful and brought us a mini fridge for drink/formula storage.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Booked in to the New Yorker for 4 nights January 27th. After reading reviews on line I was very concerned and had even considered cancelling this hotel but we decided to give it a go. The hotel was great from start to finish. Staff very friendly. Stayed on the 7th floor and our room was spotless and comfortable, it had everything we needed. Would definitely stay there again. Great location, great staff and a great hotel.

title: A great hotel in a superb location
text: A beautiful art deco hotel, rooms were large and spacious and we were permitted to check in early without any additional charge. Both our rooms were clean and beds were comfortable with a good variety of pillow! It is an old hotel so a few areas which are looking a little tired but overall a great hotel in a great location for exploring New York.

title: A pleasant stay for a great price.
text: The New Yorker hotel, though old, is quite nice. Our room was comfortable and we had a great view of the city. We were only there for one night, but had a very good experience. The parking nearby is expensive, so be sure to add that to your budget if you are driving in.

title: Rimborso della cauzione
text:
Si sono presi 360 euro per la cauzione dicendoci che alla fine del nostro soggiorno sarebbero dovuti passare 7/10 giorni lavorativi e ce li avrebbero ridati 
È passato un mese e dei soldi nessuna traccia 
Proviamo a chiamare alla struttura e ci dicono che dobbiamo avere pazienza e aspettare 
Non so credo che se li siano tenuti loro a questo punto

title: Perfect central location!
text:
Firstly, the location of this hotel couldn’t be any better if it tried! 
We stayed for 3 nights 2 adults 2 kids (teenager and toddler) and was perfect for us. 
The staff were incredible and were incredibly helpful. No question was a problem for anyone we encountered.
We checked in a little early but the room was already ready for us.
The hotel do take a returnable deposit but this was no problem to me.
Our room was a good size with two bathrooms, result! Beds were comfy and we all slept well, the tv has great channels including a good selection of kids channels for the toddler.
The bathroom I used was fine but would benefit from a little love. The paintwork on the tiles was chipped etc but still a nice older classic bathroom. 
My toddler doesn’t like showers and this room had 2 full size baths, I was so impressed I had to try the tub myself. When I tell you the water temperature for the tub was 10/10, I mean it! Never been so impressed! I like my baths super hot and this matched home.
The shower didn’t get as nearly as hot but still got to a decent comfortable temperature.
This hotel is across the road from penn station, you can literally get anywhere you need from penn. We were also a stones throw away from Maddison square garden! 
You can walk to Times Square, empire state and the edge from here no problem. 
Food options were plenty, with McDonald’s directly opposite the hotel. 
Everything you can think of food wise is within walking distance.
We took public transport from JFK, starting with the airtrain to Jamaica, then changing to the Long Island rail road (LIRR) which takes you straight to penn station. It’s super easy!
We left our bags at the hotel on the last day, the hotel charge $5 a bag which was no problem.

Overall this hotel is a lovely hotel with the most perfect location and staff!
If the bathroom had been loved a little more I’d have given this hotel 5 stars

title: Una decadencia muy cara
text:
El hotel, que es in ícono histórico de la ciudad, de 1929, no se ha renovado como correspondería. La tarifa
es mucho mayor que la indicada, hasta un 60 por ciento más, debido a una serie de cobros extras inexistentes. Además, por si fuera poco, cobran para dejar las valijas en guarda, como si se tratara de una empresa específica. El baño tenía un inodoro en donde no se podía sentar porque había una pared en ángulo. Sin palabras. Un alojamiento en decadencia total. Muy triste

title: Love The New Yorker Hotel! Must for going to concerts!
text: Very clean and affordable hotel. Staff are very friendly and welcoming. Rooms have thermostats you can control, water pressure is AMAZING and very warm water. Walls for rooms were very thin though, could hear kids screaming next door very clearly slamming doors and running around. Made me self conscious about if I was too loud at certain times. But overall great staff, security, easy check in and check out!

title: Awesome Stay!
text:
Second stay at the New Yorker.  Second great experience!  Will definitely be staying again!
Awesome location!  Have stayed for theater and for events at MSG.  Staff were great about suggesting places to visit and for great restaurants!

title: Kötü bir zincir otel
text: otelin konumu çok merkezi fakat otel genel anlamda kirliydi ve personel yardımcı değildi, bir daha gidersem tercih edeceğim bir otel değil. wyndham otel için kötü bir deneyime sahip olunan bir otel. bavul için ekstra ücret istediler bence istenilmemesi gerekiyor

title: Buen Hotel
text: Excelente ubicación, cerca de todo. Un poco viejo, pero nada de que preocuparse. El personal muy amable y dispuesto a ayudar. Tuvimos problemas con el termostato, sin embargo al hablar a recepción de inmediato mandaron a un técnico y se solucionó.

title: New yorker Hotel stay
text: A great hotel in a great location friendly welcoming staff would recommend to others and would visit again for a third visit disabled rooms are accessible with wet rooms enquire when booking but certainly accommodating of individual need

title: Good for a short break, mainly for the location
text:
We were originally visiting NYC for a gig at Maddison Square Garden (which got cancelled) and this hotel was perfectly placed for that. It was also only £110 a night in January which compared to most other hotels in the city was a bargain. 
Staff on check in were very friendly and the hotel areas were very clean. Our room, 2207, was a standard queen room with a view down to the Hudson. It was an ok size and basic but had a comfy bed and a hot powerful shower which was basically all we needed for our short 3 night stay. 
There was quite a few coat hangers for clothes and many drawers. There were lots of plugs in the room as well as USB slots. There was a small safe and an iron and ironing board in the cupboard. 
There were plenty of towels in the bathroom with shampoo, soap and shower gel. The bathroom was small with no shelf so no space to put your toothbrush etc. The shower curtain worked but my husband is tall so water escaped around the curtain which caused the bathroom floor to be soaking wet after a shower. There was a good hairdryer in the bathroom which could be plugged in anywhere. 
The Tok Tok diner on site was extremely useful being 24/7 and was excellent for any meal.
The location of the hotel is excellent and easy to get to many places on foot in 20 minutes and it is right by the subway and the train station so easy to get around the whole city and out to other States. 
The reason for the 3 stars is that being an iconic hotel in NYC, I expected more. The rooms were quite dated and needed refreshing; although I imagine they would then charge more per night. The lack of shelving in the bathroom wasn't great. A lot of cold came in the windows so we had to have the heating on quite high to counteract it. Being charged $5 per bag no matter what the size to store luggage was a rip off, although I can't remember if other hotels we have stayed at in NYC did the same. 
If you are looking at visiting NYC for your first time, I would find somewhere else, but for a short break it was ok.

title: Wow, what a location!!!
text: Central location in the heart of manhattan. Perfect for getting aground the city with get, local links to the subway. The staff are excellent and knowledgeable about the area and great recommendations on where to go and what to do plus tips on how to use the subway for tourist/1st time users. If you want to know where to go or recommendations on where to eat, keep an eye out for Dylan on the front desk. He’s your man!!

title: Good location
text: Stayed at the New Yorker for  my 40th birthday treat. Check in was not to long , had to supply a card for a $200 facilities fee which we were not too best pleased about. This was taken and we had to contact our holiday supplier when we got home as still not returned to card 14 days later, this was resolved by them and the money was refunded. Not sure what a facility fee covers as we didn’t use anything . We were told we had been upgraded and given a free breakfast voucher which was a nice treat. Walked past a girl trying to sell us “free” tour tickets however I have read that this is a time share. She was very persistent and wouldn’t take no for an answer so just walked off in the end. Security present on entering lifts which made the hotel feel secure. Our room was on the 7th floor, small as expected , in need of updating windows were drafty and whistled which also made it cold in the room. There was a fridge and coffee machine also in the room along with an empty ice bucket . The bathroom was ok , clean and a nice powerful shower. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is across the road from Maddison square gardens and the subway station which we used a lot. Starbucks and McDonald’s across the street if wanting a coffee or snack. Breakfast at the diner was very lovely , service was friendly. Overall good location, in need of a little TLC but was a cheaper hotel in comparison to others.

title: In need of decoration and resort fees very high and unclear
text: Bed super comfortable but room in desperate need of decoration. Clean but out dated as where the halls. One bar man was very rude and a few of the security team where to. Resort fees are very high for a business center and gym I had no desire to use. These are not made clear before you arrive.

title: *Avoid Avoid Avoid*
text: Avoid 100%, this place is unsanitorry. The front of house staff are ignorant and rude. The only decent member of staff we encountered was a Manager named Michael on our second day when we checked out. We were due to stay 5 nights but left on day 2.

title: Avoid!!!! Unsanitary and utterly filthy. We moved to a different hotel!
text:
We had the displeasure of staying in this hotel this month. We came to NYC to celebrate a 40th birthday and had planned to stay for 5 nights. However, we had to check out after just one night. 

The hotel is like a detention centre, not a hotel. The staff are rude, unwelcoming and quite honestly intimidating. 

When we checked in, the staff member barely said hello to us and this was the beginning of the horrendous experience. 

We took the lift to our floor and honestly the hallways were decrepit and dark. Our 11 year old started to cry. In our room, the pull out bed was stained and dirty, the bathroom was filthy. Dated is one thing, this was unsanitary. We had to wear flip flops to shower. 

The security attendant roared across the foyer at us when we arrived back to the hotel at around 10.30pm after a show. He wanted to see our key. Whilst I understand that this is a safety procedure, he proceeded to point at a sign on the wall and was utterly rude.

When I spoke to the manager on duty the following morning when we checked out, he seemed jaded and as though he had heard it all before. He offered no solution. 

We booked a different hotel for the duration.

title: Good value, nice location for MSG, obnoxious charge for storing luggage
text:
We stayed here for an event at Madison Square Garden (across the street). Check-in took about 30 minutes as busloads (literally) of people were arriving to check in at the same time we were. Room was tiny (though we were told we got upgraded from  an even smaller room) and run down, but clean. Price was excellent.
There was a charge for storing luggage ($5 per piece), which I've never encountered before. This money went to the hotel, not the bellhops, so we of course also ended up tipping when we checked out and needed to leave our luggage for a number of hours while we walked around NYC. This seemed sufficiently obnoxious that it's the primary reason I'm writing this review.

title: Nice and comfortable, good location
text: Nice, clean, comfortable rooms in a central location. I would return here if I was ever visiting NYC again. Parts of the hotel need modernising but it's not really a big issue. Good value for a now extortionately expensive city

title: Nice base for new year
text:
Checked into this hotel late in the evening check in was fast and a lady on reception was friendly and helpful. The hotel lobby looks really nice but the rooms themselves are really small. We was on the 22nd floor and the room.consisted of a double bed a bathroom in need of an update and a view of another hotel through the window. 
However we didn't really care about this the guy on the dopr was always super helpful and getting about so easy with the subway right over the road. 
It's within walking distance to the edge and the empire state building and we also walked to and from times square. 
We have been to New york before and used a different hotel and I have to be honest and say it was very similar so I think a stay in the big apple will always include a vintage type room but who cares with so much to explore outside the bed was clean so I cannot complain and I would return in future.

title: Best Hotel Stay in NYC
text: Beautiful Hotel, staff is very accommodating, prime location, clean rooms, great security. We can't wait to come back in the Fall. We spent only 2 nights before leaving this time. Easy access to trains, shops, landmarks and restaurants. Glad we stayed here.

title: Dark and Dirty.  Avoid the room upgrade option.
text: I will not visit this property again.  The room couldn't be any smaller.  The hallways are dark and dirty with carpet taped together.  Prior to arrival I had the option to pay an additional fee for a room upgrade (slightly larger with a city view).  My view was of an alley and the room was much smaller than the pictures online.  The front desk was not helpful in resolving this issue.  The location was good (close to MSG and Penn Station), but not worth the stay at this property.

title: Great location
text: The location was great, the neighborhood was nice and lively, the hotel was only a few minute walk to the train station.  There is a subway stop right at the same corner as the hotel.  Their Tick Tock restaurant was more than adequate (hash browns were not the best tho).  The $5 bag hold service was super useful to keep my suitcase the day I checked out, while I enjoyed the city.

title: Perfect location, great stay; shower for short people
text:
The location was amazing. We exited Penn Station and were looking right at the hotel. It couldn’t have been easier or more convenient. We were early for check-in, but we were allowed to check in anyway. The staff was super friendly and upgraded our room (it was my birthday). The rooms are a bit dated, but immaculately clean and very comfortable. The view was outstanding. We loved security being at the elevators checking key cards. It made us feel very safe and secure. The Tick Tock diner in the lobby was awesome for breakfast or a snack at the end of the day (try the Nutella and banana French toast; your taste buds will thank you). The bag check service was super affordable ($5/bag) and allowed us to spend our last few hours in the city (after checkout time) without our heavy bags. It was an easy walk to Rockefeller Center, Time Square and other tourist attractions, and there’s a CVS and McDonald’s across the street. 

I think the only negative I have is that the bathroom, especially the shower, is not designed for tall people. I’m 6 feet tall, and I had to duck to wash my hair. The rooms are on the small side, but that seems pretty normal in NYC.

title: Not Great!
text:
We spent a significant amount of time dealing with reception staff over a mixup in our reservations and billing. This took up a significant amount of our time and impacted our overall satisfaction with our stay. Upgrades were offered but unavailable, and alternatives were also offered but then unavailable. 
Beds were confortable but very small for 2 adults - doubles only - which impacted on sleep. Some rooms were very noisy - we had one near elevators which made noise all day/nigjt. Also, hotel run down and needs some maintenance doing - walls painted, carpet replaced etc. Secuiety excellent and cleaning staff very helpful. Not great value for maney as we paid $14,000 AUD  over Christmas/New Years  for 10 nights , so with this level of fee would expect hotel to be up to date with maintenance.

title: Clean, Convenient, Great Customer Service
text: This is our 4th stay at The New Yorker. From the moment the courteous doorman welcomes you, to the minute you step into the lobby, you are transported back in time. We love the vibe and layout.  The front desk employees are always professional, very pleasant and will help you with whatever you need.  Yes, the rooms are definitely small, but they are CLEAN!  The beds have always been comfortable.   We have never had one issue staying here. I feel safe having security in the lobby.  The bar is always a good time and I love the convenience of a diner inside the building. We stay here when we come to see Broadway Shows.  The location is convenient, and the rooms are reasonably priced. We'll be back for sure!

title: Lack of communication
text:
Despite emailing the hotel several times since booking 6 months ago. We got no response and even the email address on wnydhams main website is invalid, for this hotel.

They were more interested charging us for early check in and to leave luggage and to upsell us to upgrade room.

Location is great though

title: Excelente
text: Excelente súper recomendado, la ubicación es perfecta porque tiene incluso una estación de metro en la misma cuadra. A dos cuadras del empire state y en la esquina del Madison square garden, personal atento y servicio completo.

title: The New Yorker
text: Great location. Very clean rooms. Great view. It is definitely a hotel that I will visit again. The personnel were very friendly and helpful, it was a real pleasure to be there. The bathroom was outdated but that just added some charm.

title: Family Holiday  Trip
text:
Beautiful nostalgic hotel! 

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay during the holidays - the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful especially with food options! 

Located within walking distance of lots of good shops/sites including Macy’s and Madison Square Gardens. Subway lines are very close by. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Great location, but what a shame - poor service, shoddy accomodation, tired and dirty
text:
Great location but that's where it ended.   

We arrived later than expected due to our flight being cancelled and had to re-route to Barcelona and then onto New York, on arrival late in the night, reception proceeded to tell us that there was a problem with the room, believed there had been a leak (later told our agent they just gave our room away), so after 24 hours of travelling, our two bed family room wasn't availablle and they only had a box room with one bed and our son (15) had to sleep on the floor.  We were asked to vacate in the morning so as could find alternative room so couldn't unpack.  We were promised a refund of the room, which we only spent 7 hours in which the management later renegued on, the Guest Service Manager viewed after the event and we had left for our return to the UK that "service recovery was issued and resolved", I think not Jean Paul Babier.   We asked for a suite for the remainder of the 3 days there, which we were given, but believe me when I say a suite you would expect in any normal hotel is not what you get in The New Yorker, far from it in fact, tiny bathroom, small and tired rooms and took about half an hour for the showever hot water to warm up.  Shockinly poor, great location and within walking distance.  The hotel experience really spoiled our family trip to New York at Christmas, book elsewhere if you can. 1 Star at best.

title: Gem of a Hotel with good rates and close to everything
text: This was my third stay at the New Yorker Hotel. It is centrally located and is in walking distance to Time Square, Broadway, Macy's, Bryant Park, Hudson Yards, Rockefeller Square, Empire State Building..... the list can go on. It is also right across the street from Penn Station which is great for getting to and from the airports and accessing the subway. I have always found all staff from front desk, housekeeping and security to be very friendly and approachable. They are quick to assist such as requesting a blanket, a room issue or information.  The hotel itself is quirky in areas of the room because they have kept true to the hotel's original architecture, room layout and size which is so much part of its charm. The hotel is very clean and well kept and some of the views are spectacular. There is a fabulous little restaurant called the Tick, Tock Diner which serves food 24 hours a day. It is not cheap but the food is great, it's good portions and service is fast which is important if you want to get out and enjoy what New York has to offer.

title: Classic Hotel in a great location
text: The New Yorker has been our go to hotel in New York for several years. Location is perfect for getting to from the train and an easy walk to anything we could want. Mohammad at the front desk made this trip extra special going out of his way to provided everything we asked for and more. We look forward to returning.

title: Bon hôtel
text: Hôtel typique et bon accueil. Les chambres sont propres et bien nettoyées tous les jours. L’hôtel est plutôt bien situé (Empire State building, Macy’s et Madisson square juste à côté ) cependant les salles de bains sont un peu petites

title: Great location, great sleep
text: The hotel is on the dated side but for what we paid for it we were happy enough. Rooms are small and basic but bed is comfy and shower pressure was great which is all we needed as we didn’t spend much time in room. The rooms are in definite need of an upgrade, however it’s your typical old New York hotel. Service from the reception was great. There is a CVS just across the road, completely ideal. Train and sub stations right next door. Would definitely stay again.

title: Family trip to NYC
text:
For the money, the New Yorker is a great option in Midtown Manhattan.   We had four rooms and each one of them were different in terms of what had been renovated or updated, so be aware that the hotel is in the process of updating.  Every room was clean as a whistle and the cleaning staff were always super nice and helpful.   

The staff are what make this hotel.  Everyone was super helpful and nice to deal with.  They all seemed to truly enjoy working at the New Yorker.  Ms Linda H checked us in and could not have been nicer.  She has been in hospitality for 32 years and it showed.  She embodied the positive attitude and friendliness that we received from all the staff.   From the doormen, the cleaning staff, or a random person in the hall, everyone wanted to make sure we were having a good time.  

Overall a great stay.  Good location to easily hit all the hotspots.  NY Diner (and Starbucks) on-site is very good, but plenty of local eateries around.  Subway access could not have been closer ( right outside the front doors).   CVS across the street.  Would stay here again 100%.

title: Mediocre at best
text:
This hotel is a great disappointment. 

The best thing about it is its location; as mentioned by many others, Penn Station is opposite and the subway from there goes all over the city.

The hotel claims to have undergone a programme of refurbishment. I was struggling to identify where. Our room (22nd floor) has not seen any refurbishment for some time and the bathroom was from a different era. It was also very small. The common parts too clearly need some attention.

The lobby of the hotel is small. It is always busy and there are few places to sit. There always seemed to be a queue of people waiting to check-in/check-out/speak to reception. The reception staff were not the most friendly nor helpful and the duty manager was downright rude: when I talked to her about those I described as her 'colleagues', she made it quite clear they were not colleagues but her 'staff'! 

We had trouble on two of the three days we stayed with our keycard for our room. to get them re-programmed, one has to show appropriate ID at reception. But our ID was in the safe in our room: neither of us is in the habit of walking around with our passports. That really sent the hotel into a tizz and we had to be escorted to our room and were watched obtaining our ID and returning to reception. One can appreciate the need for caution and care but perhaps such is the impersonal nature of large hotels with a transient clientele.

The bed was comfortable enough. There was just about sufficient storage in the room. The cleanliness of the room was not as good as I would have expected but neither was it terrible. 

There is a storage facility for luggage but, of course this being New York, there is a charge for it. 

This was my first stay in New York and so I am not really in a position to compare it to other hotels in the city. But comparing it to other hotels in other cities in which I have stayed, there must be better out there. I would not choose to stay here again and cannot recommend it to others.

title: Great hotel perfectly situated
text: The hotel is a piece of history.  We travelled with virgin and stayed here on the reps recommendation,  I’m glad we did.  The hotel has a grand feel and old world charm.  Check in was easy and the lovely reception lady up graded our double double standard to a room with a view and it was fantastic.  The rooms are small but it didn’t matter as we were only there for 5 days and there was only my son and myself.  The rooms are tired and dated and the carpets in rooms and halls need refreshing but the rooms, beds, and towels were spotless and cleaned daily.  My only real criticism is that the bathroom really smelled of sulphur and was really unpleasant on a morning but that maybe the drains?  To me this hotel was perfectly situated,  not too close to the madness of Times Square but still close enough to be able to walk every where,  I would definitely stay here again,  especially with virgin as the covered the resort fees which are over $40 dollars per night which adds a big expense to your trip if your not expecting it.

title: Great location... Nothing else
text:
The New Yorker boasts a fantastic location across the road from Penn Station and just minutes from Times Square and Macy's.

The hotel lobby is accessed via very grand revolving doors or extremely heavy doors which are near impossible if you have luggage and often there is no door person available so will depend on luck if there is assistance or not.

During this stay on numerous occasions there have been significant queues waiting for the front desk to check in and out, Although from my  experience the staff I dealt with were very friendly and welcoming.

Security do check room keys as you enter the Elevators and these are separated by express for higher floors and lower floors, although it's has not been unusual to have long waits at busier times, so allow plenty of time.

On arriving at my room which was almost on top of the elevators **42 , opening the door you literally walk directly into the room, the desk there and with the door open just enough space to place a suitcase between the door and the bed.

The bathroom itself is small and a long but narrow (2" deep)  shelf to place toiletries on.

There are very old bathroom fittings and 4 taps for the bath and shower controls. There is no visible marking of H or C so was unsure when hot water took several minutes to get hot.  The Towels are nothing special and the bath towels very small.

In terms of general space there is a closet and a 3 drawer chest, one side of the bed has a bedside table although as only on one side of the bed it is home to a lamp,telephone and alarm clock.

The overall bed comfort was average, fairly springy and every slight movement the headboard banged against the wall so felt sorry for those in the adjacent room.

There was no particular view from this room, although this didn't worry me as I was on business however if on vacation would have been disappointed.

The cleaning standards unfortunately were poor the bin had not been emptied and had a black bag of Ice in it and there were sweets under the bedside table and the carpet very dusty, with dust and dirt in other areas of the room.

Sleep quality was poor due to the noise, whilst  in a major city you expect external noise but the disturbance was from inside, at 3 AM over a period of 30 minutes there was loud crashing about outside my room, on looking a member of staff was transporting cages of equipment. I politely asked if he could be a bit quieter and rather than apologise he said " I'm just doing my job what do you want me to do ? Carry it?" I noticed he had Ear pods in so said perhaps he couldn't hear how loud he was as listening to the ear pods. Generally very Rude so I then called a manager and thankfully didn't hear any more.

At 8am onwards there was lots of noise in the hall, but being so close to the elevator as and also the door virtually being next to the bed.

Significant noise was from housekeeping and staff, thankfully I carry a "Do not Disturb sign" as lots of door knocking around following by apologies. I Did not have a hotel one in my room so why I was pleased I had my own.

Overall amenities were poor 3 ultra small (30ml)  shampoo/conditioner/lotion and 2 small soaps. No shower gel. ( I rely on these as don't check bags anymore)
There were good amounts of power outlets unusual in older hotels, but no coffee machine in the room ( some work colleagues had one so it's again luck )

Overall I would not recommend this hotel to family or friends.

title: Rude staff!
text: Stay away if you don’t want to be humiliated by these goofy employees! They don’t know how to do their job and on top of that they’ll embarrass you in public around others! Simply because you ask something more than once or tell them it’s their mistake for mixing up 3 guest names about 3 times!!

title: Christmas getaway
text: We went for the Rocketts Christmas show , it was wonderful. Saw many other sites . My grandchildren had a ball. Lots to see, food was very good . I would recommend the New Yorker and stay again. Weather was mostly good .

title: Christmas in NYC
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights over Christmas, the hotel is in a brilliant location with penn street station right outside making it incredibly easy to get around. Close enough to Times Square to walk, but far enough away that the crowds aren’t so big, plenty of bars, stores and eateries around.

Rooms are a little dated, but they were clean, tidy and comfortable, exactly what you need for a stay in the city.

title: Great location, helpful staff, clean room, and reasonable price.
text: Our 2 queen room was clean and comfortable. It was cleaned regularly and early in the day. The staff was friendly, helpful and efficient. The linens were sparkling white and the beds very comfortable.

title: Location 👍🏻 but bedrooms 👎🏿
text: Great location, friendly and welcoming staff but bedrooms decor and facilities shabby and tired! Brown carpet, brown furniture, poorly insulated and heated room and just generally needs a good upgrade.

title: Lovely hotel with great service and beautiful rooms. Location was perfect and security was diligent.
text:
The location, price, room, restaurants and amenities were outstanding. I didn’t realize the history of the hotel until I was there - such a cool history. Also as a woman traveling alone the security process and presence was incredibly comforting. 
I appreciate there were three restaurants to match the atmosphere I needed for that meal. 

The only thing I could ask to improved (in general) would be more gluten free (or even gluten conscious) meal options and snacks - both in the restaurants and at the coffee cart. I can only eat so many salads in 3 days.

title: Ein traum urlaub
text:
Die lage ist ein traum!
Alles zu fuß erreichbar!
Öffentliche verkehrsmittel dirket beim Hotel! 
U- ban , Züge auch zu den flughäfen jfk und newark von dort ohne weite fuß wege direkt erreichbar!
Dank Penn station!
Zum time square 15 min zu fuß ca.
Empire state building 10 min ca.
Hudson yards 10 min ca.
Rockefeller center und 5.Avenue 15-20 min ca.
Auch central Park!!
Usw..
Restaurants , Bars, shopping wie zb. Das Macy's in unmittelbarer umgebung! Und in rauen mengen vorhanden!
Preis natürlich durch lage hoch.

title: Posizione meravigliosa e poco altro
text: 5 stelle per la posizione, 2 per le stanze. La posizione è meravigliosa davanti al MSG, dalla finestra potete vedere diversi building iconici se siete fortunati. La metro è proprio sotto l'hotel con diverse linee. All'interno un diner dove poter mangiare piatti tipici dalla colazione alla cena. Pulizia ok, stanze piccole, bagni anche.

title: Spending our 24th Anniversary in NYC
text: The location was great. Having a restaurant to order food was great as well. We had a wonderful time. Rooms were ok for such a old hotel. The Comic Con was a bonus. We will stay there again. The pillows were soft. The bathroom needs updating.

title: Great hotel experience!
text:
Hotel Location is amazing! The hotel is historic, but still very beautiful! 
The check-in experience was absolutely terrific! The gentleman who checked us in was so helpful and nice! Our room was not quite what we were expecting, so they switched us to a new room the next day, and it was absolutely wonderful! I can’t say enough of how nice everyone was at the New Yorker. I would definitely stay here again! Our new room was on the 29th floor and these were our amazing views! I highly recommend!

title: Perfectly located hotel
text: This was our second stay at The New Yorker Hotel because our last visit was amazing. It is centrally located and a great value. We had a stunning view of The Empire State Building. I don’t think we will stay anywhere else.

title: Charm & Comfort
text: Great hotel for a solo woman traveller. The facility is gracious, artistic, a lovely atmosphere all round. The rooms have old world charm and comfort. I always feel so safe and taken care of here at the New Yorker Hotel as the front doorman and elevator doorman look out for all the guests. Also, you have three dining options within the hotel; The Tick Tock Diner, The Butcher and Banker, and the Trattoria Bianca. All unique venues. This beautiful old hotel still values the lobby experience with comfy chairs and quiet corners to take a moment. The New Yorker still charms me every time I visit.

title: An outdated cubicle
text: Very expensive cubicle! The bathrooms did not have a place to put my personal hygiene products; I had to use the top of the toilet seat. No refrigerator in the room. I could not control the room temperature, so the cold draft blowing in from the window made the room cold.  21st floor. The hotel is old and needs updating.  If you don't care about ambiance, this hotel is centered around the main attractions in Manhattan.

title: Amazing Place! Lots of History! Perfect For NYC stays! Warm welcoming friendly!
text: The place is steeped in history! Iconic Hotel in NYC! Warm welcoming friendly efficient! I love this hotel and will always stay here when I’m in NYC! The exceptional one was Jonan! Upgraded me and made some great offers I could not refuse! He was very accommodating friendly and helpful a real asset to the business! I will definitely be back soon!!!

title: Excellent location and service
text: Just recently visited New York and my 2nd time staying at the New Yorker. The hotel is lovely, our room was spotless and the staff were all very friendly. The location of the hotel is excellent with madison Square Gardens just across the road and times Square just up the street plus a 34th Penn st metro right across the road with access to uptown and downtown. I didn't take any pictures inside the room however here is one of the view we had looking onto The Empire State building.

title: No customer service and not releasing my pre authorised deposit!
text:
Ok good points first, the location. 
Bad points. The hotel is very outdated. The rooms tiny, the shower just spat water at you and was like warm at best. 
Check in staff I dealt with was a lovely guy (didn’t catch his name unfortunately) however we did have to pre authorise a card for a deposit which was not aware of and they would not accept cash.  security staff we came across again all friendly enough. 
Be very wary of the young lady on the desk opposite the check in, we were totally duped into 'free passes' if we gave up 2 hours to go and view another of their hotels I quote 'they just want to show you around there’s a lovely rooftop bar etc rtc' what this actually is is trying to seek you a timeshare and viewing one of their apartment blocks, there was no free champagne as promised, the free passes had lots of ts&cs attached to them that we were not told about and we ended up being stuck there for 2.5 hours! Completely underhand sales tactics when you’re a hotel guest on holiday. 
My other issue is at check out. Woke up tia receipt of $97 dollars for facilities and tax. There were no facilities that we used!
I paid this reluctantly on another card and was promised the pre authorised amount would be returned to my debit card within 3/5 business days.  Ow I have spent hours being passed from pillar to post trying to find out where my money is as it’s still being held, spent £30 in phone calls to the hotel who told me it has been released not now could take a lot longer as overseas ( shouldn’t make a difference at all!) my bank have since told me that they have NOT been instructed by Wyndham to release my money despite the front desk clerk this morning telling me they have. Seems they like to hold onto this to earn interest for the 30 days! 
No email address seems to work to contact them and now cant afford to keep calling the hotel to be left on hold for 10 minutes. 
My 5 th time to New York and most definitely my last. This experience coupled with a few other negative experiences whilst away had left a very sour taste

title: Another great stay at The New Yorker Hotel
text: Stayed at The New Yorker Hotel from 7/12/2023-14/12/2023. This was my second stay at this Hotel, and again it did not disappoint. Special mention to Charmaine  at check-in. Thank you for allocating us room 1911 . The room was spacious for two people, we had two large extremely comfortable beds, we had a closet each, great for storing our stash of shopping. This room also has a view of The Edge. Also a mention to Marguerita from Housekeeping who did a great job! Thank you for helping me to the elevator with my luggage. The Hotel is within easy walking distance to many sightseeing attractions and shops. There are Subway stations very close by also. Overall we had a great stay, and look forward to returning again on our next visit to NYC

title: NYC 12/23 2222
text: NEIDA was amazing. She was helpful in every single way for every aspect of our trip. She offered expertise and advice for our trip and made a reservation for us at the Blue Dog Cafe which was incredible.

title: Dated but well placed if you ignore customer services
text: The hotel is very well located but in need of some updating. My biggest gripe with this place is the awful customer service when something goes wrong. I left something in the safe by accident and spent £40 on phone calls with 4 promises they would ring me back but not one phone call or reply to e-mail. I know they blame Covid but quite frankly it’s a non existent service.

title: ΙΣΤΟΡΙΚΟ ΞΕΝΟΔΟΧΕΙΟ!
text: Ιστορικό ξενοδοχείο, στο κέντρο της πόλης αφού θα νοιώσετε τι βίωνε ο Nikola Tesla, που έμενε εδώ στο δωμάτιο 3327 από το 1933-1943! Δεν συζητάμε για την τοποθεσία στο κέντρο της πόλης. Φαίνεται λαικό ξενοδοχείο, με πολλούς επισκέπτες. Με την άφιξή μας, μας περίμενε μια μεγάλη έκπληξη. Τα παράθυρα έμπαζαν κρύο από παντού, αφού δεν είχαν ανακαινιστεί από πολλά πολλά χρόνια! Σοκ... το κρύο ήταν ανυπόφορο. Ευτυχώς μετά από πολλές οχλήσεις μας άλλαξαν δωμάτιο  και μας πήγαν στο 33ο όροφο, όπου το νέο δωμάτιο ήταν πολύ άνετο, ζεστό και  με θέα  στην 8th avenue! Εμπνέει ασφάλεια με τους ελέγχους στο lobby, ενώ θα βρείτε τα πάντα από θέμα εστίασης, εκτός πρωινού!

title: Not the last time.
text:
Attended NYC for the first time for our daughters 16th birthday between 10-14 December and stayed at the Wyndham New Yorker and have to say the location was ideal. Very close to the subway, which is relatively easy to navigate or alternatively a great place to stay and get your steps up each day. 

As it was our daughters birthday we decided to pay extra for a room on the 40th floor (4006) and we were so glad we did as the view was fantastic. The Empire State Building was right there every time we looked out of our window, as was a brilliant skyline. The rooms are dated but this adds to the delight of an older hotel. Our room had 2 comfy beds, plenty of drawers and wardrobes, 2 TV’s, 1 in a small sitting room and also a decent bathroom. The room was tended to each day of our stay and overall the room and hotel were clean and all staff were friendly and very helpful. 

If we do go back to NYC ( my wife has already said we will be back) then we will definitely stay here again.

title: Terrible never again
text: Breakfast was included but it consisted of one croissant and glass juice nothing else , location good rooms tiny and decor out dated and no tea coffee facility in room either and then they put 185 pound added at end for city tax and use of facilities and there isn’t any facilities there wouldn’t stay again

title: Déception
text:
Connaissant le new yorker depuis 15 ans je ne peux que constater sa dégradation 
Chambre et surtout salle de bain souffrant d'un manque total d'entretien et de rénovation parties communes couloirs ascenseurs en très mauvais état
Il n'y a que l'emplacement d'intéressant
Très déçue de mon sejour

title: Amazing hotel!
text: I cannot, and I mean cannot recommend this hotel enough! We arrived and our room was not quite ready yet so the lovely lady at reception said we could store our bags free of charge. Within 5 mins she advised the room was actually ready so we got our key and headed up to the 40th floor. All I can say is wow! The view from our room was spectacular, comfy bed, comfy pull out sofa and tvs in both the living room and bedroom (we had a queen suite as there were 3 guests). The hotel and rooms are not very modern but I wouldn’t say it’s a bad thing, it felt like the hotel had some history! They even have a little “museum” about the history of the hotel one floor below the lobby.  The tik tok diner adjoined to the hotel is amazing as well, we had breakfast there every day and sometimes even popped in for a night cap as it’s 24 hours. They have a steakhouse and Italian restaurant too but unfortunately we didn’t get to try this time. We will definitely be back!

title: Good place to stay near times square
text: The hotel itself is a little dated but the location is excellent, next to penn street station and about a 20 min walk from time square.  The beds are really comfy and the pillows are great.  Bathroom a bit dated too but shower was powerful. Overall a good place to stay for the money and would go back.

title: Good hotel for what you need
text: I went on the 7th to 11th December 23 to New York for the 1st time and stayed at the New Yorker hotel in midtown Manhatten - room was small but it had a comfy bed with nice pillows -  running hot water for shower and bath - TV - phone and wardrobe and drawers it catered for what we needed the room for as you only need it to sleep in - who goes to NYC to spend a lot of time in the hotel room - the staff were very pleasant and helpful - you have access to the tick tock diner and a steak place as well - LOCATION is brilliant very central and subway just across the road to get you further afield or if your not good with walking loads - If i was to ever go again to NYC I would be more than happy to return to this hotel again

title: NY review
text: not the best hotel in the city.  paid a fortune for a 3 star suite. there was not even a box of tissues in the suite.  the balcony that was feature in the website look nothing like it was. There was nothing to sit outside it was bare.  why offer a balcony suite when you could not even see the city.

title: Bad hotel
text:
Gross room that hasn’t been updated for 40 years, with furniture that reminds me of my grandmothers house.

Smells like formaldehyde and it gave me a headache.

I would not recommend it - there are much better and more modern hotels in New York City..

Grade C+

title: Small, cosy & clean. Perfect location :)
text:
We’ve just returned.
Honestly, initially I was horrified about how small the room was.
(We’d been years ago & stayed at the Manhattan at Times Square & the rooms were sooo big but the reviews had gone rapidly downhill.)
Anyway, we were upgraded to a slightly bigger room the next day free of charge & with a view of the Hudson.
Still small but slightly better & less noise than the night before.
Anyway, as the days went by, I really started to appreciate the hotel.
It is small & a bit outdated, but the rooms are so clean and comfortable & the staff are really friendly.
The Queen bed was smaller than I’d expected, however I’ve never slept in a bed as comfortable & as soon as my head hit the pillow after a long day walking and sightseeing, I was out for the count. 
And we decided for the length of time we spent in the room it’s absolutely fine.
Location wise it’s fantastic. 
Penn Station right outside, which was brilliant for transport links.
We are at the tick tock diner once & that was lovely too. 
I would definitely recommend this hotel :)

title: Great place to stay just steps away from Madison Square Garden and shopping!
text:
If you are looking for a hotel to stay at near Madison Square Garden and within walking distance to all shopping, then The New Yorker is the place. We have stayed here twice now to attend concerts! No driving or car services needed! Just exit MSG and you are a one minute walk to the hotel! 
Very convienent to shopping at Macy’s in Herald Square and a 30 minute walk to Time Square and Rockerfella Center! You get to these places by walking as it is the fastest way! 

The hotel is older but brings you back to the good old days of NYC and the art deco times! Similar to the Empire State Building. If you want a room that is updated, stay on the executive level as these rooms have been updated.

Had a small issues with hot water, but Chamoagne at the front desk took care of us right away! Champagne offered excellent customer service and was so kind and friendly. She truly seemed to love her job, that says a lot for the hotel itself.

title: Won't return much nicer hotels
text:
Hotel is in a great location but needs some serious money spent on it.
Very dated and tiny rooms/ bed's/ bathroom is tiny.
We were part of a tour group we didn't have to pay the extra fees many mention.
We were on the 7th floor facing 8th Street OMG the noise from the traffic outside is bad. Woke us several times.
This was our 4th visit to New York and I wouldn't stay here again unless it's updated big time.
We had breakfast included in the tick tock dinner next door. But you can only choose from 3 dishes. No gluten free available. Tiny orange juice. Need to get this sorted why not just give everyone a voucher to spend x dollars a day and let them decide what they want from the menu?

Location is good.
We left a tip each day for the room cleaners and they left us a sweet note each day to say thank you. 😍

title: Solicitan un depósito adicional que nunca devuelven
text: Estuve en el hotel del 28 de noviembre al 1 de diciembre. Al ingresar solicitan un depósito adicional afirmando que es "por posibles daños". El depósito es alto, son 50 dólares por cada noche, afirman que lo devolverán en el momento de finalizar la estancia pero esto no es cierto. Cuando fui a realizar el check out ya después dijeron que NUNCA lo devuelven el día de la salida sino que una semana después lo retornan a la tarjeta de crédito con la que se realizó el pago... solicité algun soporte por escrito de que iban a realizar el reembolso o algo que me lo certificara y dijeron que NO PODIAN HACERLO porque esto era un depósito (casi me dicen que una donacion) y de hecho no aparece en la factura ni en otro comprobante. Ya ha pasado más de una semana y como era de esperarse no lo devolvieron, en conclusión se lo roban.

title: Very dated, in urgent need of refurbishment.
text:
My wife and I stayed here in July for 5 nights. We traveled from the UK and at the time of looking the price of hotel rooms in NYC had gone sky high. The New Yorker was still expensive and being iconic we thought we would give it a go.

As others have said the rooms are tiny, I’ve been to NYC before so was expecting this but this really was small, the room smelt stale or of mould. We went and asked to be moved and to be fair they showed us about 5 other rooms but they all had a smell and also things wrong with them.

The decor is very tired, paint peeling or yellowing. Wallpaper torn, tiles cracked in the tiny bathroom. Overall it was pretty bad but the staff are friendly and the location is decent. 

The hallways and lift areas are also pretty dark and reminded me of a scene out of a scary movie.

It didn’t really spoil our trip as we were out all the time and only came back to change and shower from a day of sightseeing to going out for the evening and then obviously sleeping. 

I wouldn’t stay here again, this place could be amazing if they spent some money on the place. 

I wish now I had spent another £300 a £500 and stayed somewhere a bit more relaxing.

title: Crabby and shabby
text: Front desk staff and front line staff very curt and exhibited extremely poor customer service, everyone seems crabby.  The hotel is in desperate need of a remodel and refresh it is shabby at best.  The food in the Tick Tock diner was terrible.  Only redeeming factor was location.

title: Great location, tired rooms but superbly clean and overall great hotel.
text: Really great stay. Rooms are tired but immaculately clean. We were on 25th floor and in a room to side off 8th ave. Noisy due to location and windows drafts and not well sound proofed. But heating system was great and shower fabulous. We were booked into a double double but the reception gave us a suite which was great as we had 2 bathrooms and a little lounge area and fridge. Useful as from UK and up early most mornings!! Great location for everything. Staff lovely. Would stay again.

title: Disorganised check in & failing to give customers deposits back
text: Hotel in a good area and lovely decor in entrance . Very poor check in service , arrived at around 7pm after a long flight & room not ready , check in supposed to he available from 4pm . Had to hang around with young kids , bearing in mind we had been up over 24 hours due to time difference. When we finally did get to check in after about another 1 and half hours we were given “the only room available” which was shabby and dated. 2 young American lads that were stood in the queue next to me who had also been left waiting for a room were spoken to by the manager and given an upgraded family suite for the inconvenience! Didn’t seem fair at all . Then paid the £150 refundable room deposit which we told would be refunded on checkout and takes about 7 days to show in bank , we have been home 2 weeks now and deposit still showing as pending so the funds not available to me. I contacted the hotel by email and they replied that the deposit had been returned at there end and would he another 3 days going into my bank . Spoke to bank several times and it still pending so hotel hasn’t actioned it and there is nothing that the bank can do until the hotel either action it or it has been pending for 30 days. Emailed the hotel numerous times again and sent screen shots etc but they now ignoring me and not responding to me. Definitely would not recommend and won’t be staying again . Much nicer hotels for the money in New York

title: Facility Fee Rip Off
text:
BEWARE! The New Yorker A Wyndham Hotel tells you on its website, 'Free Wifi'! It is not! You appear to pay for this and other 'normal' hotel services in their contentious 'facility fee'.

First the only good bit, the staff are by and large polite, welcoming and extremely helpful. 

Arrived late evening after a long transatlantic flight and even longer journey from the airport to find our room had no complimentary tea or coffee! Dreadful, never been in a hotel like this before!

The downside, although a comfortable room, sadly the decor, both in the room & generally, is looking very down at heel and in need of, at least, a coat of paint. The Art Deco, must have looked wonderful when new, but it probably hasn't seen a paintbrush since. The room window, although sealed, let a gale force draught through which was cold enough to keep milk from spoiling on the window sill.

But be AWARE the moment you book in you are charged a 'facility fee' for each night per person, we paid $300 for 6 days and we were told this will be refunded 7-10 days after our visit. It is unclear what the facility fee covers, or perhaps it is a stealth tax. We're still waiting for repayment of the balance! Spoilt what would have been a memorable holiday, we'll spend our money in Europe in future. Shame of you.

title: Save your money- stay ANYWHERE else
text: This was hands-down the grossest hotel I’ve stayed at in many years. The lobby is well appointed, but that is where it ends. The hallways are dilapidated, run-down, and reminiscent of a prison. The rooms are small, but that is to be expected in NYC. I can even look past the paper-thin walls and cardboard-like bedding. Unfortunately, I can’t overlook the gross bathrooms, dirty rooms, and poorly sealed windows. The ancient pedestal sinks leave no space for toiletry storage. The leaking toilet left puddles in the minute bathroom, the lack of an exhaust fan made belongings slide off of the tiny glass shelf over the sink while the shower steamed up the bathroom. The worst part, was the burns you get periodically during your shower as the temperature oscillates between freezing and scalding hot without warning. In speaking to several colleagues who also stayed here, they experienced the same issues. Do yourself a favor and stay ANYWHERE else!

title: Close to everything
text: The hotel is perfect for attending events at Madison Square Garden. Great restaurants, 3 in the hotel, for every meal need. Great deli behind hotel if you want chasms. The history of building this hotel is amazing.

title: Avoid giving your card details
text: Whilst the hotel was average, with decor and cleanliness in general, it had the best beds, shower and ultimately in an amazing location.  We have just got back and despite having a zero balance on our invoice on check out, they have not only yet to return our room deposit, but they have charged us £98 for something???  We are unable to contact anyone and it now appears that the hotel does this more often than not!

title: Excellent Staff
text:
The hotel is absolutely what one should expect.  Everything is clean, the mattresses are in excellent condition, the staff is courteous and friendly.  

We happened to be there on a sold-out weekend.  Check-in was delayed as our room was being prepared.  The staff was aware of the inconvenience and made up for it even though we were not complaining.  The service of the staff in every area was excellent.

title: Awful
text: I don’t know who is giving this place good reviews but wow, it’s truly awful. Dirty, tiny rooms that we couldn’t even move around in once we had our two pieces of luggage inside. Upgraded to city view to stare directly into an apartment building across the street. The photos on the website are incredibly deceiving in every way. Yes, it does say city view may vary but to pay extra to stare at the side of a building? Shady business practice there. I would tell everyone to steer clear of this hotel.

title: Great Hotel location in Manhattan
text: Great location near Penn Station for access to and from JFK airport, and in and around Manhattan. I used the fitness facility every day - nice size and variety of equipment. My first room experienced a high noice level from the street. Front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating in changing us to a more preferable room location. Would definitely stay at The New Yorker again!

title: KISS CONCERT AND TOURIST STUFF
text: where do i start , from the time we checked in to the time we left had a great experience. the front desk host Samira coudnt have been more pleasant. any questions she answered with a smile and a great laugh, great asset to your company. even the doorman and security people were helpful and great energy, would reccomend this place to anybody, great location and plenty to do in area. went to Madison square gardens for concert , 10 minute walk from hotel, we will be back to see samira's smile and laugh

title: Over price old and crappy
text:
Over priced, old, (needs renovation). I paid 850USD/night and they do not even provide bottled water in the room. Hair dryer is broken, walls are dirty, linens are torn, rooms are smallest I’ve seen for a while. They left half used conditioner in the bathroom, windows are so old the all the noise is in the room even on 30th floor. 
Gym is lousy with decade old machines.

title: Mini Vacation in NYC
text: The New Yorker Hotel was the best selection for me during my stay. Very conveniently located to the theater district and public transportation, especially the Amtrak Penn Station. Highly recommended. The room was very comfortable and clean.

title: Grand lady of New York, past her best ?
text: The New Yorker is ideally situated near 34th street to visit Empire State Building, Macy's, Madison Square Garden and the Highline. Convenient for Penn Station as well. Although impressive on the outside, inside, the hotel is looking tired. Our room was very small, without the view that was confirmed on our reservation. Bathroom was so small it was not possible to close the door whilst sat on the toilet. Reception staff very helpful in resolving our issue. We were disappointed to be charged for luggage storage on the day of our checkout. Suitable for a short stay, although choose your room well.

title: Wrong “Choice” NYC, Leads to a “Wyn”
text:
Thank you to Mohammed for last minute accommodations for a family traveling with babies. Trip started a disaster and ended with a comfortable stay, amazing food, Helpful staff - Juan is a warm welcome to the bustling lobby! 
Oh - and the terrace view wasn’t bad ;)
Thank you for the saving our days in NYC!

title: Team Naida!
text: We were lucky to have the best customer service person Nadia take care of us, she was very helpful on so many levels. Her dinner recommendation was spot on and she made the reservation for us and bought us dessert!! You don't receive that level of care anywhere these days! The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. The location was perfect, we were 15 minutes from everything you would want for your NYC experience.

title: Thanksgiving stay
text: The NY hotel was clean and comfortable,,, ask about parking close to the hotel with a discount. Hotel is within walking distance to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade, the end portion, ,,we were pleased with our proximity to the parade.

title: New York marathon stay
text:
Stayed here for the New York marathon. In short it’s seen better days, hotel is old and the rooms are showing signs of wear.

I was in floor 22 and the wind was blowing through the old windows, bathroom vey dated.

Having said this the hotel is safe and secure and it’s right in the middle of everywhere you need, comfy bed and lots of food and eating places around. Perfect location.

Reception staff are very abrupt and desk staff try to sell you excursions quite forcefully.

I would revisit but price would have to be right. I did enjoy my stay.

title: Fantastic stay!
text: My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our 2 night stay at The New Yorker during Thanksgiving. Jose at check in was very friendly and we were able to check into our beautiful suite early. From the welcoming staff, to the comfy beds, prime location, delicious diner, gorgeous Art Deco, our visit was great!

title: Great location but definitely not a 4 star hotel
text:
Hotel is definitely not a 4 star, it would be a 3 star at a push. Lobby looks very grand, but corridors and rooms are very dated and are in need of some TLC. We originally booked a Standard Queen Room, when we checked in this room was tiny we could barely fit our suitcases in. We booked through booking.com, so something to be aware of that the pictures look nothing like the room itself! We were very disappointed on arrival and went down to speak to reception. Jonan was fantastic and assisted us in moving to a bigger room after the first night which really made our stay a lot better. Housekeeping seem to ignore the do not disturb signs and still knock and come in even when that is on? Ridiculous that the hotel charge $5 per bag to store luggage after checkout when you pay hundreds already to stay there! 

On the plus side, the hotel is in a fantastic location within walking distance to many of the main attractions and next to Penn Station if you want to jump on the subway.

title: Holiday break
text: Beautiful secure hotel.The staff were excellent from check in to check out.Highly recommended this hotel and situated in great location.There is also a lovely bar downstairs which we really enjoyed in the evenings for a night cap.Will definitely return ❤️

title: Disappointing  customer service
text: We booked into the New Yorker on the 29th Nov on that evening the couple we were traveling with were woken up at 00.15 by the hotel staff banging on their hotel door and then walked into the room while they were in bed telling them they have over stayed . Once they  realised it was a hotel staff error they offered a free breakfast in the tick tock diner . Totally  unacceptable and we will taking the matter further with the head office .   We still have another 6 days at the hotel hopefully no more more  unwanted events.

title: For art deco activists and great downtown situ, everybody must try at least once
text:
Iconoclassic hotel lower West Side with a striking Art Deco reception area, many original features complete with museum downstairs; everybody in the world has stayed here, you are in good company; but this is mass hotel with over 1000 rooms, so quick processing of guests matters;  staff are helpful yet focus on efficiency; always professional. Excellent adjacent 24 hour coffee shop but dont expect health food or oats and fruit; large pastrami sandwiches with lashings of pastrami and eggs is the order of the day. 

Bedrooms vary, some windows are small and need cleaning and a request........please dear collagues at Wyndhams paint the corridors, they are screamng out for TLC., paint peeling

Overall very good, excellent postion to walk to the Village; downtown shops etc

title: ATTEMPTED BREAK IN FROM HOTEL STAFF
text:
DO NOT STAY HERE! - Attempted break in from hotel staff!!!!
Hotel "staff" tried to deliver a receipt at 2a.  They claimed they tried to slide it under the door but they were inserting a key and trying to break in.  The management needs investigated immediately and fired.  Why would there ever be a need to drop off anything at 2a? It's a coverup and I wouldn't be surprised if they aren't robbing customers or worse.

title: Great location
text: The Tick Tock Diner adjoining the New Yorker was great. Wonderful food and great service. New Yorker great service. We had room near lifts which were quite loud at night. The. Beds and pillows were 5 star.

title: Charming Hotel
text: Arrived Monday 27th November with my friend we were met by a lovely gentleman at the front desk called Mohammed who upgraded us to a lovely room with a view of the Empire State Building. Thank you. This is our 2nd time visiting the New Yorker still got the charm.

title: Anniversary break
text: We was lied too about getting are full money back on check out when we checked in .they took 250 off credit card and the man said we would get the full amount back on check out .we didn't. No happy at all

title: Don’t stay here
text:
Window was broken meaning heating kept turning on giving me a headache in the morning. 
Room stunk of paint 
Staff are so unfriendly
And to top it off a member of staff has fraudulently used my card.
The only time I used my credit card was to pay the $350 hold charge on arrival yet I arrive home to a £1500 bill.
A member of staff has clearly committed fraud on my card.
Location of the hotel is perfect but the rooms are disgusting. 
Rooms are so close together and there are high levels of noise. Didn’t get one good night sleep

title: Good hotel
text: Close to main attractions, but far enough away so you are not swamped by tourists in timesquare. It was clean and comfortable and staff were lovely and the resteraunt the tic tok, was excellent food and reasonably priced.

title: Most Pathetic Hospitality Experience.
text:
Stay at this hotel only if this is the last option and you still want to be at a central location. Ancient property with third class amenties. Old property with Old Elevators. Its an Expensive accommodation for small rooms. 

Rooms Lacking basic amenities like tea, coffee maker and not even a small bottle of water adds to the inconvenience. The rooms, despite being small, come with a steep price tag.

Additionally, the hotel imposes steep charges for services such as storing luggage by Concierge ($5 per bag) and late check-outs ($25 per hour). On a positive note, the staff's service is satisfactory.

title: Hotel is a scam
text: Reservations were for a room that was not advertised, and so small that we couldnt even prepare for the local convention, which is the one thing we came to do. The bathroom was dirty on arrival and attempting to sleep at night was a joke. You can clearly hear any noise from all of the adjacent rooms, and we might as well have been sleeping on the sidewalk for how clearly you could hear everything happening on the streets below. When approached the staff simply told us no other rooms were available and that was that. We left a day early just to get out of there and on checkout I was handed a bill for two nights, but my credit card was charged for the full three nights. This hotel is a scam.

title: Best New York hotel experience we have had
text: The New Yorker has a great history and amazing customer service. It has become our home in the city.  The staff are helpful and warm. The building is well appointed and maintained. We stay for business and pleasure. It is an excellent choice in midtown, close to much that Manhattan has to offer and sits next to Penn Station for further travel.

title: Great hotel
text: Lovely hotel. Great location to Empire State Building, edge, Times Square - and the subway station right round the corner to get everywhere else. Friendly staff, clean room, comfortable bed. Would stay again!

title: Ripped off in New York at the New Yorker
text:
Arrived at hotel to be told we had to pay 155 dollars a room even though our paperwork showed we had nothing to pay. They said this was for Wi-Fi,international calls,the gym and conference centre. As we didn’t ask for or use any of these facilities we asked to see the manager. We were promised that the manager would see us at 9.00am the next day. When we went to see the manager we were told he was very busy with an important meeting. We asked 4 times in all to meet the manager but we are still waiting.
If this hotel wants more money for the rooms it should be on the room rate,not dropped on you when you get there. It’s seems to me that the management agree with me and that’s why they would not discuss this with me because they are too embarrassed to defend there policy.
We also booked bed and breakfast, Breakfast was one cup of coffee,one bagel and one small glass of juice. Probably the worst breakfast I’ve ever had at any hotel in my hole life.

title: God awful and nothing more than a money stealing scam
text:
As of right now I’m sitting in the hotel.

Yesterday when we arrived at the hotel, we were charged an additional $400. We knew we were gonna get charged this, so no worries at all. Once we got to the hotel we were surprised to see how dirty the corridors were. In the room you could find an outdated loud bathroom, extremely old television, bad view, and walls as thin as paper. Very hard to sleep throughout the first night because you can literally hear everything. On the second day, I got up and had a shower and found that there’s no shower head and the water just shoots at you hard and fast, very annoying and something they could easily fix. The toilet also makes extensive noise when you flush it, I woke up and needed to use the bathroom and I probably woke up a lot of people with how loud the toilet is. Now it’s the morning of our second day, and we were just charged $530. We haven’t been given a reason on why we were charged this money, they are telling me it has been reversed back into my dads account but it’s not. Even if it is, it’s gonna take a week for it to go back, now we only have $150 left for our holiday, we have two days left, and unfortunately we will most likely be spending the rest of it in this hotel. 

Awful experience, terrible hotel, unhelpful staff.

title: Staffs are not helpful
text: I had water leaking in the shower. The heating was not working either. I asked for my room to be changed. Never heard back from the reception. I don't think that was due to lack of availability of rooms.

title: Great Location/Clean
text: Last time we stayed at this hotel was 10 years ago. It has not changed. Great location with lots of restaurants in the area and close to transportation options. We were only there for one night and there was no hot water for a shower. The heat controls were not readable and you had to guess what the settings were. The shower was not marked with hot and cold labels. The location of the controls to the shower were positioned so that you had to get soaked with cold water when you turned it on.

title: Lovely hotel
text: This hotel was fantastic, a great location to see all of the sites of New York! The foyer of the hotel is amazing and really wows you when you first arrive. The corridors could do with a bit of an update but the rooms were lovely and clean and really comfortable after a long day sightseeing!

title: Rooms badly need an upgrade, amazing location
text: Rooms are very tight, which is no surprise or nothing new for NY. The rooms are quite grubby and in desperate need of renovation. Paint peeling off walls, bits of the bath coming off, exposed pipes in the bathroom. There was no view from our room but we did not pay for an upgrade. The room lacks amenities like a fridge or kettle. The location is amazing, just minutes away from Times Square and Empire State among others. Tick Tock diner on the ground floor is great, subway is only around the corner. The staff are fantastic and when we arrived early they managed to get us checked in two hours early, all staff were great.

title: average
text: Price high rooms average. Location very good. The rooms are very small, dust on the furniture, visible wear and tear, no view from the window. You can hear what is happening in the hallway, sometimes the smell of heated oil/kitchen can be felt in the room. The friendliness of the staff depends on the shift that is working. Overall you can stay but don't expect much.

title: 40th Birthday
text:
Rooms very comfortable and clean but small. Plenty big enough though as only really slept in it as out sightseeing for most of the day. 
Only downside we can think of was there was no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. However this was not a major issue as there is a diner literally next door/part of the hotel. 
Staff always friendly and polite.

title: Amazing location
text:
Hotel was in an amazing location! 10 mins walk to Times Square/ Empire state. We got the Airbus train/subway from JFK to Penn Station which is a 2 minute walk! Thank you to Mohammed who checked us in and was lovely after a lonnggg flight and  made sure we were all settled in our upgraded room! Which had a view of Empire state! Only snag is that you have to put a $200 pound deposit for room which you get back after checking out. I would recommend you have that a side so it doesn’t eat into your spending money! 

Hotel needs a freshen up and looks quite dated but we didn’t spend much time in the hotel/room! 

We would definitely return to this hotel.

title: Great Customer Service & Great location!
text: Thanks Mohammed for you help in getting us all set for the day! The staff is great and helpful answering any questions -- Front Desk, Security, Housekeeping etc are friendly and helpful.  The central location is easy access to anything you want to do!!

title: Elegantly Vintage, Modern & Up to Date
text: We loved it so much we canceled our December reservations at another hotel so we could return to The New Yorker (at double the price!)  The staff is great. Front Desk, Security, Housekeeping…so friendly and welcoming.

title: Perfect Location
text: You couldn’t ask for a more central location to just about any and everything to do in Manhattan.  I’m completely happy with my stay, and will be staying here again. Thanks again to all the staff at the hotel.

title: Great hotel
text: Right in the heart of New York great hotel clean and staff we very welcoming it ideal for the city break when your out exploring all day but need somewhere to get your head down to do it all again the day after

title: Great hotel!
text:
We arrived at the hotel prior to our check in time and the receptionist provided us with a free room upgrade and allowed us early check in for no extra cost.
Our upgraded room wasn't massive but I didn't expect anything more for a city centre hotel, but it did have a view of the empire state building which was a great view! The only small negative was the fact we could hear the people talking in the room next to us. This hotel is an older build so this could not be helped. 
The room was serviced daily and we had extra toiletries and clean towels provided.
The location is very handy to the metro, Penn Station and Moynihan train hall which is exactly what we needed. You're situated within walking distance of times square, empire state building and a few blocks from 5th Av, but again, with a metro across the road you can get anywhere very easily! 
If I ever return to NYC I will definitely consider this hotel and area again!

title: I wish we had love this hotel.
text: This hotel is in desperate need of an update.  Things appear old and dirty especially in the corridors and guest rooms.  Bathroom had horrible whining sound.  Faucet handle fell off.  Smelly.  Not good at all.

title: Deposit Not returned
text: We stayed with at the hotel for four nights. Upon arrival a security deposit was taken out of the account I used to book the room. After checking out, we spoke to a member of staff who ensured us that the deposit would be back in our account in the next 7-10 days. It’s had been over two weeks and we are still waiting for the deposit. I’ve emailed the hotel and I’m still waiting for a reply. It’s very frustrating when you’ve been over charged by €270.

title: Excellent Retro Hotel
text: My wife and I stayed here at the beginning of November and  thoroughly enjoyed our time. On arrival our room was ready and once checked in we had to pay $200 (£165) tax. New York is know for this but I’m not sure why it isn’t included in the cost of the holiday! All the staff were very helpful throughout our stay, not that we needed them much but one thing I did find slightly annoying was as soon as we checked in another team member tried to sell us the city pass tickets. We had ours booked already but I personally found this sales a hassle especially when we tried to walk away and the gentleman continued to try and talk to us. That aside I would gladly stay here again as it was pretty easy to get to most places either by foot or taxi. Brilliant access to Pen Station and Madison Square Gardens.

title: Excellent location
text: Great hotel - the location is fantastic - every staff member we spoke to was friendly couldn’t have asked for better ! Would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again if we return to New York

title: Overnight stay was great.
text: Enjoyed the stay.  Will definitely stay here again.  Enjoyable staff.  Restaurants in the hotel are a definite plus!  And food was yummy.  Room was very spacious and clean.  Security was also a benefit being right in the city.  We walked everywhere from her as it's a great location.  Was a mom & daughter trip to a concert at MSG.

title: My favorite hotel
