text: The bed was so relaxing I always have a good night sleep when I stay here. I also enjoy if I’m hungry I can just go downstairs to the Tik Tock to get a quick bite. I like the security also very tight and efficient it’s a block from the train station so that’s very easy

title: MISLEADING ROOM INFORMATION AND POOR CUSTOMER CARE
text:
Think "The Shining".  The best description of this place is Ugliness.   You arrive and the Lounge is beautiful, especially the chandelier, go to the lift and the nightmare begins: the lifts are noisy which you will hear all night from your room and the corridors are dark, dirty and dated; my wife almost cried because we had just come from the Ritz in New Orleans and the Riggs in Wash. DC.  The people who clean the rooms are noisy.  I booked a room based on the photo on their website (see photos) instead they gave us one that had no similarity (2188) just behind the lift.  The noise was terrible; when I asked, the manager said that they can use any photo they want.  I am sure that here in Europe it would be totally illegal to misrepresent and sell a room under false pretence.  I complained to the kind assistant who gave me room 4008 but I had to pay an extra $100.  A suite, the manager said,  obviously he has never been to a good hotel.  The whole hotel is dirty brown and dark.  By the way, they use the same photos regardless of room type.

What makes me angry is that management (according to them) know every single room in the hotel so why give horrid and noisy rooms to guests knowing very well that they will not sleep because of the noise and that their stay will be ruined.  Those rooms next to lifts should not be rented.  But these people don't care at all and the reason is that although it is a cheap lower class hotel, they are fully booked because of their location, otherwise they would not have any guests.

Jose the porter is the only good thing about this hotel.  By the way, I complained to the CEO of the Wyndham hotels and they kindly asked the hotel to deal with my complaint.  They refunded $50 plus taxes after complaining.  However, NEVER AGAIN.  I should have listened to the Virgin Atlantic crew who told me about the horrid rooms.  I have contacted booking.com to inform them of the misrepresentation and misleading information.

Stay at this place if you have no money, don't care about cleanliness, or small rooms and above all, you are deaf.

title: Fabulous New York hotel
text:
I am travelling to this hotel again tomorrow for the 6th time and am so looking forward to it. 
The hotel is a fabulous location for all your sight seeing, hotel is very clean, staff are very friendly and I am so looking forward to going there again tomorrow.

title: A due passi da Times Square
text:
Come posizione strategica meriterebbe  5 stelle, all’incrocio della 34. ma strada conduce a tutte le migliori attrazioni sia a piedi che con la metropolitana  in max 15 minuti. L’Hotel e’ un continuo fermento di persone che arrivano e partono, molto vintage in quanto e’ stato costruito ad inizio 900 e dall’apparenza mai ristrutturato . Moquette dappertutto che non ti da’ una sensazione di igiene e pulito. I bagni sono molto datati e l’acqua esce sempre tiepida , il che in inverno non e’ il massimo. La camera ha un immenso impianto di ventilazione ed il calore lascia a desiderare. La stessa esce a forte velocità e troppo diretta dando molto fastidio. In compenso
Il servizio di pulizia e cambio della biancheria e’ abbastanza buono. Esistono 4 punti distinti di servizi di ristorazione all’interno che servono anche la clientela che non alloggia in Hotel tutti molto scadenti anche se in perfetta sintonia con la Non qualità’ dell’offerta Newyorkese e carissimi ( un caffè’ Americano che non e’ altro che acqua sporca costa 6 dollari, un breakfast 18/20 ). Dall’aeroporto Kennedy si impiegano dai 60 ai 90 minuti con la navetta  .

title: Comfortable renovation of classic hotel
text: Room was well appointed and not as small as a lot in NYC   Comfortable bed.   Attentative staff.   Would definitely stay there again.   Fast elevators.  Water for shower a bit like warm but otherwise well pleased.

title: Horrible smell in my room
text: My room smelled horrible! I think it was sewer gas smell coming from the bathroom. They tried to cover up the smell with lots of cleaning sprays which only made things worse.  I had a headache by the time I left the next morning.  Also, the bed was sagged and was very lumpy.  I wanted to love this hotel because of the art deco style and the history, but I definitely won't stay here again.

title: Alles gut!
text: Alles top, perfekte Lage,  Diner (gehört glaube ich nicht zum Hotel direkt) war super.   Aufzüge-Wartezeit kann manchmal etwas Zeit kosten. Geht aber. Häufig viel Andrang am Check-In, oft auch Flugbeleiter-Teams (meist Virgin).  Late-CheckOut 50 USD + Taxes.

title: Great location, staff and historic hotel
text: Great team, cool hotel with great food options. Great location in between the theatre district and Times Square. The room was small but very clean.  We had an issue with the tub while visiting but it was handled with speed and professionalism like I haven't really seen at other hotels.  Service was better than a 5 stars! The Art Deco building did not disappoint.

title: Great hotel
text: Having stayed all over New York over the past 20 years this is the only hotel we stay at now , beautiful art deco hotel in a perfect location but the staff here make it special . Nothings too much trouble , tick tick 24 hour diner is great and rooms are very clean and comfortable .

title: Good location. A bit shabby. Beware of “Facility Charges”
text: Great location (just a stone’s throw from the Empire State Building). The hotel, however, is a shadow of its former glorious self and is getting quite shabby now. This could almost have been forgiven because of the adjoining diner (The Tick Tock Diner) which is open 24/7 (very handy when you are on UK time and fancy eating breakfast at 5am New York time!). The reason I would caution against staying at The New Yorker are the hidden charges. When we checked out, we were stung with a bill for over $166 ($33 a day) for “Facility Charges”. These, apparently, cover the use of the WiFi (free in almost all hotels these days), the telephone, the “business centre” and the gym…..none of which we used!  We were not aware of these charges when we booked our room. I can understand an extra charge being made for phone calls, gym usage and using computers in the business centre, but only if one avails oneself of these facilities. It is also unusual to charge for WiFi. As locations go, it is fantastic for exploring New York.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: Would stay here again. PROS: Check-in was easy, Jose helped us with bags and was very helpful with our questions we had about the city and getting around. Housekeeping was also friendly and efficient. Nice to have security checking for key cards in the lobby. Location is great for exploring, subway station on the corner and its just across from Penn Station. Easy to get a cab any time of day. There are 3 restaurants in the building and they were all great, especially Tick Tok Diner. Walk to grocery, CVS, Target, and anything else you might need. CONS: even noisy on the 22nd floor, bring ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. Its an old hotel and could use a little updating. That said, we would definitely stay here again.

title: Mixed feelings
text:
We were advised at check in that we would have to pay 50 dollars per night resort fee despite this being included in our booking! We were there 7 nights! Luckily I had printed everything off to confirm this was included.The lady didn’t seem happy about this. Our first room can only be described as a cupboard!! I know rooms are small In Manhattan but this was absolutely awful! We could barely get the cases in!
I went back to reception to express my disappointment after paying so much for a week and the gentleman was fantastic and moved us straight away with no issue. We had a pleasant enough stay. The hotel is very dated and a bit grubby. Beds were very very comfortable!
Staff were all friendly enough and location was great. Food was over priced and awful in the diner and the Italian restaurant attached just bland and tasteless. We wouldn’t return.

title: Room Full of Raw Sewage Smell
text: A woman came to my door and asked if everything was alright. I told her about the sewage smell coming from my bathroom and she said she'd send someone up to look into it. No one ever came by that I know of. It was so bad it made me nauseous and I had to avoid opening the bathroom door.

title: Lovely venue
text: This was my first trip to New York and the location was perfect.  So close to everything. The wonderful staff made everything so easy too. If I find my way back to new York again,  I'd definitely stay here again

title: Séjour magnifique
text:
Hôtel top proche de toutes commodités. Personnel super, agréable, à l’écoute, qui nous donne de précieux conseils pour que notre séjour se passe au mieux. 
Ceci est mon deuxième séjour dans cet hôtel et nul doutes que j’y retournerais lors de mon prochain voyage à NY

title: Grubby!
text: A very dirty grubby hotel which I would NOT recommend. Our bathroom had toenails on the floor for the entire stay, these were not ours! It is tired looking and dirty. The bedroom was far too small, the beds were 3/4 size so inadequate for adults to share. I kept my flip flops on whenever moving around the room as the carpet was dark brown and seemed dirty. The staff are sullen and not helpful at all. The Wi-Fi is patchy and only worked intermittently in our room. The included breakfast choices are poor but the wait staff in Tick Tock Diner were at least pleasant unlike the door staff and reception staff. We didn’t see any housekeeping staff at all so can’t comment on them apart from them not keeping the hotel clean enough. We stayed here 28 Oct-1 Nov 23 with family and friends.

title: Awful hotel, fabulous location.
text:
Easily the worst hotel I've ever stayed in - but in a fabulous location.
The rooms are tiny and dated, the bathrooms are the same.
The windows are drafty and let all the noise in from a VERY noisy city. Trying to sleep and keep asleep is almost impossible to do.
But by far the worst thing about this hotel is the surcharges.....they charge around 
$32 per day "resort fee" - for what? PLUS - and this is a first for any hotel I've ever stayed in anywhere in the world- they then have the cheek to charge an additional $5 per bag (both large and small) if you leave a bag in their own left baggage department! And that's both before you can check in at 4om and then again when you check out! Unbelievable, so it cost us an additional $40 in total to leave our bags in our own hotel.
The location is great, close to lots of NYC sights but I'd neither consider staying again or recommend this hotel to anyone if you enjoy sleeping and not being ripped off, stay some place 
- any place - else

title: Great location but hotel needs a retouch
text:
The hotel is in a great location with a 15min walk to times square and 5 mins to penn station.
The rooms were OK. Chipped paint in places but didn't affect the stay. 
The only issue we had was how cold it was. We put the heating on but would still wake up shivering throughout the night. I assume it's a listed building so they're limited with what they can do with the windows.
Overall a good stay though

title: Always at great stay at the New Yorker
text: Great location. Nice room. Mohammed at the front desk was very helpful and allowed me to check in early. I've stayed here quite a bit over the past three years and will continue to stay here. As someone traveling alone, I appreciate the security in the lobby.

title: Bonne localisation
text:
Hôtel idéalement situé, avec à proximité le métro, une supérette etc… 
Personnel très accueillant, merci à Eilijah pour sa compréhension, son écoute et sa gentillesse. 

Seul petit bémol je dirais sur cette hôtel, il est vieillissant (moquette ou tapisserie abîmée etc….), lit King size un peu petit, propreté à revoir vraiment ! 

Les étoiles sont pour Eilijah et la localisation.
Pour le reste ça mérite que 2 étoiles maximum.

title: rude na recepção, bom de cama!
text: Escolher esse hotel significa não se importar com o atendimento que receberá. Desde a recepção até o 'porteiro' dos elevadores, tudo é ostensivamente controlado. Porém, para quem quer escolher pelo valor que se paga, pode ser uma boa opção.

title: Ubicación inmejorable
text: En general el lugar es bastante sencillo y tal vez las habitaciones necesitan un upgrade en decoración. Pero nada de esto es importante comparado con la gran ubicación del hotel en Manhattan y el fácil acceso a toda la ciudad de Nueva York. Lo recomiendo ampliamente. El staff muy cordial.

title: Mohamed and Linda at front desk were terriffic
text: don't expect much help from the rest of the staff when it comes to what and where or NYC attractions. wear throw away socks to walk on the carpet.  bathroom shelf is so narrow, you need to bring an extension rod to put more than a tooth brush and maybe a hair brush. Don't expect any help from any of the front desk, or the information desk if you want directions on getting to attractions in any manner except "have the bellhop to get you a taxi."  Linda at the front desk know everything and is extremely heloful-bless her.  If she didn't know, she knew how to look it up.  Most everyone else seems like they don't know and don't care and why are you asking them these questions not related to check in, check out, get bill.  There is a desk called "information"  I think it's mean to make you laugh because no one knows nothing, even less than the front desk folks.

title: Awesome!
text: The hotel was secure and very clean. The front desk staff made it simple to check in and upgrade my room. The restaurant and diner attached to the hotel were both awesome. The food was excellent. I will definitely stay here again.

title: A great stay!
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location was brilliant- right next to a subway entrance, opposite Penn station and easy walking distance to Hudson Yards, Times Square and many other attractions. A fantastic view of the Empire State right from the entrance. The staff were all helpful and friendly, our room was lovely - we had two queen beds, a walk in wardrobe, fridge, ironing board, large tv, sofa etc! The beds were incredibly comfortable! We used the Tick Tock diner for a delicious breakfast and the Starbucks kiosk for coffees. We also visited the small exhibition downstairs about the early days of the hotel and Tesla. Would definitely return.

title: Don't stay here
text: Not charming just old.  Paint peeling on walls, dirty vents, dirty soap dish in shower.  Very small.  Update the hotel.  Carpet must be at lease 20 years old.  Maybe a 2 star hotel in a good location.  Water temp in shower randomly went from cold to scaulding.

title: Great location, traditional hotel.
text:
Just spent a 4 night stay in the New Yorker hotel, Fifth Avenue, New York as part of a three centre tour of Washington, Niagara Falls and New York.

Firstly, the hotel commands an excellent location, close to the Empire State building, Times Square, Broadway, the Hudson River piers, the Rockefeller building, Grand Central and Penn Street railway stations. That's a major plus point for this hotel.

It's an old hotel with a decorative grand entrance and certainly has the decor of days gone by (in a good way).

We were on an organised, three centre tour with New York being the final stop so we decided to book a couple of extra days in NY as the basic tour only gave us 1 1/2 days, not long enough in this iconic city for us to do all we wanted.

Our room was small and some of the fittings were a bit dated but it was clean, comfortable and as quiet as you could probably get in the heart of this city.

The room housekeepers visited daily and did a good job cleaning ,tidying and replenishing towels, soaps and shampoos.

There are no tea/coffee facilities in the rooms, no fridge, no microwave but rooms do have a safe. Our shower/bathroom was functional with good pressure, plenty of hot water and simple controls.

Food and drink facilities within the hotel consist of the Tick Tock diner, an Italian restaurant, both adjacent to the hotel lobby plus "Butcher and Banker", a coffee, tea and breakfast stall (croissants, pastries, cakes) in the lobby which is your best bet if you want a quick breakfast and drink. We didn't get to try the Italian restaurant but did use Tick Tock a few times. It's an all American diner, a bit reminiscent of Al's in Happy Days and the food is typical diner fayre. It was hot, tasty, served very quickly and the prices are very reasonable when compared to dining in the 1,000's of places you can go in the city. The staff in Tick Tock were very pleasant and, all in all, the Tick Tock gets a tick from me.

The two guys serving at "Butcher and Banker" breakfast coffee stall, which looks like a portable street stall but is permanently situated in the hotel lobby, were very polite and chirpy, likewise the housekeeping staff, who were most helpful.

Regarding meals, if you didn't want to use the hotel, then every other retail unit along every street and avenue will be some sort of food outlet. It is, in general, all "fast" food but the city has such a divergence of food genres that you just have to try it. The street vendors all add to this to give you even more choice. There are also several Irish style pubs close to the hotel which serve solid "pub grub" food as part of the menu.

Having never stayed in New York City before I cannot compare the New Yorker to others but I would imagine that it stands up against similar priced accommodation which, being in New York, will be expensive.

Now for the things to watch out for.

General.

#1.

Food in New York is, in general, expensive, particular when you add the local taxes and the mandatory tips on. We were advised to budget for 30% more than the menu price to cater for taxes and tips and that soon inflates the overall cost.

#2.

It's difficult to eat healthy. I suggest you put the diet and cholesterol levels to one side during your stay and just enjoy the NY experience.

#3.

It's easy to navigate your way around; all the roads North/South are "Avenues" and all the roads East/West are streets and, in general, they are all sequentially numbered. It's difficult to get lost.

#4.

Just as an aside, for anyone visiting the USA or Canada for the first time, unlike the UK, the supermarkets are not generally licenced (possibly only for beers) so if you want wine or spirits then you have to find a liquor store (they are plentiful in most towns and cities).

Specific to the New Yorker hotel 

#1.

You will need to factor in the "resort tax" or "facilities tax" that is added on to the room rates. This is not unique to the New Yorker as most city hotels apply it, it's just something to budget for. Our taxes were pre paid but, if they weren't, the rate would be about $29 (plus tax) per room per night.

In summary.

 In summary, the New Yorker hotel is good for a stay in the city and we were looked after well by good service staff. The location is ideal for New York visitors, in the middle of Manhattan and is a good base for most of the New York attractions. The adjacent Tick Tock diner serves good, all American, food at as good a price as you will get, save, possibly for the street food and the housekeeping staff are very proficient and helpful. Some of the room fittings are a bit tired but I doubt you will get any better in similar priced hotels in this city.
All in all, it was fine for our lovely New York city stay.

title: Fantastic location
text:
The hotel is in a fantastic location. Yes the rooms and corridors are dated but the beds are comfy for a good night's sleep and the showers are hot. That's all we needed after a full on day of sightseeing.  All the staff are friendly. Rooms are cleaned each day to a good standard. We had an issue with our shower which was quickly dealt with.

Tick Tock Diner was great. Food was good and we could get a  drink to take back to the room at night as there are  no tea and coffee making facilities. There's also a Starbucks kiosk open in the mornings for drinks and breakfast pastries which was great when we had an early start. 
 
I wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again and would recommend it to others.

title: Très bon emplacement
text:
Beau bâtiment de style Art Déco, super bien situé dans Midtown. Proximité du métro et une bonne partie de NY est accessible à pied (Chelsea, Greenwich village, Soho, , Rockfeller Center, Hudson Yards...) avec Time Square à 500 m et à quelques blocs de Macy's et de l'Empire State Building.
Le hall de l'hôtel est pour ma part assez réussi et l'accueil fût agréable.
Par contre, arrivé dans les étages, les plinthes en marbre, la lumière, la couleur grise des murs et les portes brunes donnent un aspect vieillot et sale. Les chambres sont quant à elles très petites (je pense que c'est standard en plein centre de Manhattan), il est difficile d'ouvrir 2 valises et il n'y a pas beaucoup de place dans le placard. Elles sont néanmoins propres mais quand même vieillottes. Il manque un plateau de courtoisie. Le wifi fonctionnait correctement. 
La salle de bain est également petite et vieillotte, mais propre. Pas de place pour ranger 2 trousses de toilettes. Notre lavabo était bouché et on avait un peu froid. Assez rapidement, une couette supplémentaire nous a été fournie et le lavabo réparé.
Enfin, nous avons eu la surprise de recevoir une facture de 27 $/jour (sans compter les taxes) pour facility fee, c'est-à-dire pour les services que l'hôtel propose que vous les utilisiez ou pas. C'est quelque chose dont notre agence de voyage ne nous avait pas parlé et je trouve cela mesquin car cela devrait être compris dans le prix de la chambre. D'autant qu'à côté de cela, si vous voulez laisser un bagage, il vous en coutera 5 $ pour chacun.
Il n'empêche que le séjour fût bon. Très bonne situation et propre, mais peu mieux faire.

title: New Yorker
Good
text:
Iconic Hotel, 
Try to fix the lights of the New Yorker outside. When you're on the EDGE you can see that those lighted letters don't work.
Nicola Tesla stayed in the hotel which is pretty awesome. I do recommend this hotel

title: First Time In NYC! This is the best hotel for you!
text:
First time in NYC!! The staff here was the start of the best trip we ever had! 
Everything is near by!! Trust me!!! … being that it was my first time in NYC, you could see the Empire State Building from the hotel, less than 10 min walk to Times Square! 

Big kuddos to Front Desk - Mohammad!
The housekeeping team is what makes this hotel the cleanest hotel I’ve ever been in! 
Luggage service team is incredible! Security and doorman, thank you for making us feel safe! 
Thank you All!!

title: The New Yorker Hotel - A Classic
text: A stay at The New Yorker Hotel is not only pleasant, it's a chance to experience a piece of New York's hospitality history. You couldn't possible find a more convenient location, and the hotel restaurants are top notch.

title: Out dated
text: Will never ever stay there again. Jackhammer from 10 pm - midnight directly under my window for 3 nights. The shower could not be turned on without getting your arm completely wet. Peeing and pooping had to be done at an angle because bathroom was too small.

title: Fantastic
text:
Great location, view of empire state building. Very friendly, and helpful staff. Lovely food.
Really comfortable and extremely clean. Beside the subway. We really couldn't ask for more. We will be back

title: We had a lovely stay and would definitely come back to stay again
text: The hotel was lovely and the staff were great too. The hotel is very central to quite a few places, Times Square, Macy’s, Empire State Building and many more places. The hotel is full of history which is always a plus. The room we stayed in was exactly what we needed. Perfect size and the bed was very comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: Average
text:
Location great. Room is over 300 dollars . I would have expected a  better room - mine was clean but old and small and out of date and furnishings were shabby. No coffee or tea facilities on the floor or in the room 
Overall I was disappointed

title: Wonderful 8 night stay
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at the New Yorker, the location is just perfect for exploring New York, subway 1 minute away, Empire State Building a couple of blocks away and Times Square 10 minutes away. We had a room with a view which was well worth the extra fee. The beds and pillows were really comfortable and we never waited longer than a couple of minutes for the lifts.

There were security staff in the lobby checking room keys which made it feel safe and the Tick Tock diner attached fed us many times during our stay. The coffee stall in the lobby was great, probably the best coffee I had in New York and the servers there were so friendly I would like to give them a special shout out and thank you. 

The general cleanliness of the room was fine, but the one improvement I would suggest is to include more areas in regular cleaning schedule, there were some rather dusty bits that hadn't been cleaned for a while.  They like to service the rooms pretty early if you are on holiday but all the housekeeping staff were friendly and happy to come back later if you let them know. Also, it may have been operater error but I couldn't work out how to get the TV schedule up on the TV which would have been better but by no means a huge issue, we weren't in New York to watch telly!

All in all would highly recommend and I would definitely return.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is in a great position to the subway and all attractions. The hotel was very clean and tidy. Good Internet. Great diner attached to the lobby. Every one was really friendly and helpful xxxx

title: Buena ubicación, correcto y limpio
text:
Es un hotel muy céntrico, y bien comunicado. Ubicado al lado de la Penn Station.
Las instalaciones están limpias y son muy correctas con buenas vistas a la 8th Avenida.
La posibilidad de comunicarno sen español con recepción es un valor que se agradece cuando no dominas a la perfección el idioma del país que visitas.

title: Perfect location
text: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff. The rooms are a little outdated. But absolutely perfect for what we needed. Could just do with facilities to make tea and coffee in the room. We would walk over to McDonalds just opposite to get a cuppa in the morning. Perfect location for all attractions.

title: Requires serious restoration
text: I visited this hotel for a couple of days in September. I wanted to be in the city centre and was searching for a good value for money hotel. I did not have high expectations but wanted a decent place. The room and corridors were disappointing . The walls need payment, the office chair was torn up and the overall feeling was not one of cleanness . It is nicely located but needs some serious renovation…

title: Outstanding Customer service
text: It is rare to find such outstanding customer service where nothing is too much trouble. Neida has gone above and beyond today to help me with a client I have booked arriving tomorrow. I always recommend The New Yorker and have booked this hotel time and time again. You listened and turned the situation around. THANK YOU!

title: Rooms are too expensive for the condition they are in
text:
You pay for the location, the rooms are old and have seen their best days. 
The maid tries to make the best of it but the room is too old. We did have a view of the city and fortunately we had upgraded to a family room with a balcony.

title: Quiet comfortable hotel wit great location
text: We recently stayed 6 nights. While the hotel is old and our bathroom needed updating we were very happy with our stay. The location was perfect for walking or taking transit, the bed was so very comfortable and the room very quiet with no outside noise nor noise from other rooms. We did request a quiet room away from the elevators and they delivered!

title: Terrible
text:
Terrible. 
no employee to praise. They charge for everything and offer little. package received by Amazon, leave bags at check in or check out. dirty rooms with bedbugs and “dengue” mosquitoes, dirt in the luggage room. bad experience. I will even advise Brazilians not to stay at this place. Expensive for what little it offers.
I visited the doctor while I was there because I had itching all over my body. I have a receipt for the appointment that I paid $225.00.

I hope to never return to this hotel again.

title: 😊
text: The hotel is in an great location for exploring NYC. Close to the Metro, Times Square, Empire State & Madison Square Gardens. The food in the restaurant & Tick Tock top notch. Having a Starbucks in the reception is great for morning coffee. Would strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Great hotel, pricy as everything in Manhattam
text: The reception lady (with muslim attire) at checkin was very kind and put us in the best possible room for the category we booked, It was a corner room, larger than other rooms and with a gorgeous view facing the Empire State. Housekeepers did a wonderful job and cleaned the room everyday. The lobby is beautiful and well kept. We never had to wait long for elevators. The Tiktok diner in the hotel is a bit too expensive but good food and service. They have a mail room which works well for deliveries. Location is great for sightseeing, we walked to most of the places. There are many food and shopping options nearby. Would stay there again.

title: Overall great experience
text: Beds were comfortable, room was clean and the view from the room was great. Staff professional and friendly. We also had daily housekeeping. Tick Tok  Restaurant downstairs was great and they did room service. And there was Starbucks in the lobby area too. We had to switch rooms initially but afterwards everything was great.

title: Great location for Madison Square Garden
text: Good location.  The rooms were nice and the bed comfortable.   The hallways were very outdated and looked like a 1 star hotel giving it a bit of a creepy feeling.    The hotel is very close to Times Square and Madison Square Garden.   The streets are busy and loud as it is a touristy area.

title: Vieillot avec un emplacement idéal
text: Hôte idéalement situé pour visiter New York à pied ou en transport en commun, mais hôtel viellot avec une salle de bain à l'ancienne (pas de pommeau de douche amovible et robinet eau chaude au froide séparé), longue attente pour les ascenseurs et la consigne coûte 5$ par bagage. Il n'y a pas non plus de brouillard électrique.

title: Great location but very tired hotel.
text:
Second time visiting New York but first time with teenage child and 9 yr old. The hotel is looking tired and the bathrooms certainly need a massive refurb. The rooms are noisy as the windows are not sealed properly so much so you feel a full draft through the frame. I slept with ear plugs. 

The hotel is in a great location but I just wish we had a paid a little more for a better hotel.

Beware the hotel charge you after checkout to store your luggage per item and there is no negotiation or goodwill. I found this disgusting particularly because they damaged an item of our property. After complaining they refunded the charge for storing the luggage.

title: Lovely experience!
text:
Overall a great experience with a breathtaking view! Staff very friendly, convenient location and amenities close by. Small but functional room. We were out most of the time anyway. Wish there was space for a mini fridge and microwave but it is what it is. Special mention to Mr Mohammed who checked us in to a beautiful room with a view taking my son into consideration. I would consider staying here again. 

Now for people who like glitz and glamour…it may not peak your interest however there is a special charm that cannot go unnoticed. The hotel is in a location than CANNOT be beat!

title: Goed en gunstig gelegen hotel met redelijk ontbijt
text: De aankomst in het ontzettend grote en hoge  hotel was  chaotisch. We kregen één voucher te weinig voor het ontbijt. Uiteindelijk kregen we er één voucher extra bij. Je moest borg betalen. Dit kon niet cash, alleen met creditcard. Toen we na lang zoeken de kamer hadden gevonden bleek die klein, maar goed, met goed bed en goede badkamer en werkende kluis. Rustig gelegen je hoorde weinig van het drukke verkeer. Uitzicht op het platform EDGE. Het ontbijt in het hotel vonden wij alles meevallen. Na een chaotische aankomst is het hotel ons goed bevallen en voor herhaling vatbaar. Je moet er niet aan denken dat er brand uitbreekt want dan ben je op de 19e verdieping, waar onze kamer was, verloren.

title: Perfect location
text:
We loved this Hotel!  The rooms were spacious, two large queen beds, so comfy! 
Perfect location,  on the same street as Madison Square Garden and Penn station which is handy if you travel from the airport via the airtrain. 
Didn't have much dealings with the staff. 
We plan on rebooking here for December 2025!

title: great hotel friendly staff
text: we had an amazing stay here the staff was very helpful when we asked them things especially when we needed a taxi to the airport and keeping our luggage safe. the room had a good view of bright buildings around us. a great place to stay to explore the amazing city of new york

title: Top locatie!
text:
Dit hotel hebben we gekozen om de locatie. Die is zeer gunstig. Personeel is vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Kamer (goedkoopste type) is klein, gedateerd maar wel schoon en netjes.
Prijs voor de kamer is in geen verhouding tot wat je ervoor krijgt. Het is de locatie waar je voor betaald.

title: Great service, great views, great location
text:
My wife and I couldn't have been happier with our 6 night stay at the New Yorker. 

After 1 night, we were moved to room 3614 for our remaining 5 nights. What a view we had of the Empire State Building!

Aniana on reception noticed a blood glucose meter on my arm when we were checking in, and arranged a complimentary fridge for our room for my medical supplies. We were also allowed late check-out so that I could keep my medicine in the fridge on the day of our departure. Very impressed by this. Thank you Aniana!

Great hotel as well - can't think of a better location in NYC.

title: Room Deposit - Still Waiting for refund 3 weeks later
text:
Hotel was clean and tidy at all times. Reception staff were ok although the guy that checked us in was clearly not thinking about what he was doing as he asked me to repeat myself on more than one occasion which i found quite rude.
I left a $250 room deposit which i was told i would get within 7-10 working days and i still haven't received it. It's a good job I'm not relying on the money.

title: First time in New York and the New Yorker was the perfect location
text:
My husband and I planned a trip to NYC for the first time. It was the last leg of a 3 city vacation. I picked the New Yorker because of its proximity to the train that we were using to get into town. 

When we got out at Moynihan Train Hall, we walked out onto 8th Ave and immediately saw the sign for the hotel. We walked right to the hotel, used the revolving door and got in line to check in, right around 4pm.

The gentleman behind the counter was very nice and even upgraded our room to one with a view! 

We took the clearly marked elevators to the 32nd floor and our room was just off the elevator. 

The VIEW! It was amazing! We could see the Empire State Building and the Chrysler building from our beds. 

I say beds, plural, because our upgrade switched my husband and I from a queen to 2 fulls, lol. That was a little disappointing, but the view by far made up for it. 

I had already read reviews that the rooms are small and dated, which didn't detour me. Yes, the rooms are smaller and the bathrooms have older fixtures, but everything worked well. Our shower had the best water pressure of the who trip! 

The room did not come with a fridge, which was fine, so we took advantage of the ice machine one floor up. We had plenty of room for 2 people to have our suitcases out, the closet was a good size and came with an electronic safe that was easy to use, the room had an iron and board as well. We received plenty of towels. 

On the 32nd floor, we had no issues with street noise and the noise from the hall was minimal. 

The hotel was flexible on late check out and has a space for us to pt our bags if we need to before catching the flight home (for a fee), so it was nice to have that amenity. Any questions we had about navigation or services were handled professionally by a kind staff. Everyone there was very nice. 

The hotel is walking distance from so many things: Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Rockefeller Plaza, Macy's, Broadway, and more. Madison Square Garden is right out the front door and Penn Station the the next block over. You are as centrally located as it gets!

We LOVED our stay at the New Yorker and will absolutely stay there again.

title: OUTSTANDING FIRST VISIT TO NY!!!
text: First visit to NY with my family and we are very happy with the whole experience specially the Ney Yorker Hotel.  Our flight with spirit airlines was cancelled early in the morning due to weather and when I called the hotel to notify of our late arrival, Neida M., from reservation department was extremely helpful.  Neida helped us by making sure our rooms were reserved and our upgrade respected.  To our surprise, the 2 rooms we got were suites; one of the rooms with 2 double beds on private room had 2 bathrooms, refrigerator and microwave with sofa and working desk. It also had a balcony! The other room was also a 2 double bed with private door, sofa, refrigerator, microwave and a big nice dining table for 6. The second room had more space since there was no balcony or 2nd bathroom but was definitely our best choice since the view through 4 big windows on the 22nd floor was awesome and well worth not having an extra bathroom or balcony. Our check in was very easy and fast. Front desk personnel were extremely polite and friendly. Housekeeping was very friendly and helpful as well. We only utilized the starbucks cafe on site and the staff was also very friendly.  The hotel is conveniently located near many local attractions/sites. We had no big issues utilizing the subway. My husband and kids figured it out using their phones. We only used uber and lift and to our surprise, it was not that expensive.  We visited central park, central grand station, china town, little italy, the brooklyn bridge, St. Patricks cathedral, times square, broadway show and several other places all in 3 days!  It was tiring but well worth it. On our last day, we left our luggage at the hotel to take advantage of the afternoon and tour a little bit more before our fight at 10:00 pm.  The hotel has a bag holder area and for $5 per bag, they keep your luggage until you are ready to leave.  Their big lobby area is very comfortable to wait for your ride. We will gladly go back to the New Yorker again.  We love Wyndham hotels and have only good experiences with them.

title: War ok.
text:
Das Hotel hat zwar Charme, durch den 1930-Stil, aber ist schon etwas in die Jahre gekommen.   Unser Executive-Zimmer (Upgrade) im 31. Stock hatte nur ein 
recht schmales Fenster im hintersten Teil des Zimmers, aber immerhin mit Blick auf das Empire State Building, das entschädigte die Größe des Zimmers, was schon sehr klein/eng war und die fehlende Ablage im Badezimmer,  da konnten wir überhaupt nichts abstellen.  Aber alles in allem war es gut auszuhalten in den Stunden die wir uns im Zimmer aufgehalten haben (nur zum schlafen und duschen quasi). Es fehlte aber ein Kühlschrank und die Tee-/Nespresso-Maschine.
  Kann man schonmal machen.

title: Exceeded Expectations
text:
The people made all the difference in the world. I will return for our yearly NYC visits!

The manner in which they accommodated our requests was beyond expectations.

Krystal at the front desk and the rest of the employees were great!!

title: La peor atención en tan importante hotel.
text: Pocas veces me sentí tan mal atendida como en este hotel importante de New York. Fuimos en abril de 2022. Estuvimos alojados en dos oportunidades, porque de USA viajamos a Europa y al regreso también teníamos la reserva en ese hotel. No volvería nunca mas.

title: A lot of money for nothing
text: Stayed in this hotel for a week to celebrate my sons 21st birthday. We are from the uk so this was an experience. As it’s was. We paid nearly two and half thousand pounds to stay. We weren’t told of the $350 extra for ‘fees’ we also paid extra to have breakfast every morning to start our day of sightseeing. They booked us in and forgot ‘vouchers’ for breakfast. It was a continental breakfast. As I’m aware with most hotels that means help your self and have a variety of items and as much as you’d like. For the amount of money I paid for this I didn’t expect to get what I got. So disgusted and unhappy with this. On top of which we can hear literally every beep every ambulance etc. no double windows to get a good night sleep. The staff aren’t very helpful unless taking money. Never again would I book here. Below is my ‘continental breakfast’ what I had on its own. A tiny glass of orange juice. A pastry. So I tried everything to see what would come out. And this is it.

title: Charged but did not provide room, dirty lobby
text: We arrived at 10pm for a reservation made over month before to find out that the hotel did not have the room. We were made to wait over an hour and it was difficult to get a refund. We did not get even a real apology.  What we saw of the hotel was also very dirty. Awful place.

title: Nine nights stay
text: Good location next to Penn station. Nice lobby. Rooms are noisy and the view from our window was disappointing, although we paid for a room with a better view. Overall the price is too high when compared with the quality

title: Well located
text:
Did the job for my son and I, yes it was more expensive than others but it had two double bedded rooms which were hard to come by, it is perfectly located near to Penn Station which was ideal for us as we were attending NFL games at the MetLife. 
Room was large with two bathrooms and cleaned daily. Free WiFi which worked well. Coffee bar in the lobby and a diner neither of which we used.
Would stay again if we visit NYC

title: Weiterempfehlung
text:
Sehr gute Lage mitten in Manhattan. 
Es ist zu Fuß sehr viel zu erreichen.
Die U Bahn ist vor dem Haus.
Freundliches Personal.
Wenn auch in die Jahre gekommen sauber und zweckmäßig.
Für einen Aufenthalt in New York absolut weiter zu empfehlen 👍

title: Great Location saves this hotel.
text:
The hotel is located in pretty much best location you could ask for in NY. Walk out and you are presented with the Empire State Building domination the view. However and I must say this was my experience of NY on the whole, people were rude and could not be arsed to provide any kind of customer service. Also want an early checkin $25 dollars even if the room is ready. Want to hold onto your bags $5 dollars each. In fact if there is way to add to the charge they will. And this was also my experience of NY. The room was ok, very very small but manageable.  What really let it down was the art deco shower to go with the decoration. It would not harm to upgrade the shower to something out of the 21st century rather than the pathetic one on offer. 

The main gripe however was the lack of effort from pretty much every member of staff, a smile, a good morning or similar goes a long way.

title: Its a sad write!
text: Sad writing this! We stayed here in 2019 and had such a good experience we brought our kids back in 2020 just prior to COVID.  Then 2023, we loved it that much we came back for a 3rd time as a couple.  We were put in the most tiniest of rooms, literally impossible to call this a room at all. No where to put cases, no fridge, no coffee machine.  Wallpaper hanging off the walls, the tv barely worked, the bathroom was mouldy and awful.  There was the stench of weed permanently in the room.  There was rubbish left in the hallways all times of day.  I tried at reception to move, but gave up.  I've travelled extensively and this was probably the worst room I have ever stayed in.  After a business class flight from the UK and private taxi, to come into this ruined our break.   Unless I had some serious grovelling or offers of an upgrade on my next visit, I wouldn't step foot in this place, sad really!  To top it off I was severely harassed by the Wyndham time share guys also......

title: Bellissima esperienza
text: Abbiamo passato 8 giorni indimenticabili ,hotel veramente bello ,posizione centralissima a 5 minuti da time square ,la metropolitana a due passi dall’hotel che consente di potersi spostare in qualsiasi zona. Proprio vicino al famoso centro commerciale Macy’s.

title: Over priced, basic facilities and tired decor.
text:
Paid $300 (half) for a much better hotel across the road 2 weeks earlier.
Would not stay at New Yorker again. 
No bottled water or coffee maker in room.
Beds very comfortable.
Overall disappointed and shocked by the price for what we received.
Friendly and helpful staff.
Convenient cafe in lobby.
Convenient location for Penn Station which was why we chose this hotel.

title: Great hotel & location
text: We stayed here for 1 week and loved it, great hotel in a fantastic location close to all the tourist attractions as well as Penn Station just across the road which was very handy to get to from JFK Airport. Couldn't recommend this place enough!

title: HOT location for sightseers!
text: Great location! Near Penn Station, Times Square, Empire State, and Central Park. Excellent spot for NYC sightseers! Views of the city are impeccable. Luggage holding service available for when check in and check out time doesn’t quite match flight itinerary!

title: Family visit to NYC for daughters' 18th birthday
text:
Value for money, booked as a deal with Virgin which incl the resort fees.
All staff were lovely. Location perfect, close to Penn station and subway. Walking distance from Times Square & Empire State Building.
Tick tock diner was great, quick service and reasonable. Hotel bar was okay, used once but felt it lacking in character.
Requested a high floor and got 35th which was great. This floor/hallway is a little old and needs some TLC. Had room 3532 which was a nice size for 4, in a quiet corner, with views of The Hudson River, so didn't hear other guests although did hear a lot of rumbling noises from the water pipes, but didn't bother us.
Lighting in the bedroom was poor, so struggled to see unless you were in the bathroom.
Perfect for our first visit to NYC, would definitely use again.

title: Teeribly disappointed at choosing Wyndham
text: Really poor staff at a Wyndham property. The man responsible for Wyndham Rewards members was amongst the worst that could ever be hired for such a job. The lady who checked me in on 27 Sep and checked me out on 29 Sep was very uncooperative. Only one staff member, Mr Mohammed, if I remember his name correctly, was nice and courteous and seemed to genuinely solve my problems and he did do his best and as he promised.

title: Needs renovation, it is very old
text: It was very very cold and there was no heating at all. The room temperature was 18 degrees (celcius). I have never stayed at a colder hotel in my life which did not have any heating on. When I called the reception the woman was very rude, she started lecturing me what is heating and what is AC in a rude way and told me there is no heating until mid October. We stayed from 24th September to 28th. Apart from the heating the hotel is very old and needs renovation. The pictures on booking platforms are not at all how the rooms really look like. The receptionist during check in was very polite and professional.

title: Denise C.
text:
I had the pleasure of staying at the New Yorker from 9/25-9/28. Denise was our housekeeper and she was a delight from
the time we checked in until we checked out. She went above and beyond for my partner. She went shopping and decorated our room for my birthday. It was so nice, and I was very surprised! Denise is a people person (something you don’t find very often today) you all are lucky to have such a class act for an employee! I’d stay again if I could be guaranteed to have Denise as the housekeeper again.

title: Una stella per l’Hotel, 5 per la vista.
text:
Non ci aspettavamo un hotel di lusso ma neanche una stamberga! Stanze piccole, moquette sulla quale ci siamo guardati bene dal camminare a piedi nudi, bagno piccolo con una vasca grande e inutile nella quale gocciolava incessantemente acqua dal soffione (?!) della doccia. La cosa peggiore però sono i corridoi che portano alle stanze: vecchi, scrostati a tratti meleodoranti. In più la parte bassa dal 27mo in giù sembra abbandonata ( Lobby a parte si intende). 
Non diamo una stella perché la vista c’è, eccome se c’è!
Noi eravamo al 28esimo piano magari gli altri sono meglio.

title: Amazing Staff, accommodation and location
text: Absolutely gorgeous hotel, great location. The staff couldn’t do more for you, can’t speak highly enough of them. Highly recommend this from couples to family stays. You can basically get anywhere from this location. Clean rooms that are tidied everyday, great gym

title: bad service
text:
don't choose this hotel if you like to come to NY and have a nice experience.
the level of service is the poorest i have encountered in a long time.
the bathtub was so dirty is was disgusting.
don't come here

title: Localização 10 e quarto confortável.
text: Hotel bem localizado, ótimo atendimento. Ficamos num quarto de canto e tínhamos a vista do Empire State e da rua 34 com a 8ª avenida. Uma linda vista 180°. Um ponto a melhorar, textura do colchão. Achamos muito mole e largura estreita, diferente do descrito no site.

title: Great location, great staff.
text: Great location, first class staff, couldn't be more helpful. A particular thanks to Linda and her colleague (sorry, didn't get his name) who assisted with baggage queries. Really was service above and beyond. I won't stay anywhere else when I go back. Thank you, Gordon

title: Tired hotel, not represented in the price you pay.
text: Tiny, dark rooms that are very dated. Paper thin walls so you hear everyone in adjoining rooms. Rooms not made up each day. Would not recommend or stay again. For the cost or a little bit more there are far nicer hotels near by.

title: Great service
text:
I have to compliment Mohammad at the reception desk as he was extremely helpful and definitely went above and beyond to assist me.

The hotel was very well situated for me as I was attending an event at the Hammerstein Ballroom, which is literally right around the corner. Beds are comfy, rooms are small but that's to be expected in Manhattan, and while a bit dated, overall things were clean. The location can be a bit noisy, but again, you're in Manhattan, so street noise is expected.

title: Muy antiguo
text: Lo mejor del hotel es la ubicación que es perfecta. Está en una zona llena de negocios y lugares para comprar algo para comer y con varias estaciones de metro a unos pasos. El hotel es MUY antiguo y no es lindo. Necesita una remodelación. No volvería. Hay otras opciones mejores en Ny. Pedimos un cambio de habitación a una más grande y la pudimos tener luego de dos días por la alta demanda de Diciembre. Todo el personal muy amable.

title: A New York Treasure
text: Truly enjoyed our recent 4 night stay at The New Yorker.  The location was perfect (one block from Penn Station) and having dining options in the hotel was nice for having a teenager in tow...  The staff were friendly and attentive.  My only issue was asking the desk staff for a tissue and being directed to the CVS next door - luckily Tic Toc diner staff filled that gap in customer service.  The room was comfortable, although bathroom was a bit tight.  Not perfect, but a very cool NYC experience and I would return.

title: Look for something else. The room sold as king in a tiny room. Faucets drip, brown water out of tub, no coffee maker.
text: The room was just tiny. Water rust out of sink. No coffee maker. Old old. Bed ok but told king and a queen or double. Bathroom had a cover but let in all the am light. Bed and pillows ok. Housekeepers great. Would not make change for 100.00 bill.  Door man gone on Sunday night for busy show time to exit and get a cab. Next time we will find another property and spend d

title: Ottima posizione ma camere piccole
text: Abbiamo soggiornato per 4 notti nell’hotel, il personale è stato sempre disponibile, la location è ben curata e in una posizione centrale; peccato per la camera, eravamo tre adulti e la camera non soddisfava le esigenze di confort per tre persone per via delle sue piccole dimensioni, anche i letti non era grandi a sufficienza per far stare due adulti. Abbiamo fatto notare allo staff la questione ma ci hanno riferito che le doppie e le triple hanno la stessa dimensione e che se volevamo potevamo avere una suite pagando la differenza. Detto ciò consiglierei l’albergo per una coppia, ma se siete in tre adulti vi dovrete adattare. Per il resto è stato un esperienza piacevole!

title: Outdated and overpriced
text:
Let me start with the parking. They have the parking address wrong on their website.
We kept going around to find it, but it was a waste of time. We notified the help desk of the error on their website. Hopefully, they can fix it.
The hotel was overpriced but not just for this hotel but most of Manhattan hotels at the time of booking.
The room is small and outdated.
The parking fee is $50 per day
Hotel resort fee $29/day
Luggage storage is $5 per piece regardless a personal item or big suitcase.
They have starbucks on site.
The only good side about the hotel is the location.

title: Outdated and over priced
text: The Hotel needs update throughout. Overpriced for the room that we got, we understand that in general NY city rooms are small, but this was not only small, was also dark and sad looking. The nightlights did not work. There was no mini fridge or coffee maker. You need to pay $5 dollars per piece to storage your luggage. They told us that they had valet parking, but they don't. You need to unload your car yourself leave it in the middle of the street, and then drive it to the parking garage that despite being a block away, required 20 minutes in NY traffic.

title: Angenehmer Aufenthalt
text: Wir hatten Glück mit unserem Zimmer. Toller Ausblick und genug Platz. Sehr freundliches Personal. Am Anfang störte uns der Fahrstuhl etwas, später haben wir ihn auch noch kaum gehört. Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral. Die Bahn ist in unmittelbarer Nähe und viele Sehenswürdigkeiten sind fußläufig zu erreichen.

title: Rip off !!!
text:
Stayed Here between 9/16/23  and 9/20/23,Had breakfast at diner adjacent to the hotel (tik tok diner). Had Breakfast charged to the room number. For every breakfast i had, they charged me $ 27 faclilty Fee!!!! 

What a rip off!!!

title: Love this fabulous hotel
text:
From beautiful Linda at front desk welcoming you and quickly checking you in
The rooms are beautiful I had great view from mine
Security is top class
Very central across from Madison square garden and penn subway station on this block

title: Historic hotel in need of attention
text:
Stayed as part of a tour group. Our room was dark with poor lighting, beds were comfortable once we climbed onto it!! No fridge, no tea or coffee making facilities. We appreciate that this is an old hotel but the bath had been painted over and was ‘peeling’ all around. Constant noice and clattering from elevator shaft. 
Ate in both the restaurant and Tick Tock cafe, both were fine. Convenient location for getting around, security at elevators. 
We would not recommend this hotel and would not stay there again.

title: Convenient Location but not what you expect for the price
text:
I think this is my 9th stay at the New Yorker. We stay because of convenience but this is probably the last.  You never know what you're going to get when you stay here. Three weeks ago I was offered an upgrade for $40 extra a night to a gorgeous suite with two bathrooms and a balcony but this time I didn't even get what I booked. The hotel itself is old art deco but corners were cut when trying to  keep it intact such as tile repair and the like. I booked two queen rooms with fridges (was here on business) but were given a queen and a room with two double beds (one without a fridge.)  The TV didn't work in one room and we had to call three times and wait 1 1/2 hours and nobody arrived.  The entire stay it sounded like someone was moving furniture on the floors above us. LITERALLY the entire time - it must have been something with pipes or structure of the building. We had to keep the TV on all night (after they fixed it) to try and drown out that noise. I will add that a stay we had a few years back the full length mirror fell off the wall and landed on top of my sister-in-law - a very HEAVY framed wall mirror, it knocked her over and thankfully the bed was there because she fell to the bed and it rested on top of her. 
 We were offered a complimentary night stay the next time we booked but no matter how I tried to contact someone to reserve that free room, nobody would return my calls or emails. We made a note to look up other hotels in the area as we were walking around as for the price paid for this stay, we were certainly overcharged.

title: Old and expensive.
text: Spent 3 nights at the NYer and found it very expensive.  The room was v small but clean.  Decor was old and tired. No coffee or tea or fridge facilities in the room.  Hotel was clean though and downstairs bar was fine.  Just disappointing for the amount of money spent AND we had to pay a charge for arriving early and going to our rooms…never had that before.

title: Not great. Very disappointing
text: The location of the hotel is the only thing going for it. We went with our son and two granddaughters, The hotel was undergoing a refurbishment however we we in an old tired very small room with the two girls. Our flight arrived before the rooms were ready. so we had to check our bags into the store they charged $5 per bag to hold them the same on check out so we paid $60 in total. Very expensive stay.  Not a good area especially at night, sorry we booked at all  wont be returning.

title: So Great!!!
text: From the moment I checked in until I left everything went just fine.  Every employee was so professional courteous and helpful.  My room was so clean and very comfortable. The location the best in my opinion.

title: NYC never sleep
text:
Edificio dal fascino “storico”. Caratteristica la lobby in stile liberty, accogliente ed ampia. Soggiornato in una stanza standard queen( un po’ piccola per chi come me viaggia con valige immense). Nella Queen non è presente frigobar. Nel complesso stanza comoda e pulita. 
Consigliato decisamente perché in pieno centro . Attrazioni vicine : Empire State, Madison Square Garden etc..

title: The New Yorker - art deco , great location
text:
A very big hotel in the perfect location , we got the train from JFK to Jamaica station to Penn Station and the hotel was across the road , so great if you have a large group or children . First impressions going through the doors, very grand and art decor. We didn’t queue long and was given room details and pointed to lift - no luggage service- ther are plenty of lifts and we were on the 26th floor. On reaching our floor , we stepped out onto a wide corridor which went off in different areas, our room was end of a corridor, and on entering very small room with bed set of drawers two bedside cabinets, a desk and chair, LG flatscreen tv , would have been been better located if fixed to wall. A very small wardrobe built in but not much hanging space , there was an ironing board and iron , no fridge no tea making facilities . 
The bathroom small with shower over bath, and shower curtain , large mirror and plenty of towels, not very big towels . Three tiny of products which were shampoo , conditioner and body lotion- no shower gel , and two small bars of vegetable soap . 
Ther is an alarm clock with usb charging ports . A safe in wardrobe but we couldn’t get it to work . 

Floor 25 and 28 had ice machines and vending . The reception floor was Tick Tock restaurant and also a small order station for Starbucks . 

Ther is security at the lifts and entrance , they check for room key cards so no undesirables floating about . A very large reception area with seating , there is a very small gym but no air conditioning and the bar and ground floor restaurant were closed . To get a great view of the city you need to be floor 30 and above. We will visit again .

title: Great location !
text: Typical city centre style hotel , superb location , very helpful staff willing to help where the can i.e early check in , upgrades. Very good security and overall a great base to explore NYC as several main points of interest within easy walking distance

title: Dirty sheet
text: The brown narrow sheet that goes on the bed was dirty and stained of who knows what. Also, the hotel charges 5 dollars per volume to hold guests' luggage while we wait for check in time. To make it even worse, since we had 4 backpacks, we had to pay 20 dollars, the same as someone who has 4 large 25 lb pieces.

title: Great Stay - Good value and location
text: We had a one night stay.  Hotel is located in a good central location close to Times Square next to Penn Station.  Compared to other hotels, prices are reasonable. Good security.  Lots of street food and god restaurants within walking distance. You can also walk to most shows on Broad way. Discounted self parking for $50 a day is also available diagonally from the hotel.

title: Super!
text: Bel hôtel, bien situé, près de Times Square. Juste faire attention aux invitations de Time sharing en échange de billets gratuits pour faire des activités gratuites. Une pure attrape touriste et une véritable perte de temps.

title: Great stay
text: Mohammad at the front desk was great. Let us check in early (with a fee) and upgraded us to a nicer room for free. The building is super cool and has a lot of history. Very touristy area and very close to the train station.

title: Decent hotel
text: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The room was very small and old. The only thing that pleased me was the rooftop access, where there was a beautiful view of Manhattan. The housekeeper came only once during my entire stay at this hotel. A plus is that the hotel has a good location. I will never stay in this hotel again and I do not recommend it to anyone.

title: The New Yorker, New York
text: Hotel is in a very good location for visiting the main tourist extractions.  Security is of the highest, showing your room key on entering the lift area.  Family suite was a good size (although looks bigger in pictures) was ideal for our stay.

title: The New Yorker
text: Very old, but very nice hotel.  Across from Penn Station/Madison Square Garden and down the street from Empire State Building.  24 hour Tic Toc Diner attached to it.  Staff was top notch and very attentive to needs.

title: Nice little stay
text:
Enjoyes our stay at the new Yorker. Found it to be a great location, close to time square, little dinner attached. Staff were nice. 
Rooms were very small and no room at all in bathroom, to get dressed or keep toiletry bag out as no shelves or bench area. 
But beds were comfy, very clean, alot of street noise. No fridge. 
Overall our stay was still nice. 
Stayed for 3 nights

title: Vacation
text: Great location, adequate room. Brilliant cleaning staff and receptionist. Restaurant/diner could do with better customer service and quality of Italian restaurant food average and expensive for the quality of food.

title: Great experience, great Midtown location
text: Close to train station, convenient. All hotel personnel friendly, helpful. They make you feel at home. Our room was small (expected for a grand hotel built a century ago) but clean and comfortable. Our second stay, there will be more.

title: Tired Yorker
text: WiFi is non existent in the room. Decor, walls, carpets are very tired in and outside the room. Zero amenities. Lucky the TV works with remote. Check in very slow, arguing over credit cards when booked through booking.com not a nice welcome. Ground floor staff very abrupt and rude told my pregnant wife to move off her table and chair because we chose to sit together after checking out. It's a 2 star hotel at most. Bedding and towels were clean. I will not be staying here ever again. It's a dive!

title: Prime Train Station Location with Superior Customer Service
text: The New Yorker hotel is just a block or less from Amtrak,Subway and other NY trains. The art deco feel is fun and the lobby is spacious. The hotel is very clean and amenities are great. A diner, Fine Dining and coffee are just steps from the lobby. The rooms are clean, with recycling bins & comfortable beds. It’s NYC, so there was a bit of street noise from horns and construction. Customer service is outstanding, especially reception and housekeeping.

title: Superb location
text:
From initially walking through the doors, the hotel was gorgeous. Very prompt and welcoming staff and check-in was quick. Upon taking one of the 6 lifts to our floor, the room was easy to find… albeit very small, but that’s to be expected in Manhattan. The room itself was nice enough but did lack two major things that we would have liked - a refrigerator and a kettle. Other than that, it has a bed, a TV with pretty much every cable channel and a bathroom with bath and overhead shower. The view was good and One WTC could be seen in the distance. 

You have Penn Station and MSG right outside the front door. Entrances to Penn are all around you, making it so easy to travel on the subway. Times Square is a 5 minute walk. 

The Tick Tock diner is available for food but there are better places around. I’d only recommend this if you’re struggling for anywhere else. 

Check out was easy and the people on the door sorted us a taxi back to the airport without any fuss. 

Overall, a really good stay and I’d definitely consider it in the future.

title: An Art Deco legend
text:
This is a lovely, grand hotel with great service. Our room was clean, serviced daily and had a nice view of Madison Square Garden. The bed was very comfy and the aircon made sleep much easier during the current heatwave. 

The staff were all courteous, helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a midtown hotel, particularly if looking to avoid the busy Times Square area. 34th/Penn Station subway is right beside the hotel which was so convenient.

title: great
text: Our small, space-efficient room Manhattan's New Yorker Hotel had full amenities, great service, great location, and a great view. There are minor flaws but they did meaningfully detract from our experience.

title: Good location
text: Nice hotel. Next to Madison Square Gardens, so its in a good location. Antique look on the lobby and elevators. We got a suite and we loved the room view. Would stay here again. Check in and check out was smooth.

title: Average Stay
text:
Location of the property is good. Few of the standard items are not provided in the room like refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave. Refrigerator and coffee maker are provided with additional charge. Water is not provided in the room. Room service is poor. Need to show key card every time you enter the hotel which is troublesome.

In all if you get better hotel with some extra dollars please choose instead of this one.

title: Beautiful hotel!
text: Brilliant! We LOVED our stay here! The staff were so professional. The hotel is very clean and tidy! Great security with who can go up to rooms and a relaxing lobby for people to eat a quick breakfast or to rest while waiting for a room! Tick tick diner great. Close to Penn Station, Times Square and Maddison Square Garden!! Great bakery up the road called Angelina’s for breaky! Couldn’t fault our 15 days at this gorgeous hotel! You have our hearts New York!

title: Viel Geld wenig Hotel
text: Leider lebt das Hotel mehr vom Mythos. Es ist in die Jahre gekommen und man sollte vielleicht den einen oder anderen Taler rein investieren um es schick zu machen. Wir waren etwas enttäuscht und sind anderes gewohnt bei den Sternen und Preisen ! Darüber Hinaus hört man alles vom Flur, draußen und Nachbarzimmer. In der Lobby ist Essen verboten. Da fühlt man sich nicht wirklich willkommen

title: Make it a part of your stay!
text: We loved our stay! Our only complaint was that we were near the elevator and it sounded like someone loudly moving furniture constantly, but we were so tired it didn’t matter. The hotel was very clean and staff was really friendly. We ended the night at the bar for a drink, and went over to tick tock for a late night snack. The location is around the corner from the subway as well too so you’re able to get around easily!

title: Good location, aged facilities
text: On a great location, by the subway for A, C, E lines and one block from Penn Station, this hotel is an icon from the past that is in poor condition. Service is average, rooms small and aged. Requires an urgent renovation

title: Bien pour son emplacement
text: Très bien en raison de son emplacement. Permet de visiter à pied une grande partie de New York. Par contre ne mérite pas 4 étoiles. Déco années 30 qui est dans son jus, chambre promise avec lit king size : beau mensonge. Confortable mais en 140 de large. Salle de bain indigne d'un 4 étoiles. Wifi nulle, j'écris ce post dans le hall de l'hôtel où je ne capte pas la wifi de l'hôtel, je suis connecté à une borne de l'autre côté de l'avenue. Et en plus, personnel de l'accueil qui ne parle pas un mot de français. Indigne. En bref, bien pour l'emplacement. Pour le reste c'est zéro.

title: Very convenient location, landmark property, good service
text: Lovely hotel with shades of former elegance, now looking a bit tired but still more than adequate for a good stay right in the heart of New York. We had two adjacent double rooms which were mirror images of each other, each containing two good size beds with a bedside table between them, a chest of drawers, table and chair as well as a built-in wardrobe / closet. Bathroom with toilet, basin and bathtub with shower above it. The rooms had air conditioning which was welcome in the very humid summer weather. The staff were friendly and helpful, housekeeping did a good job, and we had no complaints about any of it - the only minor inconvenience was that the room keycards seemed a bit temperamental and stopped working occasionally, so we'd have to visit Reception to get them re-programmed. From our rooms on the 22nd floor we could hear some road noise (sirens etc) from outside but nothing too disturbing, and the rooms themselves were also well soundproofed from each other / the hallway. We were able to leave luggage with reception on the day we checked out for $5 / suitcase which was handy. The Tick Tock Diner was a very convenient option for meals, quick service and reasonably priced, and accessible right from the hotel lobby.

title: Location, location, location... and those beds!
text: Friendly, helpful staff. Very comfortable beds. The location is excellent... next to Penn station/Madison Square Gardens. Over-priced for us but we think the convenience of the location probably made up for that. A very walkable location with subway stops close by. Free coffee in the morning would have been nice though!

title: My NYC hotel always!!
text: This property is right across the street from MSG, Penn Station is next door, quick jump onto Subway. A few blocks from Times Square.  Rooms are spacious and suites are huge for NYC standards.  Beds are extremely comfy.  It has been remodeled and is beautiful.  Nostalgia of the hotel is even better.  We will never stay anywhere else.

title: The guestroom had a bad smell
text: The checking staff was perfect, they make sure take you know everything. The guestroom was smelling like a dirty dog, in both bathtubs we found hair. The hallway on my floor was dirty , it was not vacuumed for 3 days.

title: Travel
text: The hotel was great and the staff was so nice and kind. I like how they accommodate you and they are approachable if you need anything.  Surely i wanna go back in this hotel. Its really close in everything you need.

title: Wonderful stay
text: We stayed here to help our daughter get settled into her new apartment for her fall semester at college. She, my husband and I stayed three nights. This is a historic hotel built in 1929 and it is gorgeous This was our second stay here and this time we were in a renovated queen suite on the seventh floor The room was just large enough to be comfortable for the three of us with a nice bathroom , separate queen bedroom and a pull out couch in the living area We had a small fridge and coffee maker Every staff member was friendly and helpful The Tik TokDiner attached to the lobby is open 24 hours and has yummy,decent price food We will definitely stay here again

title: Incredibly wonderful, service-oriented staff and property!
text: This is a lovely, old Art Deco hotel. Yes, the rooms are a little on the smaller side and some of the floors could use a bit of updating, but it is a wonderful property. The staff -- each and everyone of them -- treat all guests with tremendous respect, providing an extremely high level of service. They are top-notch in every respect. Plus, the location is perfect--near transportation, Broadway Theater, restaurants, etc.

title: Historic Hotel with Great Customer Service!
text: The New Yorker is a classic and historic hotel dating back to the 1920's.  So please don't go here expecting a contemporary hotel.  The amenities are outstanding, but our room had a classic bathtub, shower and sink.  My wife and I love historic and nostalgic places so we had a great experience.  The customer service was absolutely outstanding, especially Shanika who helped us check into our room.  She went above and beyond and even worked with other staff members to help us find different places to eat.  As a Wyndham hotel, the rewards program is great and is well worth joining, especially if you have the Wyndham Visa card.  Also, the location is great as you are right next to Madison Square Garden and only a 15 minute walk to Times Square.  Overall, I love the hotel and will definitely return to stay here!

title: Ce n’est plus ce que c’était !
text:
Maintenance des chambres à revoir. Hôtel défraîchi, peinture, moquette à remplacer. Hôtel bruyant, fenêtres non doublées 
Aucun emplacement permettant aux touristes de sortir d’un taxi en toute sécurité.

title: Good location
text: Just got back from my second stay at this hotel. Our room was ready on arrival and nice and clean. Staff were nice and friendly and we were made to feel very welcome. Our room was on the 19th floor and over looked Maddison Sq Garden. The location is great as it's right near the subway and there are a lot of attractions near by. Can I just say Thanks to all the staff for being so good with us in particular Jessica. We will be back.

title: Perfect for us!
text: The room was cute and Art Deco.  The terrace was enjoyable to sit out at for coffee in morning and drinks at night.  The staff were all friendly and helpful and accommodating.  Thank u to the nice woman (didn’t get her name) that gave me bandaids for my blistered feet.  The hotel is older, but nostalgic.  I dont consider myself hard to please-for us it was perfect.   I was able to forgive the shoddy cleaning job on the floor of the bathroom and the less than appealing looking terrace because honestly, where are you going to get a terrace room on the 38th floor in NYC for this price?  Room service was quick and friendly.  The tick tock diner was quick and friendly.  The location perfect and parking close by (and validated).  We had a wonderful time.  Thank U New Yorker.

title: Posizione ottima...hotel senza pretese
text: Abbiamo alloggiato in questo enorme hotel per 3 notti. La stanza è molto piccola, così anche il bagno. C'è moquette in tutto l'hotel e in stanza puzzava ma in compenso c'era un materasso fantastico. La posizione è ottima con metro proprio sotto e a due passi da time square, mc donald e sturbacks proprio di fronte. Lo consiglio per chi come noi ha vissuto poco l'hotel e serviva solo come "appoggio"

title: En el corazón
text: Excelente hotel. Nos hospedamos durante 7días, muy buena la atención de todo el personal y, sobretodo una ubicación privilegiada. Habitación cómoda, limpia y amplia, con un maravilloso balcón en el piso 26. Volveré...

title: My only choice in all of NYC
text: Wonderful historic hotel ! Perfect blend of Golden era gem that is updated with today's amenities. Best location I can think of just 3 blocks from both penn station and port authority ! There is no other hotel I would rather stay in within Manhattan ! Check out their history exhibition and classic steakhouse in basement's Vault. Can't wait to go back !

title: 6 giorni a New York
text:
Hotel in posizione centralissima, staff cordialissimo e pronto alle esigenze del cliente. Materasso e coperta favolosi, ho dormito benissimo.
Unica pecca camera rumorosa per via dei tubi dell' acqua forse vecchi e internet poco veloce per lavorare. Assenza di servizio di lavanderia, dove consiglio di provvedere.

title: NYC vacation
text: We have just arrived at The New Yorker Hotel. It just fantastic. We were looked after very well by Mohammed at the reception desk who was very professional and swift in getting us checked in and to our rooms after a very long journey. The room is fantastic and very spacious.

title: New Yorker Aug 2023
text:
Was an excellent location, could see Empire State from outside hotel. Great for bus and metro. Room was quiet, but TV didn’t work properly, safe was broken, all clean, but could do with updating bathroom. Beds were comfy and AC worked. Room was quiet. 
Was security near lifts which was good as felt safe and you could only access rooms if you showed your key card.

title: a perfect stay in the middle of everything
text: Excellent location, overall, near train station, Subway, Madison Square Garden... The 24/24 diner (Tick Tock) has been very much appreciated too. Rooms simple but functional, a bit small maybe (family room).

title: Great location, clean, historic
text: Loved my stay at the New Yorker. Clean, great location near the trains, beautiful historic building and guests. Short walks to Times Square and Hudson Yards.  Good food in the neighborhood. Ate at the on-site Tick Tock diner twice and enjoyed it both times. Will return.

title: Will only stay here when in NYC.
text: Seriously good location and staff!  I broke my hip just before the trip and they really went out of their way to accommodate my needs. Excellent. Spacious room and bathroom. On-site restaurant is reliable and affordable.

title: A good start
