text: A very handy location  1 block from Penn Station. The room was on the small side but clean and comfortable . The restaurant onside has a good selection of food and reasonable priced .  also very close to all attractions

title: New Yorker - a grand old dame
text: Had a wonderful stay at the New Yorker. Staff were all brilliant and super helpful. Room was upgraded without asking and view of the Empire State Building drew our breath away. It’s a historic hotel and in need of a bit of tender care and attention here and there but nothing to complain about. Tick tick diner was perfect for an early brekkie before heading out and very handily it’s right next to Monyihan train hall for quick trips out of the city. One thing that would improve things would be having the windows cleaned externally but it wasn’t that bad

title: Pretty Good Hotel
text: The hotel was nicer than expected.  Pretty good renovation, Nothing in the physical appearance or condition of the hotel was off-putting.  Excellent location, and the staff was exceptionally pleasant and helpful.  Charging $5/bag to hold luggage after checkout was tacky.

title: Staffs were great, but the room was a disaster
text: The staffs were polite and courteous, but the room was very dated. There was literally no sound proof whatsoever and the police sirens, garbage trucks, and construction noises continue until 4 AM in the morning. One of our double beds also had a broken spring and it injured my thigh. Bathroom and the room are like decades old.

title: Great stay at the New Yorker
text: Absolutely brilliant stay at the New Yorker. Great hotel for accessing all tourist attractions. Range of restaurants to eat Gluten Free at both on site and nearby. Lovely friendly and helpful staff will make sure you have everything you need for a great stay.

title: Will absolutely stay again; small inconveniences/annoyances can be fixed
text: I stayed for 4 nights at the start of August in an "Executive Double Room with View", which was awesome. The view of the Empire State Building is breathtaking. We also requested/got a fridge in the room. For the price, the New Yorker is the absolute best place to stay. There are a few annoyances, and things to look out for when booking: we were put in an ADA room; while it was nice to have a "big" room, it left me feeling a bit "dirty" that should a disabled person need the room, it would be occupied by able bodied people. There were 2 of us (not a couple) and this room could sleep up to 4, but there is only one dresser with 3 drawers. And, being an ADA room, the closet has been altered to be accessible which takes space away for hanging clothing (safe, extra bedding, robes, suitcase stand). The room needs a MUCH larger dresser and/or closet. Finally, the room being a corner room and the size it was, there were 4 windows, which is great:1 at the front looking at the Empire State, and then on the long wall, there were 3 -- 1 behind each bed, and 1 beside the desk tucked in the corner. There was ONE lamp, and it was zip tied to the desk -- which, again, was in the corner of the room, away from the 2 beds. There were also 2 light switches -- one for a pot light over the desk, and the other one at the door to the room which lit up about 3 or 4 pot lights over the closet, beds, and chair/seating area (and of course the bathroom light). There was no lamp on the bedside table between the two beds. So picture it -- you're in bed at the end of a long day of walking, you're done your bedtime routine, you want to watch TV, read a book, scroll your phone, etc, and your options are: pitch black, full overhead florescent/LED lights in your eyeballs from the ceiling, or, the desk lamp, 8 ft away, tucked in the corner, on the opposite side of the room from the bathroom and single-window to the Empire state building. The NYorker NEEDS to put a lamp on the bedside table at the very least -- for a room with so many windows, it's DARK. I ended up cutting the zip tie and moving the desk lamp to the bedside table so we could turn the light off when it was time for bed. Someone designing the room should stay IN the room to figure out its functionality; ESPECIALLY as an ADA room -- if we had problems as abled bodied people, imagine someone in a wheelchair!

title: Still a good option
text: It's a beautiful property in a perfect location. That being said, the balance between history and comfort is beginning to tip. While they've done an excellent job at maintaining the elegance and architecture of a NYC landmark, it is probably about time to renovate the bathrooms...they are straight out of the 1920s. After an initial problem with my room, Lisa (rooms controller) saved the day with her exceptional professionalism. She really went out of the way to make things right.

title: Great place for weekend city visit for suburbanites
text: Large room, very helpful checkin person. Shamain was pleasant and kind. The room was clean and bed comfortable. The hotel is centrally located so easy to get to by train. I took the LIRR but Amtrak and metro north were also conveniently located at Penn. Nice place to do a city staycation

title: Great location
text: Great location however rooms small no tea/coffee in room food expensive and hotel needs modernising.Staff in the cafe was rude asking for tips in cash rather than adding to bill  Then they charge you $5.00 for each bag you in the lobby store prior to your flight.

title: Great Place for First Timers!
text: Just returned from a five night stay and this hotel served us well. The location is perfect for those visiting for the first time. Super close to Penn Ststion and multiple subway stops. Lots within walking distance. The staff were friendly and helpful. We loved the history of the place and the room was comfortable. It was surprisingly quiet in the room and I slept a lot better than I thought I would. Housekeeping was prompt and efficient and kept us well stocked. The only flaw was the lack of a mini-fridge in the room. Would stay here again.

title: NOT GOOD PLACE FOR KIDS
text: There’s no fridge in the room. It’s not convenient for young kids. I got charged $5 for each luggage to keep them in the lobby. It’s so expensive if you go with kids with so many luggages lol. The location is fine

title: Moyen malgré le potentiel
text:
Mis à part l'implantation qui est très bonne, proche de tout avec tous les métros. Le reste est assez moyen. Pas franchement digne de Wyndham, qui devrait songer à investir dans cet hôtel qui mérite mieux.
La décoration art déco est sympa mais elle date et ça manque d'entretien, surtout la salle de bain. Lampe au plafond de la chambre ne marche pas, desk avisé le jour de notre arrivée. Inchangée au 4ème jour, au départ.
Le personnel est serviable et aimable.
La chambre classique est petite (très petite) mais c'est NYC donc courant.
Le restaurant TikTok est pratique et pas cher, sur place, mais mis à part le cheesecake, le reste est soit du congelé, soit assez gras.
Parking à 100 mètres avec tarif préférentiel (50$/jour au lieu de 60$).
Sans la situation et la propreté, ça aurait été 2/5.

title: SAFETY RED FLAGS GALORE!
text:
Pros: Great Location, Close to a major subway stop, rooms were pretty good for what we got and had a nice view.
Cons: SAFETY! Not the cleanest, nasty carpets

Two stars because I would have given it an 4 if not for the safety issues. Our rooms door deadbolt was almost completely unscrewed when we came in from being out today. One of the screws was almost completely off. I retightened them as much as I could with my nail but it still wiggled. I do not feel safe here. Also, someone turned off our AC when we had a do not disturb sign on our door and it appeared someone had entered the room. I would not stay here again for these reasons alone or suggest it for anyone for that matter.

title: Ristrutturate subito!
text:
Ma quali 4 stelle? È la camera più brutta, piccola è datata che mi sia capitata negli ultimi 20 anni!
Completamente da ristrutturare,  vecchio, senza accessori in bagno, senza bidet, senza frigobar, dimensioni di una camera singola venduta x doppia, prezzo da 4 stelle… proprio no!

title: great central location but book only directly with hotel not through any other platform as only helpful then
text: ask the hotel directly for the best room for you. as rooms can be super small and dark. hotel staff was not friendly as we booked through booking.com and at times overwhelmed as there a lot of people checking in at the same time. there is no nice breakfast available (even paid) only a small coffee bar and there was a long line in the mornings.

title: Good Value. Good Location.
text: Great location, good NYC value. The room was small and the bathroom was tiny, but location is right across from Madison Square Gardens...close to subway and walkable to many things if you don't mind walking. Lobby is nice. Security asks to see your card before you can get on the elevator. AC was good Wifi was good. The price was much less than other NYC hotels when we booked and the points we got from this trip helped got us 3 nights stay on a future road trip. The diner on the mainfloor is convenient. Street meet right outside on the corner. Liberty Bagel is also right around the corner for cheap breakfast/lunch!

title: The New Yorker was Great
text:
The staff, hotel, location, and design of hotel was great.  It is right across from Madison Square Garden, Penn Station and Amtrak are right next to it.  We had a great weekend there.
The ONLY issue was the smallness of the room.  It is NOT a traditional hotel room.  It was 11x11 room, maybe, with nice bathroom, but the accommodations were very tight for two people. Other than the smallness of the room, everything else was awesome.  I really thought the staff was very accommodating and great to work with.

title: Nächstes mal wieder :)
text:
Für Touristen aus meiner Sicht sehr zu empfehlen, super Lage und sehr freundliches Personal.
Zimmer waren wie oft in New York nicht sehr groß aber dafür sauber.
Restaurant unten als gute Möglichkeit für einen entspannten Ausklang des Tages.

title: Excelent Days in Windham New Yorker!!!
text: A lovely place, with one of the most complets view of New Yor City, in times in that the hotels are shoe boxes..  very big and comfortablerooms, plenty of light.  a lobby really nice and the best attention!!!

title: Convenient and reliable
text:
This hotel is very conveniently located right across from Penn Station and Madison Sq. Garden, with the A subway station located on either side of the building. This makes it very easy to get around in the city. It is also a historic hotel which has maintained some of its original architectural detailing from the 1920's. This might also make it seem a bit drab for some, but I don't spend a lot of time in my hotel room when I'm in NY, so that isn't an issue for me. 

Rooms are small but comfortable for me and my husband. I've stayed in much smaller and less well appointed - like no closet! Housekeeping was attentive and friendly. Bed and pillow were comfortable. Bathroom had great water pressure and plenty of hot water. A/C seemed to work pretty well and we stayed during a relative hot spell for the city.

While the location is very convenient, this also makes it convenient for those less fortunate to try and survive however they can in a challenging urban setting. Meaning you will encounter those struggling with homelessness or maybe even criminal types. That said, I never felt unsafe - it is a very busy area and the hotel has security on duty checking all who enter the elevators. You must always show a keycard.

title: Great stay
text: Me and my Family had a great stay at the New Yorker. Every day a clean room. In the Family room we had 2 bathrooms and a perfect view on the City. The staff was great. The hotel is nearby the metro, times square, the edge, summit, high line etc. Our visit to NYC for 10 days was amazing. We recommend this hotel for everybody.

title: Good view
text:
Excellent location! Everything is nearby restaurants, coffee shops, gifts shops, subway, bus stations and ofcourse Time Square! I would definitely recommend 👌 this place.

Disliked · The room that i stayed, had a good view but the next morning the toilet flush handle was not working and the water kept running until it started to leak from all around. So long story short, we asked for onther room but there was no available room until 5pm. They fixed the problem around that time, asked us if we wanted to still change the room? So we decided to stay .

title: Good family vacay
text: We came to NYC to celebrate my sons graduation from HS. The overall experience was very positive. The only reason for the grade was because during our visit the temps in NYC hit the upper 90’s and every afternoon/evening when we came back to our rooms - the AC would be turned off. It would take forever to cool the room back down to a comfortable temp. Also, the small counter space in the bathroom made getting ready very difficult. Our pedestal sink was not attached to the base so we were worried it was going to fall off. We did feel the rooms were a decent size for NYC and were clean. The beds were comfortable. Our favorite parts of the hotel were the Tick Tock diner and the Trattoria Bianca restaurant. Both had great staff, food and drinks.

title: Great stay in New York
text:
This was our second visit to New York but the first time to the New Yorker.
The hotel is a little dated but it’s CLEAN and not too noisy. 

The hotel is in a great location close enough to Times Square that you don’t have to walk for ages but far enough away from the noise. 
On check in we discovered we had been given a free upgrade and had a room with a great view! 
Penn station is about a 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. 

The door staff ask to see your room key every time you enter which makes you feel safer. 
The reception staff were very helpful and accommodating they managed to get us late check outs on our last day as we had a late flight home.

The only things that let this hotel down compared to others is there was no complimentary bottled water in your room and that the rooms are not very big (but this is expected from a New York city hotel)

If I visit New York again would I stay at the New Yorker - Absolutely!

title: Early spring vacation in NY
text:
It was my first trip to NY with my family. I deliberately chose Manhattan area and this hotel was close enough to all attractions I planned to visit while in New York. I didn't regret my choice. On check in front manager Samira upgraded our room from the standard room to the bigger one on the executive floor on the 7th floor for additional price though. She also said that the room was renovated recently (well, I dont know, I think it wasn't new definitely  but it was pretty good: very spacious and pretty clean, beds and pillows were very comfy. Manager Samira was very nice and helpful throughout our stay. 
I will say that location-wise it's a wonderful place- very safe, only 2min walk from Penn Station (if I remember correctly) with the oldest Macy's department store in NY just around the corner (5min walk). Times Square is only 15 min walk away 
Overall, I can recommend this hotel. However, for our next visit we will probably try another one near Bryant Park, cause we liked that area the most.

title: Chambres petites mais très propre
text: Cet hôtel fut une belle découverte lors de notre dernier voyage à New York. Très bien situé et service parfait. Notre chambre était un peu petite et demanderait quelques rénovations mais très propre. Petit resto parfait pour le petit déjeuner.

title: Apathetic Staff + Excellent Location = Mediocre Experience
text:
THE BAD:

Terrible check-in experience. There was a huge line when we arrived, and we ultimately waited over an hour to check in. The wait itself was annoying, but I was more annoyed by the staff's complete indifference to addressing it. There are six check-in stations, but they only had three of them open, while there were clearly other staff members mulling around with nothing to do. We also ran into the general manager while we were in line, and I asked if there was anything more they could do to speed things up; he just shrugged and mumbled something about "union rules" before walking off without even an apology. As it turned out, the delay was partly because their credit card system was down, so every guest (even those who had already paid in advance) had to manually write out their credit card info and then wait for the staff to leisurely make a copy in the back room. Having people complete these forms while they were waiting in line would've saved a ton of time.

Strange but true: Taking a hot shower will set off the fire alarm in your room. I took a shower in the morning, and the alarm began while I was towelling off, so I figured I needed to get dressed quickly and leave the building -- but then we noticed that the alarm was only coming from our room (and our 'neighbors' were understandably confused and annoyed by the loud noise early in the morning). So we called the front desk and they sent someone up to quiet the alarm; he explained that this happens all the time and that we should keep the bathroom door closed when taking a shower. Not sure why they don't try to fix this, or at least put up a sign...

As others have said, the rooms are a bit dated -- and although we booked a queen room, it was definitely just a double/full bed. 

THE GOOD:

The location is excellent: Very close to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, and much more. The price was also good: About $175 total for a Sunday night during the summer. Our room was also decently spacious compared to other hotels we've used in Midtown.

VERDICT:

It was exactly "fine." For the location and price, you could do much worse -- but if I saw another hotel at a similar price, I'd take my chances elsewhere.

title: Good location needs a major refurbishment  a very tired basic hotel
text: Good location very basic the rooms are tired and compact Air conditioning was very fierce  we would turn this down each day however house keeping would turn it back up making the room cold. No kettle or any way of making a hot drink. Asked at reception for a kettle told not supplied to the rooms. No fridge to keep water cold. No where to store suitcases wardrobe very small so suitcases where by the side of the bed getting in the way In the bathroom shampoo however no body wash and only a very small bottle.

title: Great location, no-frills accommodations, just what we needed
text:
The New Yorker hits all the basics in a (mostly) friendly environment with a location that can't be beat for those traveling by train or attending an event at Madison Square Garden. 

I was there for a mix of business and pleasure with my 8-year-old daughter in tow. Check in was a bit of a hassle: despite using points to book the room one of the receptionist was demanding a credit card for payment. A different receptions, Mohammed, was very friendly and helpful in sorting out the situation - including having to fend off the protests of the original receptionist. Not sure what I did to offend.

Mohammed got us into an upgraded room on the 22nd floor with a nice balcony that we unfortunately couldn't make much use of due to the heat advisory. But my daughter and I were more than comfortable in the beds. The bathroom was spartan but functional and water was hot/cold as desired.

tl;dr: great price for the location, on the no-frills side of hotel experiences but it's Manhattan: if you're staying in your hotel room much you're doing it wrong!

title: Poor hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed in this hotel for four days though the location is central but the hotel is dated and in need of major renovation. Everything about the hotel is old from the carpet , the toilet, size of the room , painting , decor etc. no fridge , no coffee maker
I will never recommend this hotel . It is an hotel living on old glory

title: Clean but...
text: Clean room, daily maid service but hotel was worn and sound quality was very low.  Would stay again if I got a great deal but otherwise no. Very convenient to Penn Station and multiple subway stations. Midtown location.

title: Historic New York hotel, great location
text: The room was very clean and comfortable.  Front desk staff was very helpful.  I got to the hotel at 1 p.m., not expecting to be able to get into my room, and simply wanted to leave my bag at the front desk for a few hours.  They got me into a room which was a time saver for us all.  The Tick Tock Diner just off the lobby is open at all hours.  Great spot to enjoy a late night meal after a day of sightseeing, then just take the elevator up to your room and call it a night.

title: The New Yorker - Average
text: Location is really top! All the highlights of New York - Empire State building, Time Square, The Edge, Macy’s, Madison Square Garden - are  eet close.However, The service some staff members is terrible..

title: Pensavo meglio
text: Abbiamo pernottato nella struttura a luglio 2023, la hall  curata, la nostra camera invece troppo piccola per tre persone, e il bagno non era molto pulito. Nota positiva la collocazione, abbastanza vicina a molti punti di interesse.

title: Very Disappointing
text: Very old  hotel badly in need of a make over   rooms pokie n  very small rooms  bathroom shocking so old 3 star class  quality n staff not very helpful or friendly  no coffee or tea  making facilities in rooms good location

title: Motel quality and service at four star prices.
text:
Very expensive rate. Wanted $5 a bag to store our luggage. Cheaper to get early check in at $75 plus tax! 
Corridors old, tattered and threadbare carpets. 
Rooms small but nicely decorated. Safe too small but only useful for passports and money. No fridge or microwave. 
Bathrooms lazily refurbished (tiles painted over)
Challenged by security for room keys approaching the elevators but werent asked politely. Merely grunted at. 
Wont stay here again.

title: Hidden costs at check-in. A huge yet mediocre hotel
text: My booking prepayment was supposed to cover the room cost and taxes, but at the time of check in I was revealed that some "extra" taxes are applied that had to be payed from my own credit card (booking was made from a corporate card to which I had no access). Disappointing the fact of not being honest about the actual cost and charging extra at the lobby. Regarding the quality of stay, it was okay-ish, the room had barely any light and I found a used cotton swab in the bathroom. Pity this place suffers from poor management. Would not come back for sure.

title: unforgettable experience
text: Without a doubt, The New Yorker, A Wyndham Hotel, has left a lasting impression on me with its timeless elegance and genuine hospitality. It is a haven of comfort amidst the vibrant energy of New York City, making it the perfect choice for both business and leisure travellers seeking an unforgettable experience.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: We were more than pleased with this hotel.  Reasonably priced in  a great location.  We were really impressed with the friendliness of all the staff we interacted with.  They did everything possible to make our experience easy and enjoyable.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Classic Hotel, Great Location.
text: Classic Art Deco hotel in a great location. Double Queen room was clean and comfortable. All staff that we encountered were friendly, welcoming and efficient. Would definitely recommend the New Yorker as a base for visiting the popular tourist sights.

title: Not good and hidden fees
text: I know usually people only do bad reviews when they're angry but this is just a bad hotel. For the price you get bad service, hallways that feel like the shining and a hidden fee of an extra 200 dollars they don't tell you about when booking (they have a 'facilities fee'). On top of that the rooms aren't even that nice. I'd very much avoid this place. It's a good location but the metro service is so good in this city there's really no use is staying the central.

title: Exploring New York
text: Perfectly situated for exploring New York. Train station, metro station and shopping mall Macies just around the corner. Helpful reception, security for eventualities, rooms airconditioned. Fitness available, rooms rather small but probably for the New York standards ample room. Adjacent restaurant ‘tick tock’ easy to reach from within the hotel; without reservation always a seat. Chosen by several airline crews as stay over.

title: Nice and good location
text: Nice staff members and a good location. The room with a view is kinda small and the window is really small but the room is clean and we slept well. Just near penn station what is useful with luggage and near Times Square what is great when you want to go out at night.

title: Tiny and unhelpful
text: Our room was very tiny and there was nowhere to put our suitcases.  When we arrived, our room wasn't ready and so they charged us twenty dollars to store our  suitcases and backpacks until it was. Initially they said it would be for a couple of hours but ended only needing the storage  for half an hour as the room was ready sooner.  I would have thought that as we were part of a 42 person tour group, they would have waived the charge.  Not impressed with this hotel at all

title: Très bon hôtel, bien situé
text: Un viel hôtel, très bien situé à côté du métro et du Madisson square garden. L’hôtel n’est pas moderne et un peu vieillissant. Comme tout Manhattan, les hôtels sont chers. Nous avons bien aimé notre voyage à NYC.

title: Un hotel céntrico y muy cómodo
text: El hotel está céntrico y muy cómodo  las habitaciones son cómodas aunque le falta un poco ser remodeladas la vista desde el cuarto Espectacular y lo tiene todo el servicio muy bueno el wifi de primera

title: Leider zu hellhörig- ansonsten ok
text: Ich kann nur das Gästezimmer bemängeln. Man hört die Toilettenspülungen aus den nachbarzimmern. Das Bad ist etwas klein geraten, aber darüber kann man hinwegsehen. Auch alles was auf den Fluren passiert, hört man im Gästezimmer. Definitiv verbesserungsfähig.

title: A restful stay in handy central location
text:
I was very pleased with my five day recent stay at The New Yorker. The staff are cheerful and professional, and my room was comfortable and suited the purpose of my stay. In particular, the modern queen bed was very welcoming after busy days out in the city. The elevators are also very efficient for a hotel of this size.

My only suggestions would be:
* modernize TV selections to include streaming
* provide at least a shelf or small cabinet in the bathroom for toiletries
* provide at least a small safe in the room for valuables

I also felt very safe staying at this hotel.

title: A grand old Dame that has faded and still trading on it's name!
text: This hotel still has the faded beauty and history that makes it interesting and worth seeing.  However, the staff are not very friendly, the rooms tired and small.  Our suite had a plastic bag sellotaped over the smoke alarm, directly over the bed.  I was offered an upgrade for $59 however with fees and taxes, this worked out at over $100, which is fine but it wasn't made clear until I had paid and then I was told 'it is all in the small print!'.  Over $350 paid for one night (no breakfast offering) and still charged $5 per bag to store our bags for a couple of hours at check-out.  Maybe this is standard in the US but I have never come across it.  I wouldn't return but I am glad I saw it.

title: Would stay here again
text: Large, busy hotel conveniently within walking distance to the train station in NYC. We were 4 singles traveling and got 2 Rooms and requested 2 beds in each room.  Small rooms and bathrooms but just what we needed for one night. Shower pressure was good. Lobby was beautiful, room was spotless. Hallways are tiny and outdated. Staff was amazingly friendly and helpful.

title: New Yorker Hotel Wyndham
text:
The room service was perfect. The housecleaners were very friendly, and did 
 a thorough job throughout my 6-day visit. Security was also amiable, while remaining vigilant and helpful when needed. Overall, my experience was quite good. It was noteworthy that The New Yorker Hotel Wyndham is an equal opportunity employer, with a seemingly well organized staff made up of intelligent people who reflected the beautiful, cosmopolitan city they are a part of. 
So, what was the problem? Why did I rate my experience poor? The reason I decided to rate this hotel as I did is because it has been 1 month and 10 days since I checked out, and they still have not returned 2 security deposits I made. They have promised to, but that was 1 month and 10 days ago. I guess I am just frustrated.

title: Great location
text: Great location. We were on the 29th floor the lifts were very quick and never too busy. The room had a nice view and the beds and pillows were brilliant we had 5 great nights sleep. Always had hot water in shower and had nice shower gels and shampoo and conditioner. I would recommend this hotel thank you we had a great stay.

title: New York Stay
text: A wonderful boutique hotel that is close to a major subway line and walking distance to Madison Square Gardens and the Empire State Building. Also close to Macy’s and other retail shops. The hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly.

title: Bad neighborhood and TINY hot room
text: Unless you are with a tour group avoid this hotel. Busses of tour groups were checking in here every day. We didn't realize it but this is a very unsafe part of Midtown South. There were MANY homeless people in the blocks around this hotel. I've been to NYC multiple times and we were all over NY including Brooklyn and Harlem and we felt the most unsafe in the blocks around this hotel with people begging for money or just harassing people walking by!  Even the Mcdonald's and Starbucks across the street seemed to be struggling with homeless and intoxicated people harassing people! While the lobby was lovely it was very crowded most of the time and not big enough for a hotel with this many rooms. The room itself was old and needed updating. It was hot and is VERY VERY small with less than adequate air conditioning. There was no room for your suitcase to open anywhere but your bed. The only redeeming thing about the room was the view from 36 stories up. Unfortunately, the window was so dirty we couldn't even take a picture of the view. There was an extra charge if you wanted a refrigerator and an extra charge for a coffee maker- though I'm not sure where you would put either one. Extra charge of $5.00 per bag to keep the suitcases after checkout. Coffee in the hotel was $6.00.  Giving this two stars only because the people who worked here were lovely and did a great job including the front desk who was accommodating and super nice about early check-in, and the elevator gentlemen who always checked our room cards which we appreciated for safety. Sorry but you couldn't pay me to stay here again. Not worth it!

title: Average stay
text: Stayed here in April 2023. Would only rate it as ok…room was ridiculously small, with the double bed up against the window. There was a $5 charge per suitcase to hold luggage after checkout - never had that in any other NYC hotel, felt it was a bit cheeky! The doorman was disgusted that we ordered an Uber to JFK and proceeded to lecture us on it. Wouldn’t stay here again.

title: A classic NYC hotel
text: A classic NYC hotel in a great location. Love the art deco style. Check in and out easy. Staff friendly, efficient and helpful.  Clean, quiet and comfortable room exceeded expectations. Will stay here again. Rates good for New York.

title: Satisfechos
text:
Aunque antiguo, es un hotel muy organizado, limpio y tranquilo. La atención nos pareció buena y la habitación corresponde a lo ofrecido.

No tiene nevera en la habitación, pero hay hielera.

La vista que teníamos era hacia el Empire State B, era espectacular !!!!

La ubicación del hotel es inmejorable, tiene el subterráneo y la estación de tren en la esquina.

No nos gustó que no recibieran efectivo y que nos cobraran USD$ 5 por cuidarnos las maletas.

title: Great location, not so great hotel!
text:
I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights recently.  The location is great. However it has to be one of the filthiest hotels I have ever stayed at! The first room we were given had great views, however the toilet was leaking. The room was dirty with dust piled up every where including the air vents! We were offered another room which was equally dirty!  Bathtubs were filthy and looked liked they hadn't been cleaned in a very long time!

Most of the staff were very friendly and helpful, however they do also have very aggressive sales people in the lobby trying to sell time share. 
They claim that there is no catch and that they are giving away 2 "gifts" per person for just taking a trip to their new hotel and listen to their presentation about club wyndham.  Having spoken to a few guests who did take this offer, they mentioned that it was a passive aggressive sale for "time share".

This hotel is not worth the amount of money you pay. There are far more nicer, cleaner hotels around the same location for the same price.

title: Wish i liked it
text:
Wanted to like this hotel so much but it just depressed me. The lobby and public spaces are great. Bright and colorful with good food options right off the lobby. The elevator system works well and every employee i encountered was so friendly. Why only 2 stars? 
The rooms and hallways were abysmal. As soon as u get off the elevator its like u have entered a different world. A dark and sinister world. Kind of old hospital looking. And the doors to the room give u a clue about whats inside. Its not good. I couldn’t believe my eyes when i walked in the room. It was a small gloomy hallway leading one way to a bedroom with shabby sheets and pillows on the bed and in the other direction a living room with a dingy sofa and very small old school tv. The room also included a patio/balcony which i was very excited by…..until i went out there and saw it. How can a balcony make u sad? Somehow it did. My first thought was this isnt the room i booked. I was upgraded for sure, which is nice. But i considered going down and requesting a different room but didnt want to waste anytime i could spend out and about. So i just went on my trip realizing with my theater and appointments i wouldnt spend much time in room..thank god…i will say the location of hotel is beautiful and close to Hudson Yards and like i said the employees are very nice and the price was understandingly low.

title: Very good hotel
text: Excellent location. Next to Pennsylvania train station and underground subway station. So it was very easy to access most of the attractions in New York.  Walking distance to restaurants shops etc. Clean rooms. Very friendly staff. Would come back again.

title: Great Stay at The New Yorker
text: One night in a great, old historic NYC hotel. Room was quite spacious.  Everything was clean.  Housekeeping knocked upon check-in to ask if I needed anything. Front desk was very pleasant.  I ate at the Tick Tock, fab breakfast!

title: Ok for the price
text: The wifi was so slow in our room that it wasnt usable. (Less than 1mbps). I asked the staff for help multiple times but they never really made the wifi work maybe it is because our room was on the corner of the building and the signal was struggling to get to it ? As for the room it was decent and spacious, the view was great also but there was a bit of rust on the bathroom door hinges and some stains on the mirror. The bed was comfortable and the housekeeping did a great job.

title: Good location- that’s it
text:
Overall the location of the hotel was the best thing; I understand that it’s an old hotel with history and tradition but few modern touches wouldn’t hurt ( carpets everywhere made me feel like the room is so dirty) 
We booked the standard room with the views and that was the biggest disappointment; first of all you can’t even get to the window bcs the desk or a bed it blocking it; Than when you finally open the shades you can see the brick wall of the other building:( 
Another minus - you have to pay 5$ for every piece of luggage if you need to store them for few hours.

title: My worst hotel ever
text:
This hotel is one of the worst I've ever stayed.
No renovation for decades, tiny bathroom, no refrigerator, tiny room (nr 3203), you hear every sound from outside, when someone from an other room is having a shower it sounds like he is having it in my room, I paid for breakfast and all got was a black awful coffee and two plain pieces of toast- after the first morning never been to the breakfast place- when the door is closing you can hear it from far away etc.
And I have some more if you like (during my first shower thewater was like dirt).
Are you interested to improve this hotel or not?

title: Great location and clean room
text:
Stayed here on a new york vacation. I booked using wyndham points. Surprisingly a few days prior to my stay i received an offer via the app for the possibility of a paid upgrade. I made a few selections. Even though, it says that you wont find out until check in if you got the upgrade, the app showed me the new room category about 48 hours before check in. When i checked in, i was asked if i still wanted the upgrade, which i said yes. It cost about $60 a night for the upgrade to a family terrace room which normally goes for $500-600 night. The upgrade was worth it. 

The hotel is in a good location, 10 minute walk to tines square, 3 minutes to madison square garden and penn station. There is a cvs, mcdonalds and starbucks across the street. There is also an imax movie theatre across the street. 

The hotel lobby is nice and clean. There is a diner and a steakhouse which i did not try out. You have to show your room key to get to the elevators. 

The room- the family terrace room was nice and big for new york standards. Had two queen beds in one room which were comfortable. Had a tv in that room as well. There is a separate living room with a sofa, a dinner table, and a mini fridge. This also has the door access to the terrace. Awesome view of new york there on the 26th floor. The terrace itself is very large, you can probably have 20 people on there. But there is only one small round metal table and 4 chairs on the terrace, the rest is empty space. The hotel can definitely do way better on the terrace. To be honest, they can do better with the living room space, a kitchenette area would be perfect. The room was clean and the furnishings were in good condition. Housekeeping was good. 

Bathroom- this is where the age of the room shows. The shower water temperature does fluctuate a bit. The handles to the shower are old school but clean. The sink is very small and the bathroom itself is small and no counter space. I dont know why almost every hotel does has renovations done always seem to neglect the doors and hinges and vents. Instead of replacing them they simply paint over them. This hotel was no exception to this, sorry but you can tell some items have 10 coats of paint and why paint over rusty door hinges. Little things like this can make a room look nice or old. 

Overall, i would stay again if in new york again. Clean rooms, upgrade is worth it and good location. Just a few minor upgrades can make things even better. 

There is a luggage storage service which costs $5 per bag. This should be complimentary.

title: Ms Brenda Housekeeping
text: My family and I had an amazing time staying at the New Yorker this week, but the best part of our experience was the housekeeper Miss Brenda. Brenda took care of my family and gave us Southern hospitality in New York. Brenda has a wonderful spirit and made us feel like we were visiting family.

title: Superbe hôtel Art Deco
text: Hôtel art déco typique idéalement placé au cœur de Manhattan. L’intérieur de l’hôtel conserve sa déco depuis toujours. Certains équipements peuvent paraître un peu « vieillots »  mais pour les amoureux de cette période c’est un régal ! Certaines chambres en étage élevé offrent une vue extraordinaire sur l’empire state building. Les demander lors de la resa ! La vue est magique !  L’hôtel est idéalement placé au cœur de Manhattan avec 2 stations de métro tout près. Tout à côté de Macies et de Tiles Square (a 8mn à pied) le quartier propose de nombreux endroits pour grignoter, boire un verre et quelques épiceries ! Je recommande cet hôtel.

title: Our stay was part of a multi stop trip and with it being Christmas the location allowed us to do so much.
text:
The hotel is a little dated but clean and tidy. Central for everything, you couldn’t pick a better location. The staff were great and we got an upgrade with a view of the Empire State Building, which added to the experience. 
We where only in New York for 3 days , the location of the hotel allowed us to do so much . Tick tock Dinner is in the lobby with restaurants and bars within easy walking distance.

title: Brown water....
text: I thought this would be a cute option for an overnight but the room was filthy, there was hair all over the shower and the water ran brown in the bathroom.  We were "upgraded" from a king view to a double with a bed you couldn't even sleep on and a view of the wall outside.  Hard pass!

title: Great location superb staff art deco at its best
text:
Beautiful original art deco hotel at a superb Location 
Extremely effective and friendly staff. rooms are small but that's NYC  but do need an update, but it did not bother us - Maybe the only downside. 
The closeness to Pennsylvania Station and dozens of restaurants confirm the best location.

title: Excellent and safe
text: The hotel was very close to Penn station. Took the subway from Newark airport to Penn. Walked half a block to hotel. Close to the subway. Easy to get to Central Park , Met, Empire State building. I would definitely  consider staying again. The rooms are small like all New York hotels, no fan in bathroom and the Tv was really fuzzy but , we only turned it on 1 night.

title: An Absolute Treat!
text: My husband and I stayed here after attending The Cure’s concert at MSG, and it was an absolute treat!  The location drew us in, but the attentive staff, building’s history, and the hotel’s amenities have us eager to return.

title: Excellent Hotel with Perfect Location and Amazing Staff Service
text:
Please extend our deepest sentiment of gratitude to front desk agent Aniana! She is the epitome of what the Wyndham New Yorker Hotel represents. Aniana ensured that our 20th wedding anniversary was one that will be cherished by our family, forever. We are a very well traveled family both internationally and domestically. We have been fortunate to have stayed at some of the most beautiful luxury hotels and resorts in the world and now because of her elite level of excellent service, we have decided to join the Wyndham family for all of our future travels. We would be most appreciative if Ms. Ann Peterson herself can relay this message on our behalf, to Aniana as a priceless asset to the Wyndham brand that she is. Thank you again Aniana and we look forward to seeing you soon on our next trip to the City That Doesn't Sleep...

Greatly Appreciated,

The Colon Family(Armando, Amanda, Axavier and Armani)
Checked In, June 9th 2023 and Checked Out, June 13th 2023

title: Excellent stay nice location with healthy environment.security is good .rooms are small. Food is good.early environment.
text: Excellent stay nice location with healthy environment.security is good .rooms are small. Food is good.early environment.i will definitely again stay in this hotel.must try once during your trip to newyork.penn station is close by,hop on hop off bus just next to door.

title: Visiting a Friend
text: The location was great and for a last minute reservation was perfect in every way!  Got an upgrade for being a Diamond member which was a nice perk. The place was clean  & close to everything. I would definitely stay again and refer friends and family.

title: Very good but needs renovation
text: Afrosa at the front desk was very helpful with a great smile. Rooms had no kettle or fridge. Great location in Manhattan centre close to shopping areas and tons of restaurants coffee shops and bars .

title: Week in Manhattan
text: Beautiful building.  Extremely good location with short walk to Times Square, Broadway, Hudson Yard, Madison Square Garden, 5th Ave shopping and The Empire State Building.  Easy access to trains and subway to get you everywhere else.  It is safe and secure, with friendly staff.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Bad Billing and Terrifying Experience with Staff
text:
This hotel was nice for the most part, but I have to give it a 1/5 due to fraudulent billing and bad practices. I took a shower one night and my fire alarm started going off which, understandably, made me anxious. It was past 9:00 pm and someone starts banging on my door saying they are Security and they need to come into my room. I was staying in this room alone and as a young woman who wasn't even wearing anything, I asked if I could get a minute, but this person kept banging on my door telling me to open it so I had no choice but to open the door to this strange man banging on it before I could even get dressed or anything. He ended up telling me that the fire alarm sometimes goes off from shower steam and this happens pretty much once a day. However, if this is such a common occurrence why not 1) warn people when they check in and 2) not scare me to death by acting like the hotel is burning down!! This is not ok!!

Furthermore, I have been emailing the hotel for about two weeks now due to unclear and almost fraudulent billing. I stayed in this hotel to attend a conference, and for some reason, I was charged WAY more than all of my coworkers who attended with me. Even though I have the proof of my coworkers' receipts, the hotel staff keep telling me that it is not a mistake and that they will not refund me the money. The greed of this hotel management disgusts me! There are so many other hotels in New York. Save your money and mental health and DON'T choose this one.

title: Historic and centrally located
text: Beautiful, well-kept historic hotel. The staff were great! Within walking distance to so much, especially the Amtrak station, but also the Empire State Building, Madison Square Gardens, the High Line, and Times Square. Our room had a great view too.

title: Un hôtel exceptionnel, un séjour de rêve.
text: C'est un privilège d'être dans un hôtel historique au superbe décor art déco, et d'avoir pu bénéficier d'un surclassement pour obtenir une suite au 40ème étage avec une vue à couper le souffle sur l'Empire State Building ! Le personnel est aimable, rien à redire sur la propreté, et une très bonne situation pour visiter la ville à pied, à deux pas du métro également. Dommage qu'il n'y ait pas de petit-déjeuner prévu, mais on peut s'arranger avec le Tick Tock, et autres services sur place ou tout proches.

title: excellent staying at the New Yorker
text: excellent location , excellent welcoming - Samira at the reception was exceptional - professional, patient and very friendly. She direcred  us to the main attractions  and helped us  finding good vegy restaurants.

title: Great check in
text: Great check in with Mohammed. Very helpful, accommodating , and pleasant to deal with.  Rooms were nice and overall ambiance was great. It’s really nice to have such great service in NYC! Would definitely return

title: Amazing New Yorker Check in experience
text:
We were greeted by Mohammed at the front desk to check in & Mohammed was extremely kind & helpful in helping us check in 
He was very informative & accommodating 
Best customer service I’ve received at a hotel by far 
Great asset to your Hotel Guest Services 
Would definitely recommend this hotel

title: The head staff (Linda) was super helpful during our stay........Mohammed also great...
text: I would not stay anywhere else in Manhattan. New Yorker is super excellent!~rooms always clean and well made up when we check in.  I go and stay at the Wyndham New Yorker 5 to 6 times a year. It is a super hotel in every way.............

title: We'll be back
text: Awesome location, historic charm, friendly staff (Mohammad on reception was a pleasure to deal with) and clean rooms. Everything you need for a city trip! Not the most modern facilities but perfectly fine.

title: Lack of concern
text:
We were confirmed for a standard king room. Upon checking in we were told they had no king beds only queen size, room was a joke! Small dingy hallway leading to it ( room #781). Bathroom was terrible, small sink no counter top to place your toiletries, had to close door when you entered because toilet is so cramped. But the shower is great! Very tiny room, I got up in the night and when I turned on the light three (3) cockroach ran across the room, finally caught one in the cheap plastic cup from the bathroom, upon checking out I gave it to the front desk for evidence ( it was still alive) to no reaction from the desk clerk. No apologies or concern. I hate writing a bad review , but the lack of concern by the hotel was amusing at best. 
.

title: Stay somewhere else
text: The security here is very stubborn and racist. They harassed me and my guest, making culturally targeted comments. They are very rude. The hotel is old and the view is non-existent. The location is central but sketchy. The streets are gross and full of aggressive unkempt people.

title: Great option
text: Great hotel, good option to access the subway and near from Penn station. Facilitates to travel when you are carrying on a lot of luggages, Easily to walk to Times Square, Macy’s Edge tower and Madison square garden. At night there is no variety of restaurants.

title: This hotel lacks service and hospitality
text:
Perfect location! One can see various NYC landmarks from your window and it is walking distance to Times Square, Penn Station, Fifth Avenue and more. The  historic building is in beautiful Art Deco style, and the foyer is impressive with golden lighting and fresh flowers. That’s where it ends. Check-ins are only at 4 pm.  If you are early, please pay 5 dollars per baggage item that you wish to store until your room is ready, thank you very much. And in case you think you have already paid, think again: please pay a tax levy, thank you very much. On your way to your room there are officious personnel who are of the opinion that you stand in the wrong place in front of  the lifts, “blocking other guests”, even if there are no other guests in sight.  No coffee or tea in the room, not even a welcoming sign such as a flower, or chocolate or simply anything.  No proper dining room, you have to rely on a below standard Italian Trattoria and a rather seedy diner, with waiters insisting on an 18% tip. 
Really! Come to South Africa to see what true hospitality looks like. A little effort goes a long way.

title: Perfect location for NYC visit
text: The convenience can't be beat!  Right next to Penn station and metro stops.  The staff were most helpful in checking our party in who were split up and the first to arrive had not made the reservation.  All staff were friendly, helpful and attentive.  The rooms were clean, beds comfy, showers had quick hot water and great flow.  It was perfect for our stay.

title: Vintage gorgeous  with modern amenities and excellent location
text: Beautiful old hotel with modern amenities. We had an amazing view of the Empire State Building and Madison square garden. The rooms are small but modern and clean and can’t beat the million dollar view of the  skyline.  It has a beautiful and  classic lobby. There are many walkable areas nearby including the iconic Macys and the newer Hudson yards area.  All the surrounding neighborhood amenities were perfect NY experience. Subway is right there and Times Square is short walk. The staff was friendly and helpful. The housekeeping experience was amazing. Her name was Elena and she smiled and greeted us every time we walked by. She cleaned and changed sheets everyday!  This is a welcome experience since most hotels are now limiting cleaning to Airbnb style. Not at this hotel!  I can’t stress enough how great the cleaning service was.  The hotel also is secure with security at elevators and lobby. We enjoyed the onsite restaurants for breakfast and desserts but did not try for dinner.   We will definitely return to the NewYorker. Great stay and experience.

title: Great Stay!
text: Everything was ready when we arrived. Room was clean and well maintained during our stay. We felt safe and secure in the hotel and all staff was extremely helpful. Most of the major attractions were within walking distance and access to public transport was easy. We would definitely stay there again.

title: Worst hotel!!
text: WORST HOTEL EVER! This is a horrible hotel with the rudest staff I have ever encountered. The hotel is old, outdated, falling apart, smells, not at all accommodating and apparently condones their employees rudeness and disrespect of their guests. We arrived at 10am. we were told that our room wasn’t available until after 1:00 at the latest 3:00. Understandable, as most hotels have late check outs for guests. So we checked our bags with the bell station and wandered around the city. We came back at 3:00 and were told our room was still not available. So again, we left to explore the city some more. We came back at 4:30 and we were told by a extremely rude employee named Jean that our room was not available and that she could put us a room that was available and comparable to the one we booked which was supposed to be a “family terrace suite” which I was told that “ the family terrace suite” that I had book was one of the hotels best with a spacious living room area and a private terrace with a view of the river. I told Jean as long as the room she was going to put us in was comparable to the one I paid for or better than that was fine. I said, I’m sorry for being picky about it but my daughter is having surgery in the morning and I want her to be comfortable since we will be stuck in the room for the next 8 days. I said, it’s been a very long day and we just want to get in our room and relax. She responded very rudely with, “ yeah, everybody has something going on in their life. “ Ya everybody has something going on. My daughter was scheduled to have surgery following her battle with leukemia which required specialized surgery by a doctor in New York. We finally got to our room and it was not even close to what I was promised when booking this room. However, after an exhausting day we were willing to make it work. Then there was a knock at the door. It was security telling us we had to vacate the room and leave the hotel! When asked why, we were told by the manager named Mike, that an employee heard my daughter say to me while we were retrieving our luggage that the receptionist was really rude and bitchy and that is why we had to vacate. We were patient and non confrontational. There was no argument or any type of confrontation with anyone. Just someone over hearing a comment made from one person to another. Long story short, we were left trying to find another hotel that would accommodate us at 6:00 pm! Apparently, The New Yorker Whyndham Hotel condones their employees being rude and disrespectful to their customers. I rate this hotel a -10

title: LOVE IT!!!
text:
This was our first time in New York, we loved The New Yorker! Location is perfect, walking distance from main attraction and a subway station on every corner around the hotel. It is a vintage hotel, but very well taken care off and clean. The room has a safe on the closet. 

We had a room with a view, Empire State Building in front and Madison square garden on the side AMAZING! The staff were friendly and very helpful with any questions or suggestions.

There is a hidden restaurant/bar downstairs, under the Tik Tock restaurant, Butcher and Banker, try it out we loved it! It was a real bank on the pass and they kept the concept but now is a bar. (Alan is a great bar tender)

title: Great hotel and location.
text: This is a wonderful historic hotel. The rooms are large by New York standards, and the staff friendly. Even better, the Tick Tock Cafe is right off the lobby, 24/7, and serves good, reasonably priced meals quickly. I highly recommend staying there.

title: Impressive hotel helpful staff
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights in April 2023.
Location 
Hotel is in a great location looking across from Madison Square Garden and a stones throw away from Penn Station subway. 

Room
The room was a small size as expected. It could definitely do with minor upgrades and modernising.  Particularly the bathroom as the paint was chipping away from the ceiling which isn’t a nice experience during a shower. 
The maids do an amazing job of cleaning the rooms and were always friendly. 

Facilities
The hotel in itself is impressive in size and they have kept a lot of their original features which makes it impressive. 
There is a 24 hour diner (tick tock) connected to the hotel which do the best pancakes 
The staff are within the hotel are helpful and friendly 

Would definitely recommend staying here for ease of location. It’s certainly not the nicest room I’ve stayed in for the price however if your only in it for sleeping in then it’s more than suitable.

title: Mohammed is AMAZING
text: Mohammed at the front desk is an absolute rockstar. So friendly and let us check in early after an early flight. The room and view are impeccable as well as very clean and tidy!!!!! Super great stay!

title: Great value and quiet in a loud city
text: Quiet, friendly and super helpful staff, comfortable, fast elevators, close to everything, secure, and a great value.  Having been to NYC in the past and having stayed in fancier hotels, the New Yorker was the most serene. The negatives: the shower is old. It was difficult to adjust the water temperature. While it was clean, the 24th floor could use a facelift. I love the art deco style, but overall the space on my floor needs a fresh coat of paint and new carpeting. The room could also use a new coat of paint. I recommend it for it's comfort, security, and value.

title: Historic New Yorker is an awesome hotel
text: The New Yorker is an historic hotel that has remained current. It is in an awesome location for touring the NYC attractions by subway or walking. Everyone was very nice and did their job effectively. Metro queen room was SMALL, but very clean.

title: Top Lage, aber etwas Älter
text: Die Lage des Hotels ist sicher Top, wenn man als Tourist den Bug Apple erkunden will. Doch das Hotel ist stark in die Jahre gekommen. In unserem Zimmer (35. Stock) hörte man die ganze Zeit die Lifte und ein konstanter Durchzug im Zimmer brachte leider auch unerwünschte Gerüche ins Zimmer. Betten waren gut.

title: Emplacement idéal pour visiter New york
text:
Très bel hôtel, un emplacement de parfait, le personnel aux petits soins pour vous. 
Petit bémol, la chambre est un peu petite et vieillotte. De plus pas, de chance, nous avions une chambre donnant sur le mur...

title: Already booked a room for next year.
text: Exceeded my expectations at every level. As a Wyndham Rewards member I appreciated   the upgraded room and the late checkout. All the staff were very friendly. Shout out to Mohamed at the front desk who helped me combine two different reservations so I could stay in the same room. Housekeeping was great. There is no self service laundry in the hotel however there is a laundromat around the corner called Plan 452-Laundromat.  I look forward to returning to the New Yorker in March of next year.

title: Perfect location
text: Location was perfect for me. 37th floor, what a view! I even watched a fantastic thunder & lightening show! Every single employee I dealt with could not have been nicer. The room was just the perfect size for me, I was traveling alone, 3 nights. Clean, quiet, and I felt safe. I’ve stayed at 3 other hotels in the last 3 years, I will more than likely be returning to the New Yorker. Another bonus is Tick Tock Diner, attached to the hotel. Open 24 hours, it’s super convenient. Literally a 2 minute walk from Moynihan Train Hall & Madison Square Garden.

title: 5 lovely days in the New Yorker
text: The place is beautiful; the room was very clean, the staff was friendly, and it was an excellent experience. It is at the center of the City, easy to reach. The building is very nice, it has a lovely atmosphere.

title: Will come again
text: Excellent place to stay in the heart of downtown. Room was clean, staff was accommodating. There is a really cool history exhibit set up in the lower lobby. If you are going to a show at MSG it is such an easy commute.

title: A great stay with a minor housekeeping hiccup
text: We always stay here when we come to NYC.  Very convenient location to MSG, Macy's and the Empire state building.  There is also a subway stop right there!  And lets not forget the Tick Tock Diner and those DISCO FRIES!! Why 4 stars instead of 5....bathroom cleanliness... This stay was a little disappointing as  there was hair in the shower and on an old bar of soap in the soap dish, which looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while.  We were also missing our "Do not disturb" sign (which I am sure we could have called to have sent to room)  Other than that, we had a great stay.

title: A great stay with a minor housekeeping hiccup
text: We always stay here when we come to NYC.  The history of this hotel is magical old New York! Very convenient location to MSG, Macy's and the Empire state building.  There is also a subway stop right there!  And lets not forget the Tick Tock Diner and those disco fries!! Why 4 stars instead of 5?  This stay was a little disappointing as  there was hair in the shower and an old bar of soap in the soap dish, which looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while and we had no "Do not disturb" sign  Other than that, we had a great stay.

title: Complete Bait and Switch
text:
Total bait and switch! Pictures show a great hotel, but it’s two stars at best. Rooms were small and old. No coffee maker in the room, staff were curt and unfriendly. You get the feeling that they have a lot of once only international guests, so they didn’t have to be nice. 

Hallways upstairs when we got out he the elevator were actually scary. It looked like something from “The Shining”. Another lady we met in the elevator said the same thing- unprompted. 

Rooms are small and cramped (even by NYC standards) with terrible fluorescent lighting - 
Bathroom was tiny and dated.

Redeeming qualities - bed was comfortable, shower was hot and with good pressure, and it was surprisingly quiet on the 28th floor considering it’s across the street from Penn Station. 

I would not go back. Pick another hotel. 

Oh, they also nickel and dime you. Resort fee is $30. Luggage storage $5. Coffee machine if you wanted one is $50 per night!

title: A Room With A View
text: The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the view was fantastic! I couldn’t recommend staying here enough. My friend and I were traveling alone for the first time as young adults, and we ran into a minor issue with our credit card at the front desk. The man who helped us (I regret I did not get his name) was so kind and helped walk us through what to do. He even upgraded our room to a view of the Empire State Building! The history behind this hotel is fascinating, and they even have a little museum on the lower level! It's also incredibly central to Penn Station and Broadway. We will definitely be back!

title: First time NYC
text: This hotel was beautiful. Perfect for first time stay in NYC. Super clean comfortable staff superbly helpful and friendly. The rooms so clean air conditioning. Ice machines on every floor. So central to all sights

title: Amazing history, Great location.
text:
The New Yorker hotel is in the perfect location in my opinion . With a subway right outside the door you can be anywhere in the city within a few minutes. Myself and my wife stayed here for 5 nights with our 6 year old, the hotel is very kid friendly and the staff go out of there way to make you feel welcome and comfortable. The entire style and decor of the building did it for me it’s almost like a Time Machine back to the 1930’s it’s honestly a beautiful place with an amazing history to it also. 

Overall 10/10, service, food, cleanliness, comfort,etc. 
If in New York I would highly recommend staying at The Fabulous New Yorker.

title: Hotel comodo a tutto e camera con vista super
text:
Arrivati in hotel quasi a mezzanotte, in reception ci hanno accolto in modo gentile  e concesso  un upgrade in una suite con vista sull’Empire e Madison Square Garden. 
L’arredamento è datato, il bagno vecchiotto,  ma la suite spaziosa con 3 finestre, camera e un grande soggiorno con divano, un lungo tavolo ed essendo in quattro questo “ regalo “ è stato super apprezzato . La posizione è strategica, vicino a Time Square, a Penn Station, ai nuovi osservatori . Temevo che nella zona ci fosse un po’ di degrado , ma non l’ho trovata così, non ho visto homeless e siamo tornati spesso la sera in tutta tranquillità senza avvertire alcun senso di pericolo. 
Ottimo il servizio di deposito bagagli , è vero a pagamento, 5 dollari a bagaglio, ma viene fornita un’etichetta e così si è tranquilli che nessuno possa ritirare il proprio bagaglio al posto tuo ( episodio che mi è accaduto nei depositi senza controlli ). Cauzione restituita  sulla carta non subito, ma entro una settimana dal rientro . 
Considerando che i prezzi di  altri hotel nello stesso periodo erano decisamente superiori, il rapporto qualità prezzo direi che è soddisfacente .

title: Perfect for a weekend or short stay.
text: This might be the perfect hotel for a weekend in NYC. Clean, and quiet and comfy bed. Classic NYC charm and decor.  If you're going to MSG for a game or concert this hotels is flat out perfect! Literally a block away! Maybe not the best location if you want the trendy NYC experience but the A C E subway stop around the corner might just change your mind over paying double or triple just to be somewhere else. This also helps if you're taking the train in from JFK. Overall a really good hotel and location and for the price is just.

title: Would Stay Again!
text: My friends and I stayed here for five days for a gal pal trip to see Reba McEntire in concert at Madison Square Garden. Reba was amazing!! The location is excellent. It’s literally within walking distance across from the hotel. It’s convenient to Times Square and many attractions which is why we chose it. The hotel is an older hotel but when I booked, I booked a renovated room with a view. The view was great , the room was very small. I had tried to get a handicapped room but none were available the first night. The toilet was extremely low to the ground and my sis and I needed a higher one because of knee replacements. They did accommodate us the next day. It was an actual small suite with two double beds, an extra living room with couch and TV  and a handicapped restroom. We also had a patio with an even better view at the same cost. It was worth having to change rooms for. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. We were on the 7th floor so it wasn’t too bad of an elevator ride. I had heard the elevators were slow but they weren’t too bad at all. Free Wi-Fi for two in each room if needed. We did not have a car so I can’t comment on parking. It is near a couple of subway stations. The hotel has the TikTok diner that is open 24/7 . The food was good, they have all types and it was our go to unless we went out to restaurants. They did have a very nice restaurant that had a dress code. We didn’t go to that one, we were too busy. The staff was very friendly. It was expensive but not as much as some. This is New York City and it’s in the middle of everything. The location is the best thing about it. It’s so convenient . I would stay again. We actually got a good nights sleep. The noise was not as bad as I thought it would be from the sounds of the city. We flew into Newark which was about a 45 minute taxi ride to the hotel. It’s about the same distance from the hotel as is LaGuardia. The taxi rides to and from both airports was at least $100. I’m not sure about JFK airport. It was a great five days!

title: The New Yorker A Wyndham Hotel
text: 3.5 STARS- Stayed from May 25, 2023 to May 28, 2023. Hotel is clean and staff is friendly. Great location, Mid-Town Manhattan, access to subway system (Penn Station). Walking distance to time square and many attractions. Room are a little dated (older), small and bathrooms are really small, but cleaned.

title: Great stay
text: Really enjoyable stay, staff were excellent and room had all we needed, and in a Great location within walking distance of many of the sites you would want to see whilst visiting including great bars and restaurants.

title: Great Location
text:
The location was perfect for us. Train direct in from Newark airport to Penn Station, which is just across the street. We got the train to and from DC from Moynihan Train Hall, almost next door. Then the LIRR to JFK for the flight home. 
Apart from the rickety trains and the disorganisation at Penn for the DC train, this was perfect.
We stayed for 3 nights at the start of our holiday and, two weeks later, for another three nights.
Every member of staff, whom we encountered, was friendly and helpful.
The hotel itself is old, built in 1929 and it shows. It is old fashioned but this is a positive. Art Deco. 
There are plenty of lifts and they come quickly. Soundproofing between rooms is good.
Bathrooms are small. They are clean.
Rooms are not huge, as is to be expected. Queen beds are narrow queen beds.
We were in a two-queen-bed room both times. First time, it was tight. Second time it was comfortable and had a view of both the Empire State and the Chrysler buildings.
I can recommend Trattoria Trecolori, up 8th avenue on 47th street. Food is delicious.
Breakfast at the Tick Tock Diner, accessible directly from the hotel lobby, was great.
We will definitely return to the New Yorker.

title: It does not worth the Money
text: It’s a very small room for very high daily rentals, very old toilets and small, very slow internet. The location is great, but you can find other hotels so much better in the same area, it does not worth the money

title: Things to do
text: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful! The hotel itself is ideally located. Within fifteen minutes walk to alot of places. Times square, diamond district, Empire state, Hudson malls, parks,food Madison square garden., Transportation etc. Tesla. I stayed on 28th floor.

title: Great location. Convenient to Times Square and subway stations.
text: Hotel was lovely. Room and ensuite was decent size. Super convenient location. Subway across the road made for easy transport everywhere and just walk one street to 7th Avenue for all the activities in time square . Coffee shop in entrance was great for a quick coffee.

title: Comme hotel on peut trouver mieux
text:
Hotel beaucoup trop cher pour la qualité fournie .... Ce qui est positif c 'est la position dans la ville tres pratique pour decouvrir manhatan .
La propreté n est pas toujours au rendez vous . Avons du changer pour une chambre "suite" parce qu a 4 personnes celle-ci etait minuscule

title: A really nice hotel for  NYC visit. Highly recommend!
text: Just finished a one-night stay at this iconic NYC hotel.  Good location, very close to Penn station and Herald square.   Check in around 3pm.  The process is very month.  Driss at front desk is amazing and very kind tp make sure I have a good experience since I am a light sleeper.  The Hotel lobby is nicely decorated, rich in history.  A lot of great restaurants closeby.  Highly recommend New Yorker! Thank you to the hotel and staff for a great experience.

title: Good enough
text:
The experience overall was good. 
Too expensive for what the hotel actually is. 
It’s really good located and that was a must for my trip. 
The building is old as well as the installations. 
The standard room is way too small.

title: meh
text: meh.  if it was 1965, it would probably be fine.  the tv didn't work and its a tv from the early 2000s, not updated at all    carpet was brown and everything was just meh  for the cost of a single bedroom, 35 percent was fees added on .  not worth it

title: Poor value for the price
text:
Room was basic and clean. But for the price, one can do much better. We had originally booked at a Hyatt in the same part of town for the same price, which offered more amenities (breakfast, mini-fridge and microwave). We changed to the New Yorker Hotel because we wanted to extend our stay in Manhattan, and the Hyatt had no additional availability. 
Our first morning at the New Yorker (after arriving late by train the night before) the alarm in our room went off at 6 am. We hadn't touched the clock, so this was obviously set by a previous guest. We told the front desk that housekeeping should be sure to clear any alarm settings between guests. They apologized and said they would refund us some money, however they didn't deliver. 
Just about any hotel in America would provide coffee in the morning - either an in-room coffee maker or free coffee in the lobby. Not The New Yorker. 
My husband and I asked independently, ahead of time, if the hotel would hold our luggage for a few hours after we checked out. We were both told yes, but neither of us were told that there was a charge - $5 per item! EVERY hotel we've ever stayed in, including budget hotels, has offered this service free of charge. 
Location is good (especially if you arrive by Amtrak). Staff is friendly. But we will not stay at The New Yorker again.

title: Small rooms, good location.
text:
It’s conveniently located right next to MSG. I reserved a corner room
with a view and got put in a small box looking directly at a building. Front desk said that they couldn’t do anything and there was no difference in price, which I believe was just an excuse. I saw the price differences on booking.com and knew I got ripped off. Good for location, small rooms and okay service.

title: Lovely place
text:
We have not long got back from our stay at The New Yorker hotel. We have been wanting to stay here for a while as we felt it was an iconic hotel. It was exactly what we thought it would be. The entrance lobby was really lovely and I thought gave a lovely first impression. We emailed before we arrived to ask if it was possible to have a nice view as it was our honeymoon and 1st wedding anniversary but unfortunately didn’t get a view but hey ho, it didn’t ruin our trip one bit. Our room was small but not unexpected but what it was was clean, a comfy bed and a great shower. 
You can’t come to the New Yorker and expect a modern style hotel, this is an art deco style hotel and it’s in keeping with the style. The corridors are a bit dated but who cares about that! 
Some people mentioned about waiting a lifetime for a lift but we were lucky I guess and never waited more than a couple of mins. 
Tried the tiktok diner as were awake incredibly early on our first morning. The staff were a little tired and not the most cheerful but the food was good and loads of it! 
The location is perfect! Very close to the subway and stations. Shops and coffee shops surrounding the areas and a short walk to Times Square.
I would definitely stay here again, million percent!

title: Nada que decir. Todo fue segun lo esperado
text:
New Yorker es un hotel antiguo con mucha historia, muy agradable. La atencion fue muy buena y no hubo ningun problema. Creo que un punto muy a favor es la ubicacion en la ciudad.
La estacion de metro Penn Station esta a pocos metros y resulto muy comodo moverse a partir de alli.

title: DON'T DO IT!!!!!!
text:
In the words of the beloved Bette Davis, "What a dump!"  I couldn't believe this hell hole, especially since a dear friend from San Francisco stayed here often (before the pandemic), at least 3 times per year and for at least 2 weeks at a time, and said how gorgeous his suite was (Suite 4005) with one of the greatest views in Manhattan.  I had written in advance and requested this suite, but was told, as expected, that it could be "requested" but not guaranteed.  This is completely understandable.  But when I arrived and having prepaid a rather huge amount of money, the rude desk person told me that suite was unavailable since it is "only given as an upgrade," and that I would have to be content with what they gave me..  What they gave me belonged in a third world country hotel:  dirty, grimy, filthy bathroom, no toilet paper!!!!, and worst of all, no view at all -- only a dirty brick wall.  I had heard a lot about Mohammed, who I hoped could help me, but he was nowhere to be found.

I can't describe my utter disappointment and could only recommend this place if there was absolutely no where else to stay and you were an utter slob who doesn't care about cleanliness in a room.

title: I like this place. I will stay again
text:
First check in .. i was put in a tiny run down unit that badly needs upgrades. For a New York hotel, some units are not upgraded. 
When i complain they moved me then im happy. Great location. Nice unit and nice lobby. Great staffs at front desk. Very clean lobby. And uou can easily walk to timesquare. The hotel has a great location next to Hilton .

title: Adequate accommodation in NYC
text: Very small but clean and comfortable room and bathroom. Good safe. Great location short walk from Penn Station, 15 mins from Times Sq, and 24 hour restaurant next door. Note USD33 tax in every NYC hotel per night paid on arrival.

title: Thanks to Miguel
text:
Central location
Clean rooms,  although a little dated.
Very friendly and helpful staff.  Miguel on the front desk was attentive and helped us out with a small problem.
Access to the Tic Tock diner very convenient for our breakfast before going out and exploring.  We wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

title: A Great Place To Stay
text: Everything at The New Yorker was perfect. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, staff was very helpful and friendly. The location is great also! This was a perfect place to stay for a family trip to the city.

title: Gördüğüm en iyi otellerden biri
text: En son gittiğinde 1 ay önce gibiydi. Mutlaka gidince kalınması gereken yer olduğunu biliyorum Hem manzararsı hem görüntüsü. O eski amerika sokakları, o caddenin muazzam görüntüsü. Gerçekten beni çok etkilemişti.

title: Incredible Stay
text: Room and Staff were amazing.  The Queen Terrace Suite was the BEST room I've ever had in the city.  NOT a typical City room.   So close to so much,  15 minute walk to Theatre District.  10 minute walk to HighLine.

title: Loved The New Yorker
text: Fabulous 4 nights here. Got a room upgrade for my 60th birthday, we were on the 24th floor. Yes the hotel is old, but that adds to the charm. We never had to queue for the lifts, security staff were very efficient. In a great location, near to everything we wanted. I would definitely stay here again.  All staff we encountered were lovely and helpful and friendly.

title: 2.5 star MAX
