text: This is so not a 4 star hotel. It is pretty dirty, incredibly dated and is disrepair. Really such a disappointment. Ok the location is good and the staff are friendly. But god knows what is living in this 1980s carpet. This hotel needs some serious TLC.

title: New Yorker Great for Disabled Travelers
text: This is an elegant art deco hotel, with surprisingly great accommodations for disabled travelers. I use a power wheelchair and had no problem getting around. Stayed with my 2 daughters in an accessible suite with roll in shower, sleeps up to 6. Beautiful views, the staff were efficient, friendly and very accommodating.i would highly recommend this hotel. Also has interesting history, Nikola Tesla lived there for many years. Be sure to go to the basement to read about history of the hotel.

title: Great place to stay.
text: Great location. All the attractions are so close. Nice staff. And for a hotel in New York, their prices are excellent. Would recommend staying there and when we go back to New York, will be staying there again. My wife and I come from New Zealand.

title: Bel hôtel art déco très bien situé
text: Hôtel de style art déco, excellente situation. Proche de nombreuses attractions touristiques et de lignes de métro. C’est ce que nous recherchions. Personnel attentif. Samira à la réception a su répondre parfaitement à nos attentes.

title: Disappointed with Room and facilities
text: Check assigned room is what you were sold on when booking. We and another guest that we met were given rooms far from our booking details. If not as per your reservation details say something. Felt cheated for what we paid. Tick Tock diner on ground floor great asset to Hotel and location pretty good too.

title: Best location for Madison Square Garden- 4.9 stars!
text:
This is a long review; basically my check in sucked real hard, but the rest of my stay was awesome.

Absolutely amazing location, you can see the MSG arena from the front door, there's infinite Uber Eats options, a CVS at the corner and a McDonalds opposite the front entry and a 24 hour diner (called Tick Tock) on the premises itself.  Additionally there was stellar security, great housekeeping and lovely front desk staff (with the exception of one person). See my pictures for room layout and details in the captions.

The awful check in story:
I arrived very late in the evening, asked to check in and was snappily told by the woman on the front desk that my room had been cancelled and there was nothing they could do. I pressed further and she stated that the card had been rejected, to which I said 'My card is here, I can pay right now'. No-- not good enough, go call Booking.com to figure it out. I was not offered any assistance, I felt not an ounce of sympathy toward my situation or stress (which was due to having just travelled for 40 hours and my bags being left in Hong Kong). I too work in the customer service industry and I have bad days just like anyone else, but I would never ever be so callous with someone whom I have just given bad news to.

Having just arrived in the states, I have no cell service yet, so I am madly texting back home to have someone help me figure things out and I find that my room had only been cancelled a mere 23 minutes ago! I was literally in a car from the airport at that time, how could it be?!  So I approach the front desk again and this time I am served by the wonderful Miguel. He apologizes profusely, explains politely that I would need to book and pay at today's rate only if there was one available. I said, 'surely my room is already set up because it was only cancelled 23 minutes ago, can I not take that one at the original rate?'. He was unsure and said he would go speak to the manager. A time passes, maybe 5 or 10 minutes? Miguel returns and is able to restore my booking for a small additional cost. He also arranges for the mail room to be opened after hours for me to collect some clothing I had sent ahead (in case of exactly the situation with my luggage) and furthermore he helps me load up the baggage cart and takes it to my room for me.

title: Great Location
text:
My daughter had stayed here many years ago and received excellent service included a room switch.

This was my last hotel on my trip having been to many places Washington/Canada/New York with others in between. 

The staff were fine but not many smiles.

It may suggest 4 star but it isn't, 3 on a good day.

The journey to the room suggested the hotel is in desperate need of a makeover and the room confirmed it.

The location of this hotel makes up for the "missings."

I didn't fall in love with the hotel but I did appreciate it.

Thank you Team New Yorker.

title: 'A home from home'
text: We found the New Yorker hotel, with its friendly, helpful staff and excellent location, perfect for our short break in the city. It was 'a home from home' that helped make our stay in the city a truly enjoyable one.

title: Historic hotel, great staff, central location
text:
The staff here were excellent - all of them! very friendly and helpful. We loved them!
Room was fine, clean and comfy, bathrooms tiny.
Hotel is full of history and feels classy and interesting - they have kept it updated and fresh.
No welcome amenity, could not find a snack stand to buy even bottled water onsite.
Had to leave hotel to take meds with water.

title: The New Yorker - Not worth the money
text:
Please do not waste your money on this hotel.
Was expecting something wonderful and was the most disappointed I have ever been.
Rubbish rooms - we had a brick wall less than 6ft away from window and had to have the light on to see. Extra charges for facility fees not mentioned and not required but compulsory $33 per night per room. 
Some very unhelpful staff when asking questions - TV didn't work and wasn't fixed after 2 days, when we left Shower room so small you had to close the door to get in. 
Poor decor and size of room - don't believe the pictures.
Email address to complain does not work - I have been trying for several days - and this supposed to be major player!!!

title: Excelente ubicación
text: La ubicación no puede ser mejor, tiene acceso a todo Manhattan y al aeropuerto, en la estación Pensilvania que está enfrente. El hotel no es muy moderno pero está bien cuidado. La habitación era pequeña pero cómoda y muy limpia. Nuestra experiencia fue muy buena

title: Disappointing but great location
text: Very poor service major problems taking money from accounts that’s wasn’t authorised, very noisy room great location, rooms are very tired had one renovated room out of three the other rooms are very tired and the renovated one was a little disappointing,

title: Hôtel à rénover
text: Hôtel, bien placé à Manthan en face de l’empire state Bulding mais mériterait une bonne rénovation, car la peinture dans la salle de bein s’écaille un peu et le froid passe à travers les fenêtres, l’isolation est à revoir !

title: Recomendable por su ubicación solamente
text:
NO ACEPTAN EFECTIVO. 
Llegamos a las 9 por lo que pedimos el check in a esa hora ya que la entrada era a las 16 hs. Nos cobraron 50 dolares más impuestos. Al volver del tour llegamos a las 17.30 y la habitación aùn no estaba disponible pero ahí no nos pagaron nada a nosotros.
Además te cobran las tasas que con los impuestos es de 30 dolares por día mientras no estamos en el tour.
Si Se dejan las maletas a resguardo y te vas a recorrer te cobran 6 dolares por cada maleta cuando en todos los hoteles es gratuito. Si queres dejar las maletas cuando te vas al tour te cobran 10 dolares por día y por maleta.
Habitaciones super pequeñas. El lavatorio del baño no tenia lugar ni para apoyar los cepillos de dientes.
Una vez que dejas el hotel y te quedas en el lobby te cortan el wifi y para utilizar el baño tenes que pedir una tarjeta a la vigilancia.
El desayuno mal atendido por un señor grandote que no hablaba español. Te sirven en jarros de aluminio que vienen llenos de café aguado y te lo tiran sobre la mesa. Obvio que se derramó y tuvimos que pedirle que limpie de lo contrario nos dejaba toda la mesa mojada. En otra oportunidad nos quería hacer sentar en una mesa que aún no estaba limpia. Consistía en dos tostadas de pan lactal de rodaja fina, manteca y dulce y un pequeño vaso de jugo de naranja. Al estar en el tour las 2 tostadas se convirtieron en 4. Si querías algo más había que pagarlo.
Para destacar la atención de Aniana y su compañera en Recepción. Solo recomendable por su ubicación en la 34 y la 8ª.

title: Hôtel vieillot qui mériterait une sérieuse rénovation
text: Hôtel bien placé mais vieillissant . Nous avons eu un problème avec notre chambre … fenêtre qui ne fermait pas chambre très froide et avec le sentiment d’avoir été baladées . On nous a promis que la maintenance passerait elle est passée 10 minutes après 3 demandes en s’engageant à changer la fenêtre pour le lendemain …rien n’a été fait . Nous avons obtenu une ristourne . Un salut spécial à deux membres du desk qui ont fait ce qu’ils ont pu pour nous et étaient désolés pour nous . L’honnêteté commande de dire qu’un des managers nous a proposé une nouvelle chambre mais à plus de 20 heures le soir c’est compliqué d’autant que l’alternative était la réparation dans notre chambre ( avec une super vue) et compte tenu de l’engagement nous avons préféré garder notre chambre ( réparation qui n’a jamais été effectuée ) . Voilà tout cela a gâché notre séjour et cet hôtel mériterait un sérieux coup de neuf.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Yes, the hotel is old... but really clean, had everything I needed. The location could not be better. Richard from the reception was able to give us an upgrade since it was my birthday. Our room had a fantastic view (Empire State building). Loved our stay. The cleaning ladies were lovely and extremely polite, so were the security staff.

title: Wyndham scam
text: My wife and I booked into the hotel for three nights. I requested a map of the metro system from the concierge desk and they recommended joining their rewards scheme whereby you pay a refundable $40 and get discretionary terms and access to major NY attractions. They told us we could pick up our rewards card at an address in Manhattan and would be refunded our deposit. When we received the app on my phone the small print showed that to get our money back we had to attend a 90-minute time share presentation. When I then researched it I discovered that this is a long-standing scam perpetrated by the hotel group which has been going on for many years. We were warned that the presentation could actually take much longer than the minimum 90 minutes. I lost $40 but could have lost a half day of my holiday and been subjected to a hard-sell sales presentation. Be warned this hotel group has a reputation for this.

title: Not a 4 Star Experience
text: I am shocked by the favorable ratings/reviews on this hotel.  There was nothing premium about the experience. The furnishings, carpeting, fixtures and plumbing were old and ugly. I had a single queen size bed that barely fit the available space. The flatscreen TV was the smallest I've seen. The bathroom? Old tub/shower, sink and the kind of toilet you'd find in a high school built in the 50's. In addition to NYC's famous room taxes, they charged a "resort fee" and held a $100 deposit (i.e., the taxes, deposit and resort fee represented nearly a $280 surcharge for the 2 nights I stayed). You wouldn't want to eat or have a drink here... zero ambiance. I was able to check-in-out without any trouble. The staff was OK. I would never return here.

title: Very convenient hotel
text: This is such a convenient hotel. Right across the street from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. Many delicious restaurants within walking distance as well. The rooms were small but very comfortable and adequately equipped with toiletries. We really enjoyed our stay

title: $50 per day for a coffeemaker?!?!
text:
Our room (and bathroom) was relatively large and clean and quiet. Our only complaint was that there was no coffeemaker in the room. We could have requested one, but the $50 per day price was much too high. Even low-to-middle level hotels typically have that as a standard feature, not a luxury.

We enjoyed the Tick Tock Diner and the Butcher and Banker bar/restaurant. The bar of the Butcher/Banker is semi-dark and very beautiful. It's worth a trip by itself.

title: Great location, reasonably priced, on the subway
text: Stayed here as part of a tour group, so I did not pick the hotel myself, but it was a wise choice.  Great location, reasonably priced and comfortable.  I was on the 29th floor and so not a lot of noise from the street except on the weekend when you definitely could hear the music.  The bed was super comfortable.  Housekeeping every day (!)  I was here a week so I was familiar with the elevators -- slow at times, especially in the mornings, but they were all working (!)  My room had a great view of the Empire State Building, a nice touch.  My room also had a great big tub -- but no stopper so that I could take a much wanted bath!  Next time I will bring my own stopper -- I asked for one, but none was provided.  There is a Whole Foods a couple blocks away and I had yummy soup for dinner a couple times -- $7 if you are on a budget.  This hotel is on the subway line, so it's 1-2 stops to the theater district.

title: Okay
text: The reception and lobby area were lovely as were the bar and restaurant but as far as corridors and rooms went they really need to be updated and freshened up. The shower was difficult to use and the toilet required multiple flushes even after being attended to by a plumber. The bathroom could also have been cleaner. The lifts should also be updated to make it possible to use your keycard rather than having a security guard demanding to see your key card every time you approach the lift as this is incredibly outdated even for an old fashioned hotel. However, it was in a good location.

title: Excellent hotel
text: On a passe un tres bon sejour au New yorker. Tres bon hotel parfaitement situe a proximite d.acces de metro ou de Tmes square notamment. Le Personnel est tres sympatque. Les chambres sont tres bien, bien que la notre ait ete un peu petite pour 4. Le tout est tres propre.

title: Great Location
text: Ideal midtown location, close to subway. Nice large room which was clean and comfortable. The facility fee was a bit of a rip off at the end but guess that’s standard in NY hotels. Paying for services we didn’t use like the business centre and gym

title: Excellent hôtel pour visiter New York
text: Nous avions eu la joie d'avoir une superbe chambre avec une vue incroyable sur l'empire State Bulding. Cet Hotel est proches des lignes de métros ACE ainsi que des autres lignes grâce à Penn Station à deux pas. vous êtes également à &ou é mimutes du Madison Square Garden et à peine à éà minutes de Brian Park. Bref emplacement idéal pour visiter Manhattan .

title: One of the classic Hotels in NYC
text: Overall I stay here when in the NYC area. I have other chains I like but this is a classic facility with great food choices at the hotel, relatively close to the Javits and other sites in the area. Would recommend to stay!

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Lovely hotel. All staff that I came into contact with were very professional and helpful. 
Room with double bed was of a good size. Quiet apart from minimal sound of emergency vehicles outside but as soon as my head hit the pillow I was dead to the world anyway. Bed extremely comfortable, plenty of lovely hot water for showering. No coffee making facilities so  I took my own travel kettle. 
Penn Station across the road but we walked everywhere anyway apart from using the Big Red Bus tour to get to 9/11 memorial. 
Used the Tick Tock diner a couple of times. Food good with massive portions!

title: Ein schöner Urlaub
text:
Entspannter New York Trip
Der Ausblick war nicht wie gedacht, „City view“ Zimmer 
Das Bad wirke etwas älter.
Jedoch erfüllt das Zimmer und das Bad den erforderlichen Anspruch.
Lage und Preis des Hotels waren super, genauso wie das angetroffene Personal

title: We loved this hotel!
text:
The location of the hotel is fantastic and close to all the main tourist areas.

Penn Subway station is just across the road from the hotel, we took the train from JFK airport to Penn station.

The hotel is clean,well maintained and very security conscious.

The shower in the bathroom was either boiling hot or freezing cold.

We booked with Virgin so we didn’t have any extra taxes etc to pay.

The view from our room was amazing and the beds were very comfy.
The WiFi worked well.

We didn’t have a problem with paying 5dollars each for the storage or our bags on our last day, we had a night flight back so we left our bags and went shopping for the day.
This is a cashless hotel so even for bag storage you have to pay it on your card.

There is a few crazy people outside the hotel but I really don’t think they would do you any harm.

I would love to stay here again.

title: Old, small and stogy w/$29 facility fee added to bill per night!!!
text: Old, small and stogy. The place needs a major renovation. And you won't know about the $30 facility fee until after you stay!  I booked the hotel for $207 a night and the taxes were $67. I should have asked when booking why the fees were so high. I hope that Biden gets his plan passed to remove these junk fees!

title: New Yorker Hotel.
text: This is a fine hotel. Reasonably priced, for New York. The hotel is very close to subway, literally right outside their doors, and central to many attractions and districts. Our room was very clean and we were very impressed with the water pressure in the shower. Bed was very comfortable and housekeeping was very efficient. We ate at TikTok diner for breakfast and Tratoria Bianca for supper. Both are attached to the hotel. Trattoria was excellent and reasonably priced, and catered to our particular dining requirements concerning allergies and intolerances. Some have mentioned that the hotel is dated, but it is well-kept and quiet and clean. All the staff that we interacted with were friendly and helpful. Highly recommend staying here.

title: The New Yorker
text: Very dated hotel, would not stay here again the building is scruffy, walls need painting.  Small bed in room when asked for another room Reception very unhelpful.  Plus they ask you for 5 dollars to store your case if your room not ready (money maker).  Better Hotels around the area e.g The Reniance Hotel far better.

title: Great location, dated bathrooms
text: We selected the New Yorker based on price and location and we’re not disappointed. Walking distance to many subways and Time Square. We also had a room on 33th floor with an amazing view of the city. That been said, the room itself felt outdated, manly the bathroom. Not a lot of storage as well as we were 4 people (family trip) so luggage were left on the floors. So, I recommend still, based on what is more important for you.

title: You’re paying for a view , and that’s about all you get.
text:
You’re paying for location and history. There is a perceived opulence that falls sort of expectation.
Booked two rooms for a weekend (Fri-Sun) upon arrival there were doormen , however they refused to open doors and just pointed to the turnstile door. No assistance with cabs/ Ubers/luggage or even a hello , good morning that you would expect with an upscale hotel. 

The lobby is spectacular, dripping in lush furniture and ornate decorations. Check in staff was quick and pleasant. Then you’re immediately “heckled” by people at a desk trying to get you to agree to join  some Wyndham thing or another, the last thing you want when you’ve traveled all day is to feel like you’re being heckled as if you’re walking in Times Square while you’re in your hotel lobby.  The rooms have no refrigerator/microwave . 

The beds and bedding are definitely great , we loved that the windows opened for fresh air . Rooms were small but we knew that going in . The common areas had not a speck of dust in sight but found the rooms were not as clean as expected. I kept saying the room feels like a landlord special , painted over hinges peeling paint in the bathrooms. Dust all over the chair rails (molding that goes around the room at shoulder level ) hair in the shower curtains , grimey tiles . The sink does not drain well so you have to turn it off or it will over flow . The hot water was not consistent, while showering and not touching the knobs it would get super cold then super hot etc.

I love the history /design/ location however I’ve had much better stays at lower priced hotels that include breakfast and other amenities that were a miss here.

title: Great for business and for fun!
text:
Mohammed at the front desk took care of me and my business travel needs like a 5 star hotel concierge! I needed to host some meetings but hadn’t booked an adequate room. Mohammed was so helpful in finding me a suitable room, explaining how the parking worked, etc. Very patient and helpful, he really cares! Thanks Mohammed, I’ll be back! 

The hotel is fantastic, very high level of service all around, but not at all snooty! Luggage and security were helpful and considerate. Doorman was great also, he held my bags for an hour while I recovered my car from the parking garage and made my way back in crazy traffic. He then helped me load up the car with a smile. Took away the stress! 

Big thanks to everyone on the great team, keep up the wonderful service! And 5 stars for Mohammed!!

title: New Yorker not a great hotel
text: It is a very busy hotel. The hotel beds are very comfortable  it is going through refurbishment but our room wasn’t good .  The location is good however we arrived early so we  checked in but the room wasn’t ready so we had to pay $5 per bag to hold them. On checkout as well   The rooms are very small we had two grandchildren aged 10 & 13  with us  we  ate in one of their restaurants and it is the only place werre we were charged $3. for using our Revolut card debit .very pricy for what we got.   The area is not too good especially for children. No we won’t return to the Bew Yorker

title: uma ótima opção!
text:
Hotel bem localizado é possível fazer tudo a pé...
quarto pequeno e banheiro tbm, ambientes bem cuidados, limpos, cama boa, chuveiro dificil de regular.
fechamos cedo em NY e foi possível fazer check in antecipado por 50 dólares. 
Sem duvida numa proxima vez em NY ficaria aqui.

title: Pleasant stay at New Yorker
text: Hotel met expectations. Krystal at the front desk was very helpful. I hadn’t been to NYC in awhile and she was very patient in answering my numerous questions. Location is excellent for exploring the city.

title: Great stay
text: Stayed for 5 nights. Room was on the small side and a bit dated but great location and staff. Would go back again. Tik Tok diner great for breakfast. Very helpful staff on checking in and easy checkout.

title: Family stay
text: The room was clean.Look out for facility fee which is added. The location is perfect.The rooms were serviced daily.It is an old hotel but well maintained. Expect just the basics.The staff was friendly. Security is good.

title: Beautiful Iconic Hotel
text:
We are a Family of 10 & recently stayed for 4 nights. The hotel is within walking distance of many of the main tourist sites  Time Square, Empire State Building, Broadway & St Patrick’s.  We flew into Newark & took the air transit to Newark station & took the train to Penn Station, just a short walk from the hotel.  We had 3 2 double bedded rooms. Each room had 2 bathrooms & seating areas & were quite spacious. The beds & pillows were very comfortable.  The staff are really friendly, professional & knowledgeable. 
We visited the Tick Tock Diner, attached to hotel, a couple of times & the food was good. My grandkids preferred the McDonald’s directly across from the hotel to have breakfast. 
We had a wonderful few days in New York City before heading to Disney World, Florida. We all agreed we would love to stay at the New Yorker again when we return to the Citu

title: Menos mal.
text: Bom atendimento e funcionários muito atenciosos. O pequeno almoço incluido é ridiculo. Quartos familiares são um pouco apertados. Muito boa localização, mesmo no centro da cidade e com acesso a transportes mesmo ao lado.

title: Small rooms, older property, great location & service!
text:
This is a vintage property. The rooms are smaller than elsewhere in the US...but it's NYC and is very well located to the Amtrack Station and the Subway.  The staff also took good care of us.  The door to our queen bed room opened right into the bed and our bathroom wreaked of urine - akin to a drunk homeless person.  I informed the front desk and they immediately started working on getting us a different room for transfer at a time that was convenient for our schedule.  Not sure if the housekeeper was cutting corners or if the job needed some extra chemicals.  Either way, they took care of both rooms for us.

They have a security guard at the elevators that checks for room keys to keep guests safer. There is also a cute museum downstairs, and 3 different restaurants (diner, steakhouse, trattoria).

title: 5 nights by Madison Square Gardens
text: Stayed for 5 nights,  well priced,  great location.  Staff friendly,  cleaners were very good. Art Deco hotel opposite Madison Square Gardens and near Penn Station.  Macy's round the corner about 5 mins. Empire State Building about 10 mins away

title: Great stay - recommend the suite
text:
I really loved the foyer of the hotel - it was big, spacious and felt safe and secure with the security on the doors and lifts. 
I was also really pleased with the service and help at reception as I complained our room was too small and we managed to upgrade to a suite with a balcony which viewed the Empire State building, the Statue of Liberty and the Edge platform. It was great to see the views at morning, sunset and at night. However, we did pay extra for the upgrade, although it wasn’t the full amount and it was definitely worth it.

title: Excellent location and value
text:
The location of this hotel is absolute perfection for MSG and the train/metro station. It was also a convenient 15-20 minute walk to see several Broadway shows and other attractions. 
The accommodations were very small, but clean and well maintained. Looking for a hotel in a large city, that is what I’m most concerned with. Security was also top notch and I appreciated having my bags held for $5 each. It was better than shlepping it along…and I picked them up within a minute and  only had to transport them a block from the train station. The bathroom was a similar size to one on a cruise ship. Bedding was nice and reasonably comfortable. I feel like it was a superb value for my money and I’ll definitely be back.

title: WOW
text:
Very beautiful hotel!
Small, but clean rooms.
We were on the 26th floor.
Elevators can be very busy, but we were on holiday, so we didn't mind that.
We also love the history of the hotel, when there you should take the escalator downstair and take a look around.

title: Family visit to NYC
text:
Great stay
We met family here and spent 5 nights at the hotel .
Great place very central to pretty much everything.
Room was small but view of Empire State Building was amazing and it was kept spotlessly clean with daily cleaning .
The bed was really comfy too.
We used the bar several nights and it was great , Stephanie the bar tender was excellent and made suggestions of places to go .
We ate in Tick Tock one day and it was fine , handy and tasty as a diner should be.
We also ate at the Trattoria one night and it was delicious.
Thanks to everyone for a great stay .

title: Bad bad bad
text: Pass your way. This hotel doesn’t deserve any guests and don’t care at all about customers. Rooms are small and old. Personal are rude and impolite. No service. They charge you to keep your luggage...

title: Eine Woche New York City
text:
Nicht ganz preisgünstig, aber die Zimmer waren ordentlich und sauber und das Personal sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. 
Positiv: Die Lage! Die ist absolut genial, da sehr zentral.
Negativ. Es gab sehr wenig Ablagefläche im Zimmer, insbesondere im Bad. Allerdings haben wir und ein Doppelzimmer zu dritt geteilt, vielleicht lag es daran.

title: Family holiday exploring New York
text:
Family of 4 children aged 6&8. Central hotel located by Penn station great for airport links and getting around newyork, friendly & helpful staff clean rooms and super comfy beds. We were on floor 25 but they had quick lifts skipping the first 20 floors so no waiting around. Also have good TV channels available. 
We tried both restaurants on site really good food and friendly staff.

title: Great location!
text:
Location was superb even though it was further away from Times Square than I’d normally stay. We took the Airtrain from JFK and then LIRR to Penn Station which was daunting but easy once we’d got started. Check in was quick and directed which lift to use. Once we found the room we we’re disappointed, it was tired and dated with wallpaper coming away from the walls (room 1965) with a view of a brick wall! The draft and noise coming through the windows, even with the curtains closed was massive and the lock on the door was broken. For two women travelling alone, this wasn’t ideal. The positives were the beds, two bathrooms and housekeeping who kept us supplied with clean towels and made up room daily. The shower was also really powerful but varied in temperature.
The price of the hotel wasn’t cheap, in fact on par with all other mid range hotels that I’d previously stayed at but I wasn’t impressed and wouldn’t stay again.

title: Great location but disgraceful hotel
text: We were checked in by the general manager and he was rude and disrespectful. He barely even looked at us let alone welcome us and continuously said credit card! Credit card!  Not one single please or thank you. Appalling service to receive on your first evening of arrival. Room was thick with dust. Hotel run down, old fashioned and in need of a serious make over! Rooms were so small you couldn’t swing a cat in there. Window let in a horrible draft that left you really cold and the thin sheets barely helped keep you warm. Hotel location was great but everything else is shocking. Will never be back

title: It's a fake four star hotel
text: The room was a reasonable size but somewhat dated. It had several fixtures broken and just looked well used. The hotel's location was great. Just expect a three-star hotel and not a four-star hotel. They also charge for storing bags, something we had not encountered before.

title: Super expérience
text: J’ai adoré mon séjour à l’hotel The NEW YORKER. Le personnel était très accueillant et la chambre avait une vue magnifique. L’hotel était en plein centre de Manhattan et facilement accessible à toute les attractions. Je le recommande vivement pour un court sejour à NYC.

title: Renovation
text: The amount that is asked to stay at this location does not meet up with how the property is presented to the public. This hotel needs an overall renovation floor to floor. It shouldn’t be that we are using tape to hide the seams on the carpet.

title: Faded Splendour
text: This hotel is a piece of New York history and it was a great place to stay. Location was great (a bit noisy). The history exhibition is an absolute must see. The only thing that let it down was the cleanliness which is more to do with the age and patina of the original fittings - which is the whole point of staying there!

title: A nice stay in a great location in NYC
text:
The location of the hotel is great, its very central and can access all NYC from 34th street subway and Penn station. We walked to all major attractions from there within 30-40 minutes. You need to have your wits about you walking down 8th avenue from Times Square, it can be a bit "animated" especially around Port Authority bus station. I recommend taking a right and immediate left through 34th street upto 6th or 7th avenue and walk from there - Just my personal opinion.  

The hotel itself is quite old and the rooms are very small but functional. Bed is comfortable and the rooms and hotel in general are kept very clean. The staff are very helpful and have good security. 

Overall for the price we paid it was good value - If returning to NYC I think I would prefer to stay closer to the rockafeller plaza or that side of town but again thats just personal preference.

title: A great stay
text: Comfy and perfectly placed as a base to explore the Big Apple from! We loved the art deco hotel and the friendly staff. We'd love to stay again in the future... already dreaming of another trip to New York!

title: It's up to you, New York, New York
text: Great hotel in an excellent location. Friendly staff, clean rooms, opulent interior. Easy access to the subway and easy walking Uptown and Downtown and between the streets and avenues. Straightforward to navigate if you keep your wits about you. Plenty to see and do in the locality. All big ticket attractions are within a 30 minute stroll. Subway will get you as far north or south within the same time. Area appears safe. We would go back in heartbeat.

title: Nice hotel, clean rooms and Friendly staff. Rooms could use an update.
text:
Nice hotel, clean rooms and Friendly staff. Rooms could use an update.
Location is great. Especially if you want to goto a concert at Madison Square Garden. Tickets Tock restaurant beloofd is Super! Also for breakfast!

title: Very good hotel in excellent location
text: The location (adjacent to 34th street subway entrance and 200 m from Penn Station) is excellent. The room was very good (clean and spacious) and the adjacent family restaurant fully adequate). Price a little high ($250 for two-bedded room) but that comes with the locataion. Fully recommended.

title: Uitstekend hotel
text: Goed hotel en qua ligging zeker geweldig. Kamers zijn recentelijk gerenoveerd en schoon. Beveiliging bij de liften, zodat enkel hotelgasten worden toegelaten. Was hier voor de 3e keer en een volgende keer zou ik weer voor dit hotel kiezen.

title: Fun in new york
text:
Stayed in new yorker for four nights. 
Lovely hotel with nice and helpful staff. 
The location is great alot of attractions within walking distance and close to bus and rail. 
Our room was small clean with a comfortable bed .
Would stay again when going back to new york.

title: Does what it says- great for location
text:
Don’t expect bells and whistles but a great location, clean rooms and a bit of history. You can get anywhere in NYC from here with ease. 

We enjoyed our stay. It was great for a first trip to New York. We had a good base to explore from and we’re close to major touristy things. A stones throw from Madison Square Garden too so perfect if you have an event.

title: Not attentive to details or quick to resolve issues
text: We waited 1 hr 15 minutes for someone to come to our room to turn on the hot water (the guy needed a wrench the knob was so stuck).  Needed a roll of toilet paper, waited 2 1/2 hours late at night and no one showed up, eventually had to go to the lobby and get my own roll.  Heater was inconsistent and would not stay on or move when pushing the buttons.

title: Great location, clean enough for Manhattan
text: Stayed 5 nights with family. The location is amazing for tourists, right in the centre of Manhattan, close to all the main attractions. The hotel itself is rather beautiful, in a faded art deco style. The room was not particularly big but had a coffee maker, fridge, iron, drawers and great view. It was clean enough but everything feels like it could do with a clean and redecoration. Staff were helpful  when we needed anything. The area round the hotel has loads of takeaways, shops and restaurants but can feel a bit edgy, especially at night. The hotel has a lot of rooms and seems very popular so was always extremely busy, lots of people in lobby, lifts etc. Lack of included breakfast was the biggest downside, because everything is so eye wateringly expensive in Manhattan.

title: OK hotel
text: The hotel is well placed for many tourists places you'd vist  eg Empire state,  Madison Square Gardens, Central park, Broadway the list goes on.  Room clean and bedding, towels changed every day .  TV  in the room but out most hours , sadly no kettle to make drinks , but iron and ironing board . 3 restaurants in hotel , we never used and a gym never used , but run in Central Park .

title: Will be back
text: Great location and beautiful Art Deco hotel. Very close to Madison Square Garden and everything else midtown offers. Lobby was gorgeous. Room was small but that was expected. View from room was fantastic. Will definitely stay again.

title: Concert hideout
text: The hotel was very nice, especially if you like art deco. The rooms are small but you are in Manhattan. We booked to stay after a concert at MSG and it's a short walk to and from to avoid the rush to Penn station or Grand Central to catch a train. We also found staff to be extremely helpful to resolve any issues you might encounter. Would book again!

title: Our worst hotel choice ever
text:
Terrible hotel to stay six nights. We often travel around the world and this hotel was the worst in a long time. The hotel lobby was great and the staff at the reception was quick.
The room was really old fashioned, worn and shabby small one. 
Usually the best thing on vacation is the hotel breakfast, but here at the Tick Tock restaurant it was terrible. We had ordered breakfast, but on the first morning we were served coffee, some juice and two pieces of toast. Is it breakfast? The next morning, it was accompanied by an omelette and potatoes. An incredibly bad start to the days. The waiters were grumpy.
Never again this hotell.

title: In the heart of the city
text: A hotel with a long history (recommend the gallery exhibits on the ground floor) which had cozy rooms. I stayed here with my daughter for a work trip while she visited New York City. The central location makes it easy to hop onto the subway or get to the train station, and the rooms weren't noisy.

title: Decent stay
text:
Rooms not big but was expected. Comfy beds and pillows. Kept clean daily. Used Tik Tok diner and our food wasn't great at all and never went back.
I would give the hotel 5/5 but I emailed twice for an upgrade as it was our 27th wedding anniversary to be told they would attach a note to our booking. I emailed again about upgrade with fridge and coffee making facilities to be given a room with a back alley view.

title: Good Hotel - Horrible Food
text: The room is fine, we will go back. The Tik-Tok restaurant is absolutely horrible. We could not eat some of what we ordered. STAY AWAY from Tik-Tok. The server struggled to speak english but she tried

title: Great Staff makes for a great stay
text: I visited the New Yorker Hotel during the second last week of March 2023 with my 12 YO daughter.  I have been on many trips in my life and this is the first review that I have ever left.  My stay at the New Yorker Hotel was very much made much better due to the caring, friendly, and professional check in representative Afrozeh.  Afrozeh was caring, friendly, professional, preceptive, and hardworking.  She is a great example of what a hotelier should be.  Without a doubt she improved my daughter and I's trip and is a good example that most people in the world are good, and good people always make a great difference in the lives of others.   I am happy to have met Afrozeh along my journey of life.

title: Gutes Hotel
text:
Wir wurden einquartiert in der 23 Etage mit Blick Richtung Hudson River. Der Ausblick war grandios.
Wären im Zimmer nicht die USB-Anschlüsse da, könnte man sich die 30 er Jahre vorstellen. Die Zimmergrösse, Ausstattung und Sauberkeit entsprach dem bezahlten Preis. Wir waren sehr zufrieden.
In diesem Hotel hat Sir Nikola Tesla seine letzten 10 Lebensjahre verbracht.

title: Great location
text: The location is great and rooms clean and tidy. It is not the most modern but the slightly retro building is a good experience and place to stay. It is only a short walk to the station so you can access most of NYC from here.

title: Recomendable
text:
El hotel está muy bien ubicado, a media cuadra de penn station y a 5 de la terminal de buses. 
Es un hotel viejo ( como la mayoría de NY) restaurado, el personal es súper amable salvo la gente del bar donde se desayuna , íbamos a pedir agua caliente a la noche y no la cobraban pero el personal de la mañana si, rarísimo eso o avivada la verdad no se. 
Éramos 3 y nos dieron una habitación con dos cañas “dobles” pero la que compartíamos no era tan cómoda para dos la verdad y el colchón súper blando, lo que sí teníamos dos baños y dos armarios, entiendo que era una habitación que en algún momento estuvo dividida. 
En el piso que estábamos había expendedora de hielo, máquina de gaseosas y golosinas. 

Hotel recomendable por su ubicación, el check in es a las 16hs y les guardan las valijas por 5dolares cada una.

title: Cigarette smoke
text: Someone was constantly smoking inside the hotel close to our room. I had to address it at least five times with the front desk and security. Two horrible nights with getting headaches from the smell, lack of action from the hotel staff. Only after third day and me insisting on it they found the person.

title: Great place to stay
text: Very well placed hotel to visit the sights. Out room was a good size with a fridge but no kettle. Check in was quick and we were fortunate to be upgraded to a bigger room with a view. Comfortable bed. Tick tock diner is great for meals. Great value for money in a very nice hotel

title: Wonderful Stay, Will Stay Again
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at the New Yorker Hotel for a short getaway. We arrived on a Wednesday and were able to check in fairly quickly. While the website states that check in is not until 4, we were thankfully able to check in early around 1. This allowed us to drop off our luggage and start on our long list of activities right way. We were on the 35th floor and the view was amazing. Our room overlooked Penn Station and we could see all the way down to the south end of Manhattan when the sky was clear. I loved that the window opened and we were able to sleep listening to the sounds of the city.

The room itself was a bit small, which was expected given the age of the hotel. It wasn't really an issue for us as we were only in the room for sleeping and were gone all day. But if you are traveling in a larger group or with family, you may want a suite so that you have room to gather and hang out.

The price was way less than expected for the part of town we were in and honestly comparable to places that I stay when I travel around the Midwest.

Overall we were very impressed our stay and will most likely stay here again if we ever get the chance to visit New York again.

title: New York Celebration
text: Came to celebrate a 40th birthday of son. Great location for all our activities. Felt safe and very much enjoyed our time at the New Yorker. Midtown is the place to be for good access to much of New York City. Good for food, good for shows good for shopping.

title: Great hotel with a great location
text: We had a wonderful experience at The New Yorker. The check-in staff was kind and helpful, the room was well-appointed and clean, and the location is fantastic for exploring Manhattan. We used the subway for transportation during our stay, and there is an entrance just around the corner for the trains that service Manhattan. I had read some reviews about the elevators being out of service, but we never had an issue with that while we were there. The only drawback we found was that there is no coffee pot in the room. There is a daily fee to have a keurig in the room ($15/day), and it wasn't worth it to us. There is a McDonald's right across the street, so we just got coffee there. There is also a coffee bar and diner-style restaurant in the lobby, but we never tried those. Overall, it was a great experience!

title: Stayed at the New Yorker, will return!
text: The location cannot be beat if you are traveling by rail.   Bear in mind that the hotel was built in 1929, so the rooms are compact, but the service was great, there's a wonderful diner attached to the hotel, and there's an exhibit downstairs on the history of the hotel.  I had no idea that Nikola Tesla lived there for 10 years!

title: Vintage coziness!
text: Small, cozy room (ask for a room with a desk IF you need one at check-in) - ours did NOT have a desk (but it didn't matter!)  The old plaster walls were incredibly soundproof!  Bed super comfy!  Temperature controls very effective!  Loved the vintage fixtures in the bathroom!  The New Yorker is classic and staying there is an experience in and of itself!  Do not expect "modern hotel" spaciousness because you'll get something better!  A historical vibe that calls to mind all the past generations who've come and stayed before you!  Basement has a historical review of hotel's history.  Location is great for MSG events!

title: Feo y caro
text: Un hotel muy viejo y poco mantenido, la decoración ni los colchones se han cambiado en 100 años. Bien ubicado pero muy caro para lo que en verdad ofrece, no te dejes engañar con el desayuno, significa que lo sirven en su restaurante pero no está incluido, ok 👌

title: Exquisitely Designed Suites
text: Perfectly encapsulating our status on Fifth Avenue. Each accommodation is stunningly appointed and flawlessly furnished, from our two-bedroom suites to our lavish Presidential Suite. Original elements such as crystal Waterford chandeliers and elegant crown moldings are accented with beautiful

title: Cercherò di evitare questo hotel nel futuro
text: Una suite per 3 giorni…. Dello spazio di una stanza normale presso qualunque altro hotel …. Ma questo è’ il meno perché a NY si sa che anche pagando circa 800 dollari a notte gli spazi sono ridotti… ma arrivando manca il valet … ho il coraggio di lamentarmi alla reception e mi chiamano qualcuno fisicamente molto imponente che con fare tutt’altro che cordiale e disponibile mi risponde in modo quasi aggressivo dicendo che il servizio Valet non esiste da anni e che in più non è’ mai stato gestito da loro!!! Provate poi a chiamare per chiedere informazioni… risposte chiaramente infastidite e ancora una volta poco cordiali e disponibili…. Per riassumere… io personalmente non sceglierò mai più questo hotel se non per stretta necessità’.

title: Perfect location.
text: We had a great stay. Other than needing to be updated everything was fantastic. Location and service were superb. Walking distance to Broadway, empire state building and Hudson yards. Penn Station is right across the street. No taxis needed .

title: Service is exceptional.  Great location and views are spectacular!
text: We stayed 4 nights for a fun getaway to NYC with friends and family.  I just want to say what a wonderful experience we had during our vacation.  We had a little issue with our first room's bathroom and the staff took it upon themselves to find us a new room.  Not only did they find a new room, but they upgraded us to a suite on the top floor of the hotel.  It was perfect!!  It was very spacious and the views were spectacular.  Any time we had a question or request during our stay, the hotel staff was so friendly and patient and accommodating.  We have stayed at the New Yorker before and will definitely plan to stay again!!!  Thank you for going above and beyond our expectations!!

title: If you’re looking for a 4-star-hotel, don’t book this
text: This hotel unfortunately didn’t do justice to the 4 stars it holds. The only positive aspect was the location. The room was way too small and the bed felt small for two people. Also the bathroom is super old with an old bathtub. Also there’s no tea/coffee or even minibar in the room. Super unhappy.

title: FINAL TASK 3
text:
One of my best trips ! I’m so sad to be back..
I visited THE monument I wanted to visit, The Brooklyn Bridge! Pass by this bridge which offers us an unforgettable view and memories.
Without forgetting the unforgettable Times Square, with its lights and the incredible crowd there was. It was amazing! I really liked, i didn't get tired of it
How to pass a trip to New York without going through Central Park? Its acres of grass, the ideal place for family picnics in a peaceful setting.

Who says New York says food!
We started with Mac and cheese at Beecher's, an artisan cheese maker who also offers... its little pots of mac and cheese, ready to eat to go!
We also discovered the Lobster Roll, it's a lobster-based sandwich served in a hot dog bun, Ed's Lobster Bar in Soho for the best Lobster Roll in New York.

Unfortunately we didn't have time to visit all of New York, but if I come back I would like to visit: Empire State Building, Ellis Island and the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Great Location, Great Hotel
text:
Short trip to NYC with my son and we stayed in the New Yorker.
It’s a bit tired but the process of updating rooms has started so it will be better in time.
This said, we had everything we needed. 
The location was central. Within walking distance of all we wanted.
Our room had 2 queen size beds. We looked down towards the Hudson River.
Our bathroom had the best shower ever. Plenty of towels, travel size toiletries and a hairdryer.
Coffee and creamer was provided as well.
Staff were always pleasant.
It’s a great place to stay.

title: Would recommend
text: I had stayed here many years ago and the property was definitely looking and feeling a bit tired.  However this was not the case on my recent stay when everything was updated, staff was personable and professional, location is still great.  Would highly recommend.

title: My favorite Hotel in NYC Centrally located
text: Love this hotel and its central location close to all attractions of the Big Apple. Accros the street from Madison Square Garden, one block away from Penn Train Station. I highly recommend it to everyone visiting NYC for business or pleasure.

title: Hit and miss
text:
Decent hotel, good location (though 8th Ave is a hub for homeless people constantly asking you for money). The room was pretty small and basic but it’s all we really needed given it was just a place to sleep at night. The only downside was that the duvet was insanely thin and the TV was quite blurry. 

Check in was quick, they took my debit card and immediately took $300 ($100 for the facility fee which they keep and $200 for the security deposit which I’m waiting to get back) which was a bit jarring but it is what it is - what i felt wasn’t fair is that despite paying this facility fee it costed $30 PER DAY to use the coffee machine in the room which was just a basic machine with some plain coffee pods. It was also another $30 I think per day to have a mini fridge in your room, which I thought was odd as most places you have complimentary coffee/tea and usually a mini fridge with a mini bar which costs. 

Anyways after checking in we we called over by a girl at the adjacent desk who started giving us a presentation about their new hotel that’s opening across town, and asked us for a $40 deposit for a ticket to tour the new hotel the following day in return for a gift card and the $40 back, (we had just had a horrendus 12 hour travel day and all we wanted was to get to our room and finally lie down) so we asked if we could book it later on as we were exhausted and really just wanted to get to our room and settle in but she persisted on booking us in for this tour and explaining about their resorts all over the country and their perks etc - I get it’s her job to recruit people but read the room guys, we just wanted to get to our room and drop our bags!

So we got to our room $300 (nearly $340) lighter and yeah it was okay, I did hope for a a view not of a brick wall but I imagine that would’ve been an extra cost also. 

Check out was easy, $5 per bag if you want to leave it in the lobby if your check out is much earlier than your flight and you’ve got time to to kill in the city. 

Because of the extra costs I probably wouldn’t stay there again, as the costs you end up spending might as well be spent to stay at a better hotel.

title: Not my favorite, so sorry
text:
Disappointed. Luckily we stayed only for one night on our way to Washington DC by train. The location was good near Penn Station though. But like often near stations you can expect smell of weed everywhere. 
Very crowded and fuzzy in the lobby since there was some kind of youth happening nearby. The room was outdated to say the least, and very small. You could almost hit the toilet seat closing the door. The bed was not very comfortable. The window was small and the view was the opposite brick wall. Sorry, but cannot recommend this hotel.

title: Great view at a historic hotel
text:
I enjoyed my stay at The New Yorker. Very conveniently located near the train station and has subway access just outside. I also enjoyed looking through the mini museum they have on the basement level. There is a lot of rich history at this hotel and I hope they continue to preserve it in their renovations. 
Yes, the rooms are small, but that is to be expected staying in the heart of NYC.  My room had a Keurig and a mini fridge.  I saw some reviews saying they didn’t have that. The room was kind of perpetually damp. I think that has more to do with the weather while we staying. The paint around the bathroom windows was peeling due to the lack of ventilation in the bathroom. I suggest cracking the window open while bathing to help prevent this. (Yes, you can open the windows a little in this historic hotel) The bathtub was solid, cast iron. I believe it may be original and re glazed, along with the tiles on the wall. The bathroom was about half the size of the room. What we sacrificed in space we gained in a view though. We had a lovely view of the Empire State Building from our bed. 
Room service is available here, granted it’s not brought on a cart or on China. It is brought in bags in to go containers. It was prompt and friendly. My only complaint is they should use better quality plastic ware for the cutlery. 
Overall, we had a very nice stay at The New Yorker, and would recommend it for anyone that wants to stay in the center of the city with easy access to everything.

title: Close to everything, send the extra cash on the view!
text: Would have given 5 circles but there we a ton of people in the evening but not many elevators on line. We booked through booking.com and got a great rate, then a week before arrival got an offer for  a high floor with a view for an extra $34 a night. SO WORTH IT!  We lucked out with a view that included the Chrysler and Empire state buildings. Near times Square, trains, Madison Square garden, on several bus routes and near subway.

title: Not worth the price, staff will harass you
text:
When you walk into The New Yorker expect a 10-15 min wait to check in, not including the people who have been waiting even longer. No apologies offered just them in the back chatting. (March 5th 9:30 PM)

When you arrive at the elevator if you’re  on floor 20-40 expect there to be only 2 that actually work and are over crowded so you may end up waiting an additional 15 min to even get to your room. (March 5-9th ongoing)

When you arrive at your room at the 33rd floor have the expectations that your room will smell like kitty litter and cat pee… they chalk it up to “the hotels haunted” yet those smells are USUALLY associated with meth soo. You be the judge. (Room 3329 march 5-9 ongoing)

EXPECT to be harassed by staff…. They had some high school convention going on and they constantly tried to stop me and my bf from coming into the hotel (classist/homophobic?) AND leaving because we “looked young.” They legit made him pull out his ID to be able to walk out the lobby.  (March 7th 2AM) 

I want to elaborate on the high school group, when I say they pick and choose who to harass i mean they had no issue letting those kids run around the entire hotel, mess around on the elevators and basically run a muck anywhere but the lobby. It was rather ridiculous. Like if you don’t trust people to be staying here out scanners in the elevators, don’t bug every person in sweats and a tee shirt walking in. 

I paid more than I pay in rent to stay here for a total of four nights and I’ll say it’s not worth it. They are overpriced for what you get. They will harass you if you don’t fit the “New York Look” and they simply don’t care about their guests. I’d suggest spending the extra $100 a night and going somewhere that isn’t complete trash.

title: Short break
text: Great location easy walk to broadway, Empire State  building, Macey’s Flat iron district, Little Italy  Time Square, Madam Tussauds and also recommend the big bus open top bus hop on hop off. Hotel rooms are  clean comfortable with very helpful staff on reception .

title: Worst hotel in New York
text: What a disappointment, staff waking me up when signs on door, broken glass in hallway when getting ice, which I stepped on, and no help from staff, the place stinks of cannabis, and when I complained they couldn't give a bollox, I'm allergic to cannabis, what a horrible place,

title: Schönes Zimmer, perfekte Lage
text:
Wir wir waren als Familie in diesem Hotel und sehr zufrieden. Die Betten sehr gemütlich und das Zimmer sehr sauber. Handtücher immer ausreichend vorhanden. 
Die Lage war ausgezeichnet. Metro direkt vor der Tür. In wenigen Gehminuten ist man direkt am Times Square. 
Autovermietung ist auch gleich ums Eck.

title: New Yorker stay
text: It was my first time staying in New York City. This hotel was in the perfect location for visiting the city and had an amazing time. Good location to enjoy some hockey just across the street from MSG. Great location to walk to attractions like Empire State Building and The Edge Observatory. The staff was awesome and the food was great. Will definitely be staying there anytime I come back to visit more.

title: decent, recently remodeled rooms
text: I enjoyed staying in a clean, newly appointed room in this centrally located art deco hotel.  Subway very nearby as well as major attractions, decent exercise room,  3 good restaurants attached to the lobby depending on the types of meals you are looking for.

title: Great Hotel Stay - 2 double bed room
text: Hôtel is iconic, art deco style, characterful. Great mid town central location.  Close to Penn Station and Subway.  Beds were a little smaller than what you expect in the States but it was fine. We had an amazing view from our room. Can’t fault the stay.  Would definitely return if back in NYC again. Thanks to Jason the Concierge,  who was very helpful.

title: A First Class Experience
text:
The New Yorker is one great hotel. Everything about it is right e.g. location - midtown and near so many places such as Macy's, Madison Square Gardens, Penn Station, Times Square and is less than a block from subway stops.
The New Yorker is affordable with a variety of good size rooms and suites for most budgets - the room prices are very competitive and the value for the money is excellent. It is a part of the Wyndham group and you can use points plus cash, all points or at the very least collect points during your stay. Full disclosure I have a Wyndham card and pretty much stay at their branded hotels.
We found the accommodations super clean, well appointed with a comfortable bed, quality linens, towels and toiletries. The powerful shower had a safety bar which as a senior is important to me. The mini refrigerator, and room safe are features I like. 
Without exception the staff are first rate from check-in receptionists, housekeeping and suited security in the lobby who btw are always there checking access to elevators 24/7. Speaking of elevators they are segmented by flights of floor e.g. there are express elevators dedicated to floors 20 through 40. 
The Tic Tock diner just off the lobby never closes and is there regardless of when you are hungry. We liked the Tic Tock and did not try the other two restaurants also located just off the lobby.
The entire hotel is well maintained and we noticed nothing that needed painting, repair or replacement. 
We did not have a car and can not comment on parking. The Wi-fi which is included in the price was always available and did not drop off even once.
Over the course of our eight day stay we saw numerous groups staying there so it seems popular with conventioneers too. Even with the many guests we found the accommodations to be exceptionally quiet.
I would recommend, without hesitation, the New Yorker for any business or tourist traveller such as singles, couples, families or groups looking for a quality, affordable stay in New York City.

title: Great Location in NYC
text: Stayed here 4 nights but booked only really for sleeping in. Our room was pretty small & basic but had everything we needed. No tea/coffee facilities in room but you can get for an additional fee. Lobby very grand & good security as they ask to see your key before you get to the lifts so felt safe. Great view of the Empire State Building from our room. Room cleaned every day & fresh towels left. Great location as only 10/15 minute walk to Empire State Building/Times Square & right next to Penn Subway line. Couple of restaurants attached & plenty cafes/fast food places close by. Madison Square Gardens just across the road. Friendly staff & would stay again.

title: Front Desk Staff are Exceptional
text: I have been to NYC 13 times since 2017.  Samira, Ramona treat me like family and they are the sole reason I always stay here.  In this day and age where customer service is at an all time low, the staff here are fantastic.

title: Excellent location, a perfect place to stay
text:
Che I in was a little slow as it was s busy, but to be fair we had arrived 2 hours early. Staff were patient and polite despite being beer pressure to check a many in. The lobby was very impressive and staff helpful friendly and polite throughout the hotel. Our room was clean and always made up beautifully every morning.
It’s location was superb for everything we wanted to visit, especially for our fist night concert at Maddison Square Gardens.

title: Good stay, stylish but outdated. Beds amazing
text:
I was in NYC with my wife (late 40s) for a second city break, for 4 days. 
Good:
The hotel is old and outdated and needs a full refit. Some will see that as bad, but I love the old Art Deco styling (see photos)
Staff were very helpful
Lifts were good. Like 5-6 for floors 1-20 and other side for 21-40. Only had a longish wait once.
On-site restaurant food is good, as is the ticktock diner, albeit expensive.
Location is excellent, certainly from transport perspective. Penn station is round corner which is a main hub. You can get easily to JFK via airtrain, LIRR, subway
Beds are amazing, so comfortable, we both  had great sleeps

Bad:
Rooms very small. We 'upgraded' to a room with a view. Not sure about that!
Not a fault with hotel per se, but the area stinks of weed. Like every few shops is a weed shop. Since it was legalised here, it has ruined new york in my opinion. Some seems into the hotel which can't be helped
Time share sharks in lobby too

Real bad: 
£200 damage assurance fee on credit card
What we are not told by uk holidays is the £25 (incl taxes) daily 'facilities' fee you have to pay when at hotel. Funnily enough, that's close in value to that deposit you have to put down. Now the cynic in me says....

title: Not a 4* Hotel experience
text:
The surrounding area is very daunting and intimidating.
The hotel was very outdated.
They do not have the normal facilities experienced in a 4* hotel, such as tea and coffee making facilities in your room and they have hidden charges to be aware of? Ask before you book?

title: Awesome place to stay!
text: I do not even consider staying elsewhere in NYC. Clean place and very efficient staff. I have been staying here for every trip to NYC and am very satisfied, prices are reasonable. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing place, great view
text: Best hotel i have stayed in aol of my six trips to NYC. Amazing restaurants and great services, people there are great! Hope to stay there again soon enough, hope in 2023 yet. cost effective for sure!

title: 7 days NYC Trip
text:
Das Hotel liegt wirklich ideal als Ausgangspunkt zum erkunden von NYC. Subway, Zug und Bus direkt um die Ecke. Post, etliche Einkaufsmöglichkeiten und Restaurants unmittelbar erreichbar. Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, Bryant Park und The Time Square rasch fußläufig zu erreichen. 
Das Hotel ist zwar in die Jahre gekommen, besonders das Bad zeigte dies deutlich, war aber sauber und gepflegt und hatte vielleicht gerade deswegen einen besonderen Charme. Am Personal gab es nichts auszusetzen.
Wir würden auf jeden Fall wieder dieses Hotel wählen.

title: I HAVE A MISSING SUNGLASSES FROM MY ROOM
text: I left my sunglasses in my room and there where missing.  I notifided with the security person and after that I talked with the Manager (I don't know her name) and never give me a solution. She told me the hotel had to notify to the insurance company as a claim and wait until have an answer.  I completed and sign a claim or notify form you asked to, and didn't have any answer¡¡¡

title: Room is not good
text:
Room is not good, furniture is old, room windows are not clean which totally deceives the view.
Internet speed is very bad. Except that it is in the center of the manhattan there's nothing this hotel can offer.

title: Great stay, Great Location
text:
We stayed as a family of 3 (2 adults and a 7 year old) in room 3201 on the 32nd Floor with a view towards the Hudson. I was expecting a small room but it was huge. Could have easily fit in 3 queen size beds and still have room to move around. The room was clean although a little outdated

No fridge or kettle was a little disappointing. The bathroom was also quite small and it took a while for the shower to get hot, but it did have great water pressure.

The gym was decent enough with a good selection of cardio and fixed weights machines. Plenty of sanitisers and a cold water filter. It could have done with Air Con though as was quite warm. 

We arrived at 2pm and were checked in straight away with no queues. The reception staff were lovely. The hotel felt safe with room cards being checked for everyone approaching the lifts. 

There were 5 lifts serving floors 1-19 and 5 for floors 20-40. The lifts were quite slow but didn't have to wait for more than a few minutes max. They did often stop on many floors and filled up quickly in peek times.

The lobby has seating you can wait in for check-in and check-out, but no toilets as they all require a room key to access. 

The steakhouse looked amazing, although we didn't try it. 

The tick tock diner was a little dated but was a good experience. Good food and a lot of staff working hard. 

The location wise it's perfect. Right next to Penn station with a subway access point on the corner meaning you don't even have to cross a road to access the subway. Can see both Maddisonw square garden and the empire state from the entrance. Has a CVS, Duane Reed, McDonalds and Starbucks within 30 seconds from the front door. Also right next to Liberty Bagel (home of the rainbow bagel).

The area is very busy and lots of crazies walking the streets but felt safe at all times. 

If we were to stay in Manhatten we would happily stay there again.

title: 16th birthday celebrations in New York
text: Visited with family for 16th birthday celebrations, having emailed the hotel to inform we were treated to a suite on the 40th floor, amazing views. Great location, very good value for money. The coffee at tick tock was the best we had in New York. Very clean and friendly.

title: Gus
text:
Ideal location on 8th Ave. clean and efficient rooms and excellent service.
Would recommend for family groups in NYC for sightseeing. Right next to Moynihan Train Hall Penn Station for subway and LIRR to JFK airport

title: ACKNOWLEDGE YOUR EMAILS
text:
I have booked this hotel for a trip this November 17-21 st 2023 and they have taken a full prepayment of 1,000 dollars when I selected to pay on arrival. I have messaged, called, AND emailed them and they have not responded once.  I feel this is my only option now to post this review.

Terrible customer service.

title: Hôtel très bien placé
text: Nous avons réservé au New York erreur pour un séjour de 5 nuits.  L'hôtel est idéalement situé pour pouvoir visiter à la fois top of the rock, le musée d'histoire naturelle, centrale Park et de l'autre Mannhatan. A 2 min à pied du madison square garden, l'hôtel reste très silencieux. La chambre est très propre. Un tout petit bémol pour le petit déjeuner..nous avions réservé les petits déjeuners avec notre agence. Quand vous arrivez, on vous donne des coupons qui ne vous donnent droit qu'à une assiette de 2 toasts ou 1 muffin ou 1 croissant..niveau boisson, rien à dore car le café est à volonté. Dommage..sinon super expérience.on recommande

title: Horrible experience
text: Multiple issues throughout stay and staff always unwilling and/or unable to help. Have contacted the hotel multiple times to discuss but they don't even bother getting back to you. Staff were unfriendly, even mean. Bathroom not cleaned properly. Very noisy. Tick tock room service unavailable. Staff constantly too busy to assist during stay (if you call the front desk they just hang up on you).

title: Homeless shelter
text: Stay away hotel is filthy and extremely dangerous just ask the police officer on the corner who advised me to get a refund before I even checked in. They would not refund my money got to the room it was the size of the closet and filthy hadn't been updated in 50 years. On my way to the room I had three people offered to sell me drugs

title: Amazing service from the staff, would recommend.
text:
We had the loveliest stay in this hotel. Mainly thanks to the amazing staff that work here. You can really tell the staff love their jobs and love to help people. Mohammad on reception was absolutely wonderful. Unfortunately on our first night we were in a room with a noisy group of youngsters next to us who kept us up all night and we could hear everything (including the toilet flushing, them talking, their alarm etc.) so we went to reception and asked to be moved and met the wonderful Mohammad who couldn't do enough for us. He let us view multiple rooms to ensure we were happy with our final choice and ultimately ended up upgrading us which was such a wonderful gesture. It really enhanced our stay and we felt he was really understanding of the frustration of being woken up all night so he really went above and beyond. We aren't complainers and hate complaining therefore we felt so relieved he was so amazing and understanding with what we were saying. That is genuinely the kind of customer service every hotel needs as he was just amazing throughout and I cannot thank him enough! It really enhanced our stay here as we slept amazingly for the rest of our week. 

The beds are super comfy although the duvets are thin so we did have to sleep with the heating on to keep us warm. 

The rooms are a decent enough size, we enjoyed the built in wardrobes which we could store one of our big suitcases in. Rooms come with a hairdryer which works well and iron + ironing board. 

We ate breakfast in the Tick Tock restaurant in the hotel most mornings and built a rapport with a wonderful waiter called Cosmas. He is from Greece initially and truly the most wonderful human. He remembered our drinks order by our second visit and his customer service is just so on point. We had such a laugh with him and again, he just went above and beyond every time without fail.

We were genuinely so sad to be leaving New York and the hotel which doesn't happen often! We are regular travellers but this hotel will always hold a special place in my heart and I would definitely stay again!

The location is amazing! Ideal for going to Madison square garden too as it is literally across the road!

The metro is opposite the hotel (34 st) + Penn station so it is so easy to travel further afield. Times Square is a 10 minute walk and Central Park or the water front with the sea, air & space museum & circle line tours are 30 min walk. So everything literally within walking distance if you enjoy walking and if not, just jump on the metro which again is so easy to navigate!

Upon leaving the hotel, we were then met with a guy who was organising taxis to the airport. I cannot remember his name which is frustrating but it was on Sunday 19th Feb. He asked us if we needed a taxi to the airport which we said no we had an uber booked and he asked what price the uber quoted which was $91 and he said he can sort a taxi for us for $80 fixed rate. So we agreed and again he was amazing. 

Overall, if you have read this much then you must be interested in this hotel haha and I would genuinely recommend staying here and would stay here again. 

Thank you New Yorker, it's been a pleasure!

title: Needs massive improvement!
text:
Pro's; 
-Good location. 
-Bath with hot water (although bath needed some attention!) 

Cons;
- Very tired- the room and hotel really needs some money spent to improve. It was cramped,paint was peeling off the walls and bath, sheet was stained, headboard was peeling,cracked main lampshade and the catpet is just horrific. Bath plug looked like it was from when the building was first built and the actual bath fixture let the water drain out. The chest of drawers had a handle snapped off and the top drawer would keep opening. 
- Not very helpful on front desk (they couldn't care less!) Checked in and was given the wrong room number.. then had to lug all my bags down from the 27th floor back to the reception to sort. 
- Facilities fees- charged an extra $22 per night plus 2xtaxes for the "facilities". These include having a phone in your room(!), a conference centre and use of a fitness centre. Nothing of any use to the majority of people. Spoke to the manager when I received my final bill of $126 for these facilities and she told me it was basically "tough luck" ( I hadn't been aware of the extra payments when I booked!)
- No fridge, no kettle/coffee maker... fortunately I took my own travel kettle, but had to chill my milk by filling up the sink with cold water. 
-Building work outside- the hotel must have been aware of this, but didn't make me aware. 
Cleanliness- towels on arrival were stained. I spoke to the cleaner the next morning (I was on my own so could use other towels and it was quite late by the time I had arrived) she gave me clean towels. Unfortunately I was then again left stained towels a couple of days later. The rails in the bathroom were dirty and I made the mistake of looking behind the mirror in the bathroom! 🤢

Check out hotels that don't charge facilities when you check out (or if they do, they use this money for improvements) this is a very cheeky way of advertising a cheaper room rate and then making money back and hotels are being pulled up on this.

The hotel needs a lot of renovation, a lot of love and some new management to make it wonderful.

title: love the new yorker
text: a classic.  warm and fuzzy, new-york style.  tick tock diner is wonderful also <3  great rates, perfect location for any garment center professional, among others :)  love the authentic touches that remain.

title: Déçu
text:
Cet hôtel est très bien situé et je crois que que c'est le seul point positif.
L'hôtel manque d'ascenseurs l'attente est très longue le matin et le soir.
Il y a beaucoup d'étudiants d'élèves dans le hall l'hôtel est très bruyant.
Les chambres semblent ne pas être rafraichis depuis plus de 20-30 ans.
Il manque une bouilloire et machine café. 
La salle de bain est très vieille on se croirait un retour dans le passé.
Le petit déjeuner à TIK TOK est vraiment très décevant par la quantité et le service où le personnel n'est pas aimable.
Pensez à prévoir 5$ par bagage pour la consigne  qui est pour moi du vol car depuis quand on doit payer pour ce service sachant que la plupart des hôtels le proposent gratuitement. Sachant que la valise est juste gardée 3h. On paie suffisamment chère et en plus il faut payer pour ce service.

title: Highly recommended
text:
Fantastic hotel room. Being New York, I was expecting a small cramped room, this was not the case, our room was large with an area with a tea and coffee machine. The bathroom was small but adequate with bath robes. Our room was on the 7th floor and was quite, no street noise, although our room was not at the front. Staff were lovely, check in was friendly, Linda H  on check in was very welcoming and upgraded us. Concierge staff very helpful in assisting us to navigate the train system, giving us a map and advising us on the best way to get to where we wanted to go. On checkout the doorman arranged a taxi to the airport for us while we sat in the comfort of the hotel.  Beautiful comfortable foyer where I met a friend for coffee on the comfortable sofas. 
Great location easily accessible to all tourist attractions.  Very busy hotel, lots of groups of international students but the staff are well equipped to deal with this.  We have stayed in many hotels around the world and for a trip to New York, I would recommend the New Yorker.

title: 5 night stay with partner
text: Beds are very small. Upon arrival, the doormen were extremely friendly. However, reception staff were a little cold. Paid for hotel well in advance and were left with a bill of over $100 dollars on the morning of us leaving. For “services and fees”. Not satisfied with the behavior of certain staff.

title: Great location
text: Hotel is in a perfect location across from MSG and a few blocks from Times Square and the Empire State. Easily accessible to the subway, 2 minutes away. Great range of bars and restaurants nearby within the area of the hotel and Times Square is good walk away to access the bars and restaurants there. Could do with tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms but that would be my only negative from the trip.

title: Perfecto
text:
Todo estuvo de maravillas. Amé lo vintage del hotel. El personal muy, muy amable. 
No es un hotel moderno, si es eso lo que buscan, no lo encontrarán. Pero me encantó todo. 
La habitación muy cómoda y limpia. 
El baño es espacioso, antiguo. 
Tuve todo lo que se me ofreció al reservar. 
Excelente ubicación.

title: Great location, Great ambience.
text:
I've stayed at the New Yorker twice in a year, first with a travel group and this month with my daughter and 14 year old granddaughter.  The price was reasonable, the location is great, within walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, shopping, restaurants, without as much of the hustle and bustle.  Being close to Penn Station is really a plus also.
The subway is just so New York.  It's a good idea to study the lines and areas before you go because it can really be confusing.

title: Fabulous location and great hotel!
text: Great hotel in historical building. Needed somewhere close to Penn Station and this was awesome! Friendly staff and I felt super at ease as a solo traveler. Lots of eating opportunities nearby. Will definitely stay again!!

title: Flawless
